Reviews.Title: “Best Experience in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: MJBK4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well run. The staff makes you feel like they are happy to have you from the moment you arrive. The rooms and grounds are very nice. My only complaint is that the pool bar/restaurant closed much earlier than they have posted and twice I walked out to find it shut though the front desk staff said it was still open. The food was excellent - every meal I had. Highly recommend this hotel when traveling to Orlando, which is a destination I don't usually enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service, people, property!”
Reviews.Author: budgetraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights here---and my husband and I were both so impressed with the quality of the staff, the incredible facilities, food...amazing. They had trouble upgrading us with our points, and were kind enough to upgrade us to a suite....just amazing! If you can splurge, go for the lounge level. This was the best lounge staff and food, facility we have seen anywhere, and it was not crowded at all! We loved every minute. Thank you Ritz Carlton...we are now spoiled for life!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: frenchyBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton has very friendly staff, from front desk to grounds people, all will greet you when passing by. Shame some of the guests are not as polite! A smile and a please is not that hard ! Grounds are just beautiful, gardens, lakes, birds.. Great rooms, Even better beds and pillows, very quiet rooms, well appointed, apart from having to pay for wi-fi to connect in your room. It is a great place to stay. A bit far from all the attractions which limit the choice of restaurants unless you are prepared to catch a town car everywhere. If you have a hire car, it would be perfect. A little piece of serenity in a busy part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: JudyPoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with my daughter-in-law while she attended a conference. My job was to take care of my 19month old granddaughter, Mallory. And what fun we had! The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. Even the waiter in the fancy restaurant was extra friendly and understanding . The room was set up in advance with a crib and amenities for our toddler. The grounds are beautiful with fragrant flowers and so well kept. We enjoyed our view from the balcony overlooking the pool side of the building. It was convenient to walk between the two hotels and be able to charge payment to our room in both places as well as use both facilities. A great place and I saw no one complaining...not once!

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Brockxerox
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Quiet out of the way for pure relaxation. The pool and Spa are world class.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel at Disney”
Reviews.Author: CCGrandma
Reviews.Content: We ended the last few days of our trip to Orlando with our daughters family with a stay at the Ritz and were so happy we made this decision. As usual, the lobby was so beautiful and the room was very nice. We were a little disappointed with the few from our balcony which was described as a lake view but it is a tiny man made lake that borders a parking lot. The rooms are not very large but very nicely decorated and very clean. We decided to have dinner off property as there are so many wonderful restaurants in the area. My husband loved the bar lounge area and greatly enjoyed his martinis as he waited for me to get dressed for dinner. All in all we would highly recommend the Ritz as it is away from all the buzz of Disney but still close enough with the available shuttle service. It is a lovely hotel and by the way, it is next to a very nice Marriott that has a huge water slide pool area for families with children that guests of the Ritz may use as well.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from our 2nd stay -- love this place so much!!”
Reviews.Author: travel141
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton Grande Lakes is in a class of its own. We are pretty discerning travelers and this particular property is a stand-out in so many ways. The grounds are beautiful. The walking paths around the lake are great for both fitness and wildlife watching. I love the little docks with benches -- a great place to end the day with a cocktail in hand. The pool is gorgeous -- probably one of my favorite hotel pools ever. We had a cabana for one day and it was a worthwhile splurge. The inside of the hotel is just as nice, with an inviting lobby and well-appointed rooms. The service was excellent in just about every way. There is a difference between being polite and being friendly, and I felt that every staff member we encountered was truly friendly, genuine, and helpful. We never felt like "just another guest." This makes a HUGE difference. The food was truly great. Over the course of our 5 day stay, we ate most of our meals on the property and every one of them was delicious. We were fortunate to have a club level room, and I can't recommend this enough. This club lounge was unlike any other we've experienced. Wonderful presentations of food, switched out every couple of hours, combined with surprisingly attentive service and a relaxing atmosphere -- it was amazing. There was a separate area for kids with a TV, books, games, toys, a flat screen TV, and kid-oriented food. Our daughter loved this. One issue I must mention is that when we arrived there was a massive convention happening for the restaurant chain Texas Roadhouse. The hotel had been temporarily "re-decorated" with items relating to the convention and there were approximately 500 Texas Roadhouse employees staying at the hotel. Fortunately for us, the convention ended on the 2nd day of our stay so we weren't particularly inconvenienced by this, but I can't imagine we would have enjoyed ourselves as much if this was going on the entire time. When we arrived, they were doing relay races and obstacles courses out on the lawn all day. This involved constant shouting & singing into a megaphone. This could be heard from the pool area as well as our own room on the 14th floor. I would not have expected an event like this to be held at a property of this caliber. It just didn't fit, and for the short time that we overlapped with it, it was very distracting. I hope the hotel reconsiders events like this in the future because it does unfairly change the experience for every other guest staying at the hotel during that time. That aside, this is a truly amazing hotel. Our first stay (2 years ago) was very short and I was concerned that this 2nd stay might not live up to my expectations. But it did and it exceeded them in many areas. I understand that it is a 15-20 minute drive to many area attractions and some people would rather stay "on property" at places like Disney and Universal. I would rather spend a couple extra minutes getting to the park and then have a peaceful haven to return to at the end of the day when you're tired, cranky, just want to get away from it all. We really look forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “good service, crowded pool”
Reviews.Author: Wasylocha
Reviews.Content: recently stayed for 3 nights with our two teenage children as part of a two centre holiday to florida. The hotel itself is very large and is also part of the even bigger marriot which it adjoins. On check in we were advised that we had booked the Marriott not as we thought the Ritz Carlton which is apparantly not an uncommon error and whilst we had to pay extra to stay at the Ritz, we felt the problem was well handled by check in. The rooms are of a good standard with good bathrooms and showers and the day rooms are generous. The exterior of the hotel is like a large apartment block and not very attractive. Wifi is available free in the common areas downstair but an extra (how annoying) anywhere else. Breakfast is buffet style for a fixed fee or if you are on a B&B package and is very generous with a wide variety. its an extra if you order off the a la carte. Be warned that after 930, the restaurant gets very busy and waiting time of 30 minutes is not uncommon The hotel is on a huge site and as a result you must either have a car (valet parking payable per day) or be prepared to taxi anywhere outside the resort. Town cars are on standby outside reception at all time but be prepared for a 17usd fare to internaitonal drive or 29usd fare wetnwild or universal. My main negative would be that considering the ample availability of land, the pool area is just too small for this size of hotel. Its a bit like a zoo with all the children with no adults pool (the pool is only 3ft deep) and sunbeds crammed beside each other ... this isnt good enough for a 5 star hotel even though its a family resort. Then poolside restaurant / bar is good with a reasonable choice and a special commendation to the bar in the main hotel which is small but excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went out of their way to make our stay perfect”
Reviews.Author: TS39
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little earlier than normal check in time and we're shown to the suite we'd booked. It didn't have 2 double beds which we had requested so the kids could sleep in one bed, mum & dad in the other. So what did they do? Gave us the twin interconnecting room next door in addition to our suite for the duration of our stay at no extra charge. Ok, so we were paying $800+ per night but they didn't have to do that for us. Couple of days later we asked if they could supply a DVD player for the bedroom. It turns out they were at 100% occupancy and couldn't lay their hands on a spare DVD player, so they gave us a $100 credit in case we wanted to buy one ....and free movies on demand for the duration. I honestly felt it was their mission to make every gues feel that their expectations had been exceeded. Eric, the front desk manager is a superstar!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Crusader1427
Reviews.Content: We found our rooms very wonderful and the staff very attentive, caring and helpful. The layout and spaciousness of the hotel are something to behold. The pool is nice too. Of course prices are high but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Wallet”
Reviews.Author: LewisMapp
Reviews.Content: Very inviting upon arrival but, be aware this hotel is out to take your money at every turn. Rooms are dated for rates they charge , Came originally on Amex package, stayed extra day and was promised by Sarah Bohn, hotel credit and was told " you should have got it from amex " Spoke with Anthony Ullilo front desk mgr. He was very rude. They are on the prowl to look for anything to charge extra. Waldorf Astoria on Disney property is better property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Ritz Carlton Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ZenSwan77
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Club Lake View room while attending a conference. Check in was easy and quick for the Club floor. Room was spotless and housekeeping was always available and helpful with extras like towels etc. The grounds were beautiful and peaceful during early morning runs. Club lounge was well stocked and there were always Club staff replenishing/maintaing the area while I was there early morning and in the evening. Even though this is a fairly large busy hotel, was impressed with the calm and relaxing atmosphere in the public areas (inside and outside). Would most certainly come back for a leisure visit...lots a varied amenities like the pool/cabanas,spa and golf to enjoy in addition to the proximity to WDW (for those that prefer a break from 7/24 Disney).

Reviews.Title: “Club Floor Makes It Great”
Reviews.Author: mikedavis2008
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at the hotel. It is attached to a big JW Marriott and thought it would be overwhelming. Not the case at all. Both properties are very nice and the combination gives lots of options for eating, shopping. Big property great for walks. Not a golfer, but the course looked very nice. As is often the case, the RC club floor is amazing. It costs more, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: shelbyreneski
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful view of the pool from our room. The service here was unbelievable! Everyone was willing to help with anything you needed. We loved the pool area. We rented a cabana on one day and the pool staff took excellent care of us!! The food is delicious from the pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Spotty service ruined my holiday”
Reviews.Author: Ann M
Reviews.Content: When I booked the best rated hotel in Orlando for my visit with my son, I admit I had high expectations. When we arrived at the Ritz Carlton at 4:45 pm, the front desk staff kept my son and I waiting for over 20 minutes only to inform us that our room wasn't ready and could we wait an additional 20 minutes for my room to be ready. When I declined their request, it still took another 15 minutes for reception to get us keys to a room. I was disappointed again the following day when we returned to our room at 3:30 pm and our room had not been made up. I was able to track down housekeeeping and persuaded them to clean our room immediately. The following day at the pool, there was no attendant to help us with chairs or towels. I struggled with moving a large heavy umbrella and no one came forward to help. the only employee I saw at the pool was a waitress who came by our chairs at the end of the day, not to take an order, but to collect the menu that was on my side table. I was also surprised to note that there was no wifi offerred. I received no information about it during checkout nor was there any information provided in the room. My son was extremely disgusted that the television in our room did not operate properly. Engineering claimed that housekeeping would dislodge the wires, but this happened twice during our three night stay. I would have rated this hotel much lower, but the beds were comfortable and the towels in the room were soft and generously sized. Despite this, I don't plan on returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the room, loved the view of the pool & lake as we arrived with our 1 yr old grandson..only to find broken glass & empty”
Reviews.Author: Raymond Q
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, hotel & to rooms! Great service! Unfortunately we had an incident where our baby was in danger & my wife ended up cutting her fingers grabbing a broken wine glass stem as it was about to go in his mouth! After further research, there was ore ore broken glass & trash in corner by curtain & balcony door! Security was gracious & quick...however , mgmt was slow to respond! In the end it was great! We had to repack...but they moved us to a nicer room! Loved out stay & pool & golf course is beautiful! Food was great!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Grande Lakes/Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Star010
Reviews.Content: My husband had a convention/business trip at the Ritz Grande Lakes, so I tagged along. I was not disappointed. It is a huge complex with one half being run by the Ritz and the other half being a Marriott. You never have to go outside the building to go from one resort to the other. Both resorts have one whole side with balconied rooms that overlook the pools, the lake and parts of the golf course. While my husband was in meetings, I was able to get a kayak lesson in the lake area, enjoy the pools (I especially enjoyed the lazy river pool on the Marriott side) and walk the beautifully-manicured gardens on property. They even have an herb garden that is used by the culinary team that you can walk through; each plant is identified with a marker. The staff is extremely helpful and polite no matter where you are on the property. My husband is attending another conference there in a few days and I am very much looking forward to going back to Grande Lakes for some pampering and relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: fls114
Reviews.Content: I'm worried we've gotten travel spoiled. Unfortunately for the Ritz Grande Lakes, we just stayed at the Ritz Dove Mountain less than six months ago. We were at this property for one night on a business trip for my husband. The grounds are very nice and this is a large property. Amenities are shared with the JW. The hotel is a bit away from the major Orlando attractions, however, this may be appealing if you don't want to wait in traffic for 10 minutes to turn into your hotel parking lot. We had a double room which was very large. There was a balcony with some uncomfortable metal chairs. The beds were of course very comfortable. The bathroom was large with a double sink, toilet closet, separate shower and tub. The turndown service wasn't much. At other hotels, we've received waters and chocolate. Here we just had our beds turned down. The pool area was great. The pool was large and the staff was checking in frequently. There is water and fruit at the towel stand and a man comes around with fresh pineapple slices. Overall this was a really nice property, and if we hadn't just stayed at Dove Mountain, I'd have been more impressed. We didn't golf and didn't go to the spa so I can't evaluate those.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, some of the best service I've experienced”
Reviews.Author: ctwino
Reviews.Content: My family (wife + 3 kids) stayed here in February and we had a great experience. The best part was the service - I've stayed at Four Seasons and other Ritz properties so have experienced good service but this was near the top, if not at the top. Before we arrived Joanne at concierge helped set up transportation, a rental car for one day, and a few other things and every one was seamless. While we were there, the concierge overall was great, and when we asked where something was we were not given directions but personally escorted there (including a waiter who escorted us to the butterfly garden). My kids were treated very kindly and the food, while expensive, was great. we did the family plan that gave us two adjoining rooms and kids ate free with adults, which was a great deal. My mother-in-law joined us half way through, and I asked the front desk if they could put her on the same floor as us. turns out that there were no free regular rooms on our floor, so instead of just saying "sorry" they upgraded her to a suite for free on our floor (and didn't even tell us, she opened the door and was amazed!). Lots of little things that were helpful in addition to these added up to a great stay. I will happily recommend this property and will return myself.

Reviews.Title: “Very posh - small beds”
Reviews.Author: DrLogical
Reviews.Content: The Ritz lives up to its image. The hotel is beautiful, elegant and well polished - almost to the point of not being comfortable to hang around. Pool area and golf course are excellent (shared with JW marriott next door). I was a bit put off in that if you want a tube for your kids to swim the lazy river you have to buy it - first time I've run into that. Service was great and staff was helpful and polite. Two complaints: 1 - Self parking lot is very very far away and expensive 2 - The beds (and I am referring to doubles as I was there with my family) are very small - not only narrow but short. Not too bad if you have small children and get two rooms but adults in that bed are not comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: sks120n
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for a conference at neighboring JW Marriott. The front desk service was friendly and efficient and very accommodating with our requests to spend time at the pool after check out. The room was spacious, clean and nicely decorated with turquoise accents, a very comfortable chaise chair and a private balcony. The bathroom was clean and spacious as well with a separate shower and tub and a double sink vanity. The pool area was beautiful and well kept with clean lounge chairs and prompt towel service. Having another waiter for pool side drinks would have been nice and we probably would have had a few extra rounds had someone been there to ask more often. Probably a good thing though as the drinks were on average 12-14 dollars. The only down sides to this visit were the lack of staff in the bar and in the outdoor cafe. You would think the management would have anticipated extra traffic due to the numerous conferences and scheduled accordingly. Also, wanting to pay a visit to a nearby mall we asked for a cab. They said certainly and then showed us to a town car with a considerable price difference. While it's a great service to offer, a guest should be notified up front of the difference and not be put on the spot and feel pressured to use the town car. All in all, this is a great property, we enjoyed spending time at the pool and also highly recommend Norman's restaurant located on premises.

Reviews.Title: “Best Way to Visit Disney!!”
Reviews.Author: TucsonThree
Reviews.Content: We were here for a week in October. We have a 2 year old and 5 year old and the trip was all about Disney, but mom and dad enjoy staying at nice hotels and getting in some relaxation too. We found a great deal through American Airlines- our week cost us about the same as staying at the medium level Disney hotels. We did consider staying on the Disney property but we were so glad we did not. True to Ritz standards, the hotel is beautiful, comfortable and the service is awesome. The concierge spent a great deal of time helping me to plan our weeks activities, even making the reservations and doing grocery shopping for me so that our suite was stocked with food when we arrived. We spent time at the pool and the sister resort's pool- they have a lazy river and slide for the kids over there but the pool is more crowded and the food is not as good- but you can still charge things to your room there as well. We used the hotel shuttle and/or taxi cabs to get back and forth between hotel and resorts and we were soooo glad to have a quiet, calm place to come back to after the craziness of the Disney parks all day. We saw how loud and crowded the Disney hotels were as well and we were so happy we chose the Ritz. The spa is OK, not spectacular- a bit on the small size, but nice and relazing. We even had the hotel find us a babysitter one day so we could do spa appointments and have an early dinner. A perfect vacation for mom, dad and the kids!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks”
Reviews.Author: leeeds
Reviews.Content: Top quality hotel. A little on the expensive side, but you get what you pay for! Arrived at 13:00 and room King Bed room was not ready; we were offered a room with twin double beds which we refused - instead we preferred to wait, so without question or complaint we were offered free lunch in the Vineyard Grill. 1 hour later, our room was ready. Lovely room with very opulent furnishings. Dinner at Norman's; breakfast in Vineyard - all amazing food and superb service. 3 amazing days in this fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cjc57
Reviews.Content: Usually I am not a fan of large chain hotels but I definitly enjoyed my four day stay at this beautiful hotel and property. Outstanding service from the moment we arrived until we got in the cab back to the airport. We were warmly greeted and a when it was found out that we were celebrating an anniversary a dinner reservation was made and we were treated to a lovely evening filled with nice little surprises at the Vineyard Grill. Norman's the higher end restaurant was fully booked but our meal was very good at Vineyard Grill and the service was excellent. Our room was well appointed with a lovely lake and golf course view. The fitness facility was very well equipped and spotless. I signed up for one of the classes and ended up with a one on one trainer. The Golf Course is beautiful and gives you time to enjoy all the incredible wildlife in the area. I have a fairly high handicap but the forward tees took most of the trouble out of play so I could enjoy the round. Our caddie Greg was fabulous and made our rounds extra enjoyable. I come home with some excellent tips. Poolside service and food was good as was room service. The lounge was a great place to unwind at the end of the day. We were enjoying the music one evening so decided to have our dinner there. It was nicely served and very relaxing. With only four days we didn't leave the resort; it was too nice. If there much longer than a few days a car would be worth having as cab rides anywhere are quite pricy. Lots of families around but they all seemed to be well taken care of so I was never aware of unhappy children making a fuss and taking away from such a lovely resort. Would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A+ Food at Bleu, spacious, great relaxing space”
Reviews.Author: Sf903
Reviews.Content: It was probably in the middle of nowhere and I read it's a convention venue but boy is it pretty and relaxing if you're not here for work. 20 minutes from the main airport and not rampant with kids, although there is a kids play area. I don't have any so it's nice to not hear squealing! Friendly staff and helpful. The dinner in the ballroom also offered synchronized service but the food was just ok. Bleu is better and outside overlooking green and sunny.

Reviews.Title: “I felt pampered with all of the customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Shan143
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference but would defintely return for a personal stay. The rooms are great with nice views. The property is gorgeous...took me 30 minutes to run around the golf course. Every staff member was about customer service. The spa and fitness center are fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “We spent a perfect weekend at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Surfdiva8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights while he attended a conference. What a wonderful hotel! The staff was great. Every time I needed anything, there was a staff member available immediately to help me – and always with a smile. When I asked for directions to the spa, not only did they direct me, they walked me there personally. The décor of the hotel is understated – elegant without being stuffy. Our room, which had a small balcony overlooking the gardens was lovely and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was large, with two sinks, water closet, and separate tub and shower. I spent a lovely day at the spa and had a wonderful facial and massage topped off by a glass of champagne. A nice touch. The spa has all the amenities you would expect including a steam roof, café and private pool for spa guests only. We ate dinner at Norman’s and it was very, very good. We particularly enjoyed the shrimp stuffed with yucca appetizer and the grilled fish served on a bed of mango puree. All in all, a lovely weekend at a first rate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Comfort”
Reviews.Author: MATravelerBOS
Reviews.Content: First you have to get past the $4.00 for a can of soda from the room, $18 to self-park per day, and $24 for a 1/2 hour 4-wheel bike rental, and spotty, expensive wi-fi. If you can do all that, and I did, this place is great. The rooms were large, luxurious and impecabbly clean. The service by the pool was excellent. You are close enough to Disney and Universal to enjoy the parks if you want, but far enough away from the madness of the crowds to enjoy some down time. I've stayed at a number of hotel properties over the years through a combination of business and leisure travel, and the rates for this hotel relative to the first-class accomodations were a decent value. Very relaxing and very enjoyable. I look forward to my next stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oh No, Not Again”
Reviews.Author: LuxFirstTravel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Ritz in Orlando many times in the past and seem to constantly encounter problems with service, which tends to be erratic and slow. Calling the front desk or housekeeping is a task since it takes quite a while for the phone to be picked up. When you do reach someone, you are told it will be taken care of right away. That usually means an hour if you are lucky. The rooms and suites were recently renovated, but are out of character with the rest of the property. Albeit a bit worn in places, the suites pre-renovation, were more plush and better decorated. The renovated rooms are a touch too modern and spartan in the suites. The carpet is too light and already shows stains. AC units work sporadically and are too loud. The Ritz is one of the best places to stay in Orlando for couples, but we are beginning to doubt we can continue to put up with the problems we experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel annoying spa”
Reviews.Author: MTHSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip in a suite; great room, beautiful locations. I would give this hotel between 4 and 5 if it weren't for the annoying service at the spa. Specifically, they have a nasty habit of saying, "would 20% service charge be ok?" This well-known aggressive sales tactic (anchoring you at a high rate) belongs at a car dealership and not at a luxury hotel. The people paying before me were visibly uncomfortable with having this imposed on them; I lowered mine to 15%, which I think is a very good tip for good service, yet the look I received did not relate that, and I left feeling I had been a poor tipper. No way to treat guests at a luxury resort.

Reviews.Title: “Way more comfort than at home”
Reviews.Author: SaraDL
Reviews.Content: Attending a conference at the JW Marriott next door, I did some research online and found that the Ritz rooms were bigger and had balconies. The conference price was the same for both properties, so I treated myself to the Ritz. I have stayed at the JW before and it was very nice, but the Ritz is better. Front desk service is superb, rooms are very comfortable, very clean and spacious. The bathroom was huge, with bath and shower, and two sinks. Rooms were serviced twice daily so you never run out of fresh towels. I also ate at Norman's which was totally wonderful again. Weather was great too. They serve hot chocolate with marshmallows during the day in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Top shelf facility / very expensive 'extras'”
Reviews.Author: Kate3671
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights for a conference that was taking place at the Marriott next door and thought it was fabulous--the service and accommodations were both terrific. Unfortunately can't speak to the recreational facilities since I didn't have time to explore them, but it's a beautiful property. As others have mentioned, any 'extras' are unusually expensive compared with many other properties. Internet, delivery charges on room service, and taxi/car service were all high (I was especially surprised that I was charged >$20 each way to go to the pharmacy less than 1 mile from the property to get medicine I needed, but had little choice but to pay).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sally h
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was just perfect. Great food and service. Close enough to Disney without being on top of it.I would happily return here each time we visit Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Spa!”
Reviews.Author: GetBusyLivingNow
Reviews.Content: Visited here in December 2011 and truly enjoyed the hotel and especially the Spa. The rooms were very well appointed and comfortable. The grounds of the property (both inside and out) were very well taken care of. But it was the Spa that was the real treat! One of the best spas I've been to. Very nice lounge areas including a beautiful outdoor pool area reserved just for spa guests. Excellent amenities within the spa, too (e.g. teas, snacks). Didn't get a chance to try the Spa's cafe but its menu looked great. Spa staff was excellent and very attentive and friendly. I highly recommend this Spa if visiting Orlando and can't wait to have a reason to return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: dandkm88
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have had the opportunity to stay at the Ritz-Carlton in Orlando and both times have been terrific. The staff is impeccable, the facility is beautiful the food is fantastic, I could go on... This week, I participated in a small conference while my wife accompanied me at the meeting. The meeting facilities are top notch and my wife had a fantastic time spending a couple of days poolside and shopping. We will certainly be looking for an opportunity to return

Reviews.Title: “More like a Marriott than a Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: veritas08
Reviews.Content: Lovely property great amenities and facilities. Unfortunately service was decidely poor and additional charges, for example internet and parking, are more to be expected in city locations of lesser brands not in an upscale resort..

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property & staff”
Reviews.Author: travelinjep
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work meeting. The property is lovely. It is connected to the JW Marriott hotel and conference center. The staff are friendly and helpful. The fitness center is well-equipped and the spa (outdoor) pool is open to anyone from 6am-10am; after the spa opens at 10am you have to pay or have a spa treatment to use. I swam in it one morning; it was wonderfully heated and lovely. The regular outdoor pool at the property is nice also. The Vineyard Grill has a nice Sunday brunch and also excellent steak and seafood selections. The spa looked very nice but unfortunately I didn't have time to try.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gaunty43
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the Ritz-Carlton in orlando Grande Lakes. The hotel is huge, it's imposing structure along with the JW Marriot Next door are visible from miles around. you will definitely need a car if you are staying here otherwise you will spend a fortune on cabs. However, the staff are friendlythe rooms are excellent. The pools are fantastic and there is a very adequate golf course as well. I very much enjoyed walking around the lake and golf course and the food was excellent. I walked to The bar at the Marriont down the hallway, a long way down the hallway and the have an good sports bar serving fresh sushi which was delicious. They also havce excellent fire pit outside the bar areas so you can enjoy a drink under the stars, slome a cigar and meet new friends. The hotel itself is fairly near Universal studios and is not far from Disney either. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but expensive when you get there!”
Reviews.Author: RSP71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Orlando Grande Lakes as part of a business meeting, and so (to be fair) everything was covered by my company. That being said, if I was there on my own finances, I would have been pretty upset - 6 of us had a pretty average dinner, which came in at $700. The average bottle of wine in this place is more than $150! The actual hotel is great, the rooms are large and comfortable, the staff are attentive and helpful, the facilities are very good too. It's close to the attractions albeit, I never got the opportunity to visit them as I was there on business. To sum up - it is a great hotel, but just be aware that if you eat and drink there, you will be paying through the nose. If you want to get out and find somewhere different, you will have to get a cab or hire a car - you cannot get anywhere on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Ranger30269
Reviews.Content: Staff does not attempt to go above and beyond as all other Ritz Carltons typicaly do. They do not honor American Express Centurion program, which ruined my entire day. Phone calls to front desks should not take 12 rings to get answered. I did not know minors can sit at bar at night in the state of Florida. Bad choice of hotel. Definitely the worst experience i've had in all my many visits to Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Breath of Fresh Air in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: JBHAtlanta
Reviews.Content: You might think that staying away from the parks is a negative if you are traveling with children but it depends on if you are looking for a trip that leaves you feeling like you just worked for a week or if you want to leave Orlando feeling rested and pampered yet knowing that you fulfilled your children's idea of Orlando as well. The Ritz which is adjacent to the JW Marriott (also a wonderful property) has something for everyone at a level that you cannot possibly find at a park property. The staff remembers your name, the property is beautiful, they have a wonderful childrens camp for those evenings that you want a dinner alone, and the pool has the right mix of childrens activities and quiet areas if you are not there for a Disney vacation. The Spa is one of the best in the country. The facility sits between the Ritz and the Marriott and is quite large with every treatment imaginable. The restaurant at the spa is an unknown gem so even if you aren't using the spa, try it for lunch. The food is fresh and a pleasant change from normal vacation food. If your children need some extra fun, take them next door to the JW to the lazy river pool. You can use the JW facilities but they cannot use the pool at the Ritz. Children love the new Zip line and Rope Course. Although I detest buffets, the breakfast buffet at the Ritz is quite nice and offers items that I don't consider "typical buffet food". Worth a visit! Great if you have children. The Club Level is one of the nicest in the Ritz Chain along with the Club Levels at Cancun, San Francisco and Dallas. A definite must if you don't mind the upcharge. Although when you take into consideration the cost of a breakfast for a family of four, you are better off with the upcharge. Love this hotel, the service, the activities are plentiful, the food is fabulous and I highly recommend this rather than the standard Disney esque properties.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: kirklandgirl02
Reviews.Content: Everything was as should be in a five star place. Elegant interiors. Spacious and very clean rooms. Good beds, very nice breakfast. Lovely pool area with great service. Actually, the service was friendly, helpful and discreet throughout the entire hotel, just as should be. We loved our stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely first class.”
Reviews.Author: deniseacole
Reviews.Content: The name suggests it all: it's a five star, upmarket hotel that promises to deliver nothing but the best. The rooms are spacious, elegant, and not to mention, those oh-so-heavenly beds! Guests are provided with luxurious Bulgari toiletries and plush bath robes too. To top it all, the service was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “A vacation to remember”
Reviews.Author: Lysistrata79
Reviews.Content: We planned a last minute weekend vacation to orlando over christmas and were very fortuante to land an awesome deal at the ritz. The location was great, very close to all the theme parks and attractions. The property is beautiful, the rooms were luxurious, and the food was great. The staff, or should i say 'ladies and gentlemen' were very well informed of excellent service which truly made our stay special. They were very friendly and helpful. Be prepared to pay $24 per night for valet, and no free wifi. However its the ritz, what are u expecting? I highly recommend getting a package bc it is well worth it. Ours included daily breakfast and $50 per night resort credit that we used towards parking and a dinner. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Escape from the mundane”
Reviews.Author: Soprano1NewJersey
Reviews.Content: What a resort. We stayed over the 4th of July and watched the firework show over the lake from our balcony... WOW ! What a great time we had . The place is top shelf. Restaurants are great and pool is fantastic. A nice place to stay without all the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional - no request is too much at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nmclennan
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 4 nights at the Ritz Carlton at the end of our USA trip. It was a wonderful hotel to simply unwind and relax. From the moment we arrived, we were met by staff who were genuine, friendly, helpful and polite. All of our requests were met quickly and professionally. I almost thought of requesting something quite ridiculous, just to see if they could meet such a request. I am sure they could. We enjoyed the Club Lounge during our stay and we were looked after by some great people - most particularly, Giovanna. Giovanna always greeted us by name and consistently checked in with us to see if there was anything she could do for us. This service is second to none. Rooms and all common areas were exceptionally clean. The only negative we experienced was a rather surly Manager at Vineyard Grill for breakfast each morning. We can't recall seeing a smile on her face once, which really made her stand out amongst staff who were all warm and friendly. During out time in Florida, we also stayed at Bay Lake Towers and Hard Rock Hotel, both which served their purpose, but in terms of quality of hotel, services and staff you will not find a better hotel than the Ritz Carlton in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A winter wonderland...in sunny Orlando”
Reviews.Author: FloridaPeapod
Reviews.Content: We just finished yet another stay at the Ritz Carlton, Grande Lakes/Orlando resort. As always, the staff, food, and ambiance was 5 star. However, there did seem to be a few additions of which I wanted to make note for luxury travelers. It seems that the rooms have been slightly redecorated. I do not know if this is the case around the entire resort, but our room had some color scheme and accessory changes. It was all for the better. Additionally, in the past we have had to get two rooms because the suites only came with King bed options. However, we were able tot get a suite with two queens/doubles. This was wonderful because originally I was going to book two standard rooms but they could not guarantee connecting rooms due to the holiday. Normally, the Ritz would always accommodate such a request. However, seeing as we booked on Dec 24th for a stay starting on the 25th, this was understandable. The suite was meticulous, and house keeping was gracious and wonderful with our messes. Room service meals were excellent, as was the buffet at the Vineyard Grill. Oh, and the evening lounge French martini was one of the best I have ever had, and their cheese offerings were quite pleasant. I do wish they had larger lounge menu for late night snacking, but no big deal. Finally, they had a couple fantastic kid friendly items I must mention. They had a ballroom open daily each afternoon with two bounce houses as well as tables with games and crafts. This was a wonderful place for the kids to go and bounce their energy out after spending hours at theme park rides!! And most notably was the Gingerbread House Building Workshop. Not cheap - but truly wonderful. 150 dollars for up to 4 people - the kids wore chef hats and aprons and worked with a pastry chef to build a large and quite edible gingerbread house. They were built on a wooden platform and very candy treat was there for decorating and the icing flowed. It was magical. And part of the proceeds went to a local charity, which is superb. Well done yet again, GL Ritz!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves more than '5' rating”
Reviews.Author: DMLehman6
Reviews.Content: I not only had the pleasure of staying at the Ritz Carlton Orlando Grande Lakes on three separate occasions in the past year, but I was the Event Manager for a client conference held Nov 4-6 for 190 attendees. Room rates were entirely affordable for such a stellar property. This property impressed everyone - from the CEO to the company's VIP clients and partners. Rooms are large, recently freshened and every one of them has a balcony with a view of the pools, waterways, golf course and entrance to the Everglades. Ritz Carlton amenities, of course. But what really sets this property above others is the over-the-top service of the staff. EVERYONE greets you as if you own the place. The door staff, the desk staff, the cleaning staff, the coffee cart operator, restaurant staff - even gardeners on the grounds. It's a smoothly run hotel, very light and airy and has top-rated banquets. This property is adjacent a JW Marriott and they share a first-class Spa, which is popular even with local residents. I can't say enough about this hotel. The breakfast buffet in the Vineyard Grill is phenomenal. All of the breads and pastries are baked on premise - fresh fresh fresh! You can get a fresh omelet as well. International guests will be pleased by the wide variety of what's offered, no matter if you are expecting a Swedish, German, French, or English choice. Special dinner? Eat at Norman's. Yes, it's expensive, but worth it. We hosted 12 of our speakers - including one from Belgium, one from London, and one from Frankfurt - and they raved about the dinner the entire length of their stay. Meeting planners: This is the BEST event staff I've ever worked with in 15 years. It's only 15-20 min taxi from Orlando International Airport. I can't wait to return with my family, as there is a lot to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, much better value than high-end theme park hotels.”
Reviews.Author: LuxPlorer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, grounds, rooms. Delicious food, excellent service. Not cheap but much better value than high-end theme park hotels, e.g. Disney Grand Floridian (unless one is traveling with small children and the ability to go back and forth between theme park and hotel room during the day is really important).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashleywyatt
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of the most beautiful Ritz Carlton's in the USA. Food...incredible, we were there for Thanksgiving and ate at Norman's. The rooms are just lovely and they offer Bvlgari amenities. Pools were not heated...I was surprised. However, since we live on the ocean and have a pool, we will definitely be back as our stay was a dream.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, upscale accommodation that's kid friendly.”
Reviews.Author: KMG30
Reviews.Content: The Ritz offered the perfect balance of serene, resort-style living with a convenient location to Universal and Discovery Cove for my two young sons. PROS: It's the Ritz -- beautiful lobby, champagne welcome, ultra-clean rooms, plush bedding, and attentive service. It's for families who appreciate elegance without the stuffiness. Very kid friendly without going overboard. My boys enjoyed the "real" hot chocolate and marshmellows available in the silver urn in the lobby throughout our stay. The daily fish feeding at 1 p.m. that also attracted an 8-foot alligator for close viewing. (Yikes!) The beautifully landscaped lazy river pool at the adjacent JW Marriott. The Gingerbread house in the lobby. The turn down service that "tucked in" their stuffed animals brought from home with accompanying chocolates. CONS: I wanted to take my boys fishing without a guide, but signs posted everywhere state alligators and snakes are present near their wetlands. Shop attendant told us not to worry because they take out the large alligators out of the lake. Someone forgot to tell the 8-ft croc that story. Passed on the fishing. No one seemed to know when the attraction shuttles come by, so if you are thinking about staying here and using shuttles, it doesn't really flow smoothly. You'll need private transportation, which is readily available. The in-room safes are extremely small. Fortunately we had access to two safes with adjoining rooms, but it sure would be difficult to fit iPads, jewelry, money, etc. for two adults in one safe. Overall, it was one of the best hotel stays we've had as a family. TripAdvisor contributors, you rock! I chose the Ritz Grande Lakes from the overwhelming choice of Orlando hotels based on your recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Prettty darned nice for a conference but not quite up to other Ritz Carltons.”
Reviews.Author: MartyPuch
Reviews.Content: Four nights for a conference. On par with the adjacent JW Marriott; doesn't really feel like a Ritz. Would book personally if I got a good rate but it didn't blow me away.

Reviews.Title: “Superb with a few quibbles”
Reviews.Author: JiminVirginia22305
Reviews.Content: My wife, two teen age daughters and I stayed here for the girls' dance competition in December.We were booked at the JW Marriott but were upgraded to the Ritz due to overbooking. The Ritz is superb. Service is gracious and attentive. the grounds are spectacular, the property is clean and well kept, the room was quiet, comfortable and very well equipped. The Ritz and the Marriott share the same grounds and facilities so we made use of the pools and restaurants on both. A few minor issues: Self parking is $16 a day;this was waived with our upgrade but it seems exorbitant for a suburban hotel. There is NO excuse for charging $10 a day for wifi. Even McDonalds provides free wifi. Hotel restaurants (at both hotels) were excellent, very good food, good service, but overpriced. I know, it's the Ritz and it's Orlando but if you have a car there are multiple decent locations off site. All in all, a good stay- pricey but worth it. dn IN Decmber

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place to stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: jcuvafan
Reviews.Content: The attentive service and consideration, luxurious surroundings, and great food make the Ritz-Carlton Grande Lakes my favorite place to stay in Orlando. For those of us traveling without kids, it's nice to be near Disney and not have to worry about being inundated with rowdy adolescents 24/7. That isn't to say that children aren't there, because they are and there is plenty for them to do, but it is still a nice getaway for adults. My favorite room is saved in the network and is available when I call. The food on both the JW and Ritz side is really tasty. My favorite is the blue crab salad at the spa cafe. The smoothies there are also a great treat. The views are great, the walking paths are fun, and the pool is the perfect way to spend some downtime. What really makes the Ritz stand out for me is the service. From the bellmen to the front desk staff, to those in room service and everywhere in between, you every request will be met with a smile, a can do attitude, and of course it's always "their pleasure".

Reviews.Title: “An Orlando Treat”
Reviews.Author: cmac1618
Reviews.Content: This is a truely first class hotel. Everything about it is fabulous from check in to check out. Room service was beautifully done and actually delicious. The bed was so comfortable with plenty of good pillows. An absolute treat - yet at a reasonable price. And the staff is amazing -very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and serenity, while convenient to WDW activity”
Reviews.Author: ActiveTraveler1
Reviews.Content: We checked in to this hotel after attending a conference elsewhere in FL. It is by far and away one of the most beautiful Ritz Carlton's in the US. When you are there, you feel like you are 'off the beaten path', away from the sometimes craziness of Walt Disney World and the other parks for which Orlando is known. However, a 10-15 minute drive will take you to the attraction of your choice. The hotel's lobby is beautiful, spa and fitness center is well appointed (the fitness center rivals a typical separate 'full service' club) and the food was excellent. We only ate at their casual restaurant, but it was quite good. Meanwhile, many of our 'meals' were courtesy of the rather extensive food offerings on the Club Level. At some R-C's, the Club Level may not be worth it. However, I would highly recommend paying the extra $ and booking a stay with Club Level access. Besides the food and service, the concierges that staff the Club room are a wealth of information and very helpful. As the hotel is in Orlando, you will find many more kids at this R-C than others. But, any unnecessary noise seemed to be less noticed in such a beautiful environment. (Besides, most families would probably want more economical accommodations, closer to Walt Disney World.) Finally, our room was top quality and had a beautiful view of the golf course, pool and waterway that runs through the property. The hotel is adjacent to another Marriott, Inc., property, the JW Marriott. Although the lobby looked beautiful there, if given a choice, I do not think you would be disappointed with the RC. We recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: alwaystraveling74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in Orlando as part of a conference group in early November. The conference was actually at the JW Marriott next door, but because there was overflow I was given a room at the Ritz. It was amazing! The pool area (with it's fountain/water features) is so beautiful and relaxing. My friend and I ordered salads and laid out for a bit, and both ended up falling asleep! The rooms were tastefully decorated, and the bathrooms are huge and especially perfect for two people traveling together. The service was great as well, the front desk person who checked us in walked with us to the elevator, and then gave us chilled bottles of water when we were checking out. It's an amazing place (very relaxing, especially for Orlando which can be a little crazy) and I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property!”
Reviews.Author: powercarsearch
Reviews.Content: Room was beautiful! Lobby was extraodianry. Upgraded room as an Amex cardholder. Pool was wonderful and relaxing. Every person on staff was welcoming and happy to accomodate any need we had. 1st time at a Ritz, but it definitely won't be the last. Breakfasts buffet was good. Our Amex plan included 2 free buffets per room so our family got the breakfast buffet for free. Otherwise it would have been $115 breakfast. I don't think the buffet was worth paying $115 but it was definitely worth the $20 tip we left our server each day. Feather bed was not great, just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the JW Marriott connected next door”
Reviews.Author: Nikki M
Reviews.Content: Within the same week I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for business (2 nights) and later, the JW Marriott (1 night) for pleasure. I would choose the Ritz over JW Marriott based on the quality of the rooms, the beds, and the amenities. However, they are both very nice hotels and the grounds are immaculate. The restaurants vary in quality (and service speed), but in general I think the Ritz has better food / chefs. The spa is very nice as well (although pricey) - if you do the spa, be sure to build in extra time to enjoy the whirpool, saunce, steam room, relaxation areas (inside and outside), and snacks/drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise among the Tackiness of Theme Parks”
Reviews.Author: FromToronto2011
Reviews.Content: The service of everyone from the front desk to the chambermaid to the waiters know how to make a guest welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Trust the reviews!! The hotel is superb!!”
Reviews.Author: Shpaki
Reviews.Content: WOW! I loved the hotel! Awesome valet parking- 1st time used it in the US! Very helpful reception. Breakfast - amazing! Loved it - nice selection! and if you like swwets and pastry...) Watermelon juice great! The swimming pool is very pretty! The room was called deluxed - but is was a standard room it think, but nice beds and pillows) If you have any problems - contact me Young Carter - he was absolutely amazing! thanks to him! and its only 7 mn drive from the convention center and 20 min to disneyland resorts!

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ellotravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and really enjoyed my stay. The service, food and rooms were great. We had a nice view of the pool. I liked being close enough to the attractions but not right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...”
Reviews.Author: labrt2004
Reviews.Content: After staying at a Ritz-Carlton for the first time, I now completely understand why they are legendary. The level of service and professionalism is mind-boggling. Yes, it is exactly as the rumors say: staff will address you by name, bend over backward to make you happy, and make you feel like royalty. It starts from the moment you check in, when they offer you a bottle of water at the counter. When I asked them whether there was any place where I could buy an Orlando paper for my father (they delivered only the WSJ and USA Today to the rooms), they offered to get it for me and have it sent to my room. I expected to see something appear on my bill for this little service, but it was complimentary. Even though the Ritz has an old money, staid kind of reputation, I didn't feel out of place when I was there. They really seem happy when you ask them for things, which means that you don't feel awful making an extra request or two. Everyone, from the bell hops to the concierge to the spa and restaurant staff were just amazing--quiet, efficient, no nonsense kind of service that makes you wonder how much more functional the world could be if everyone adhered to such standards. As for creature comforts, well, this hotel was just full of them! The sheets, robes, and towels were the sink-into-them-and-sigh kind of soft. I was a great fan of the little slippers they give you in the room, and I admit to taking home a pair as a souvenir, though I thought I'd long moved past the steal stuff from hotels stage of my life. I was a bit awed by the amount of marble in the bathroom, but it's the Ritz, so I guess it's only to be expected. Housekeeping was top notch, as was turn down service (yay little chocolates). Rooms weren't huge, but they were comfortable and scrupulously clean. Loved the spa--though I'm not quite sure why they get to be #7 in the nation from Conde Nast Traveler. It was a good spa, but I think I've been to other equally impressive spas, like the Omni Bedford Springs.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler125
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for a business conference. From the moment I arrived, the service was exceptional. I was greeted by the warm and friendly staff when I checked in, and after picking up a package that was waiting for me at the concierge desk, one of the concierge helped me with the elevator and escorted me up to my floor because my hands were full. My room was clean and comfortable and had a balcony view of the garden and golf course. I ordered room service my first night at the hotel and enjoyed several meals while at the conference, and the food and service didn't disappoint. I don't think I've had better hotel coffee anywhere! Possibly my favourite memory from my stay was the turn-down service - a small touch, but everything is in the details. I would highly recommend staying here for business or pleasure. Just one word of caution: if you are planning on using in-room internet access, there is a $9.95 charge for every 24 hour period.

Reviews.Title: “"A wonderfully civilised place to stay if you are visiting the theme parks..."”
Reviews.Author: Voyager212
Reviews.Content: The rooms and decor are all you would expect of a Ritz Carlton property. Good bedrooms. We had 2 connecting deluxe rooms which gave us plenty of space for a family. Good room service. Staff are very good. Good breakfast - not the best buffet breakfast in the world, but covers most of the things you need. One nice touch was "snack packs" (eg. little bags of granola) for you to take away and munch on during the day. If you are visiting the theme parks (as we were) and don't want to stay in an on-resort hotel, then this is a great choice. You can leave the crowds behind and come back to your very civilised hideaway. It is very close to all the parks. It is also good value. They had very nice touches for the children, including a RC wristband which enabled them to go and get a little tub of ice cream from the front desk whenever they wanted. The reasons why it did not get 5* from us are threefold. First, although there is a decent enough pool, the hotel seemed to have little atmosphere. It seems as if it does not quite know what to be - business/conference hotel, resort hotel etc. This is reflected in the second reason, which is the restaurants. We found the dining options a bit limited, although you can easily walk to the neighbouring Marriot which adds a couple of options. We had mixed experiences at the Vineyard grill. However, I must report that after we were not very happy with the food, the F&B manager pulled out all the stops the following night and everything was perfect. That reflects the quality of staff which you would expect at a Ritz Carlton. Finally, they charged us $25 a day to park our car! Admittedly that was for valet parking, but they still charged something like $15 or $18 a day to park it yourself in a car park near the hotel. I am happy to pay for parking at a hotel in Manhattan or the middle of Paris, but not in the middle of Florida. Unbelievable. They should just stick $15 on to the room rate and save a lot of aggravation. We did not play golf, but the course looked beautifully kept. All in all we had a great stay. Late August was a fantastic time to go to Orlando as there were no queues at all in the theme parks, and the weather was great (apart from one late afternoon downpour). We did not find it too hot or humid at all.

Reviews.Title: “Give me something...”
Reviews.Author: CliveWoodrow
Reviews.Content: To complain about, but after 4 days at a conference, I pleased to say they did a flawless job. My biggest impression was from the great staff. Everyone was welcoming and service oriented. Every staff member wanted to help and provide that extra level of service. Ate at the lobby bar, Normans, Vineyard grill and had two 500 person conference lunches and every meal was suburb. Wonderful pool, again the staff made sure my family was comfy on the lounge with the extra towels. Room was richly appointed and super clean. Turndown service with chocolate. Ok, one item, don't nickel and dime me ($9.95 a day) on wireless in the room. Add it on to the nightly room charge, we won't notice. Again, the folks at the Ritz did a great great job. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: brentwoodmom56
Reviews.Content: Service was great at the Ritz -- including the front desk, room service, pool attendants and the wait staff. They all went out of their way to make sure your needs were met. The hotel is beautiful and the pool was my favorite. I had a room over-looking the lake and I enjoyed watching what I thought was a gator swim around. Can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A WOW venue”
Reviews.Author: betty313
Reviews.Content: This is quite possibly the best all-around hotel experience this frequent traveler has ever had. The keen attention to customer service and comfort by each and every member of the hotel staff with whom I came in contact during my four-day stay was worth noting. The staff is simply there to “serve”. From the meeting rooms, to the hallways, to the individual bed and bathrooms, cleanliness with crisp, clean linens and upholstery was amazing. The view of the pool from the spacious room (as well as the private balcony) was refreshing. Buffet-served food for our large group was excellent. The Spa facilities, personnel and services were top-shelf, and the golf course well maintained. The only room for improvement in this facility is to suggest that the restrooms closest to the meeting rooms were absolutely freezing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: private1_90732
Reviews.Content: Booked via AMEX website, all details correct upon check in. Valet parking was prompt and courteous as was luggage delivery to room. Room had great view, was well equipped but no hairdryer in bathroom that Housekeeping promptly corrected by bringing a new one. Restaurant had great selection of food, were very flexible in meeting needs of kids and service was excellent. Check out was correct, fast and professional. No complaints. No time for golf. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: saltwaterTN
Reviews.Content: Its the Ritz all you expect and more. location is good golf was a ok course not the best but above average. Pool was nice spa was great

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem with Surprises”
Reviews.Author: DemandingGuest
Reviews.Content: This Ritz is a bit away from the attractions, but an absolute treasure. The price is usually less than staying at a Disney resort, but you get so much more QUALITY family time. There is a paved walkway around the lake behind the hotel, and in the lake we saw a variety of birds and an alligator. Follow the path around and you will cross over to the golf pro shop where you can book a canoe tour down the creek. Far from the fake Disney experiences, the canoe creek tour offers a taste of old Florida's natural beauty. The creek is a preserve where birds congregate in the winter and year round wildlife resides in the summer. The hotel offers a chance to do what most tourists never find the time to do; explore the natural beauty Florida has to offer. And it does it from a luxurious starting point.

Reviews.Title: “great golf”
Reviews.Author: simpleblueprint
Reviews.Content: stayed here one night before heading up to go diving. the course was good. Our room was very large and the breakfast was great. stayed prior to 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a Ritz Carlton Should Be”
Reviews.Author: bravarino
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of my high expectations for a Ritz Carlton. The room was spacious and very comfortable with all the high-end amenities I expected. I don't golf, but the pool area was lovely and the spa had a very full range of services. The things that stood out a bit at this hotel were, the very excellent food, the live music at the bar in the evening, and the graciousness of virtually every single staff person with whom I had contact. From the front desk, to the waitress at the pool side restaurant, everyone was very professional and conscientious without being fawning or too familiar. I somehow managed to leave a pair of eyeglasses behind in my room after I checked out. I contacted the hotel after I got home. The glasses were located promptly and sent to me immediately (even with tracking information) at no cost and with a very polite "Thank you for staying with us" note. If you want some luxury and to know you will be well taken care of, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Service is top notch- hotel beautiful too!”
Reviews.Author: tofubeast
Reviews.Content: From the moment you pull up your car to the lobby area, all the staff members have a smile on their face. Check in was a breeze. There are greeters in the lobby who assist you with questions etc, until you are met by a bellhop. The newly redone rooms are an improvement from last year (which were nice as well) with lovely shades of tan and blue. We stayed there for a recent large conference, and even with so many people, we could feel the staff were attentive. The pools (you can also enjoy the grounds at the other hotel on the resort) are gorgeous. The one at the Ritz is more for quiet-time relaxing, the other pool has a lazy river. There are also wonderful opportunities for dining, some cheaper than others of course. However, if you venture off property, there are plenty of more reasonable restaurants etc. We loved our stay again at the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Reumann
Reviews.Content: Typical of Ritz Carlton hotels, this one is no different. The service is great and the rooms are very well appointed. The fact that they charge for internet service considering the price of the rooms is crazy. If there is one negative besides the internet issue, it is the fact that the hotel is not near the attractions like Walt Disney World but it does have a golf course on property.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty at the Ritz Grande Lakes Florida.”
Reviews.Author: Pairadocs2
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay in the past two months and both times have been equally relaxing and enjoyable. I suggest the special occasions package which includes a room upgrade to lake view, champagne, amazing chocolate covered strawberries, rose petals on your bed and breakfast which you must try. The food is exceptional and the offerings tremendous. The staff is extremely accomodating and the rooms recently updated. Muted colors, pillow top beds and cleanliness are only part of the ambiance. Small touches like bottled water on your night stand are evidence of this hotels attention to detail. Take advantage of their sister property the JW Marriott. You can walk there in two minutes but please stop along the way and "smell the roses." The gardens are very well kept, including butterfly and vegetable gardens outside the Primo restaurant. The lazy river at the Marriott takes about 20 minutes to go around andoo is fun for the whole family. There is no doubt you will feel renewed and rested after your stay. Whether you are looking for a romantic get away or a family vacation the Ritz is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “What Every Hotel Should Aspire To!”
Reviews.Author: cstokely
Reviews.Content: What can I say except my entire stay was perfect from check-in to departure. Prompt, quick and courteous check-in. Clean and quiet room - comfortable beds, beautiful balcony, flat screen TV, I-pod docking station, mini-bar, work desk, wireless internet ($10/day), toiletries, plenty of hot water and water pressure, morning newspaper delivery, morning cleaning, evening turndown (with chocolates), fluffy robe and slippers, and everything else you might need. Room service was hot and quick. Little things like a personal (not recorded) and cheery wake up call was such a treat. I was there with a large group for a conference, and the entire event was handled so smoothly with excellent service, snacks and meals. I can't wait to go back to this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever!”
Reviews.Author: Asilcu
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Orlando and our first time traveling with our baby. They had the best service that I have ever seen. Very friendly and caring. The location is great too. Close to the amusement parks. Highly recommended. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: toddraber
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton, Orlando is a gorgeous location overlooking a golf course and numerous pools... it's also right next to the JW Marriott hotel which has a large pool and lazy river that you can use. The food and service was excellent. If you are looking for a relaxing get-away... this is the place to go! It's away from the busy downtown Orlando area, but still close enough if you need something...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: up2eleven
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 5 different hotels on our recent 3 week stay in Florida and the Ritz Carlton in Orlando was easily the best, but not the most expensive. The rooms had recently been refurbished (on the 4th floor) and were very tastefully decorated. The breakfast was great and the facilities were also excellent. We went to Disney each day but would have gladly stayed all day and used the pool, Spa and golf course. It was perfect for a family with 4 kids. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: USAbluegirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were allowed to check in upon arrival. We stayed in club level rooms. The offerings in the club lounge were pretty good for breakfast as they had hot and cold items and plenty to drink. Lunch was pretty good and filled up my husband and two teenagers. Dinner offerings were appetizers so we did have to go out but it was really nice to come back each evening and have the cordials and deserts. The club lounge was awesome for me and my husband and the kids. We played board games every day and watched movies in the side lounge off of the main club lounge. My kids said it was one of the best times they have had spending time as a family. the pool was ok. We liked the Marriott next door pool better and the lazy river and volley ball sand court they had. The spa was pretty good and priced the same as most Ritzs. My husband said the gym here was good although small. He never had to wait to use the weights or cardio equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Raving about the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: EmEs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton, during a conference and I cannot say enough good things about it. The room was stylish in blues and tans and soothing in its effect. The food is excellent and the rooms are clean enough to eat off of the floor. But what puts the Ritz above the rest is the service. It is simply phenomenal. You are treated like royalty by each person you interact with. There employees are tops!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: finance1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary at the Ritz in Orlando in August (2011). We received an upgraded view room which was spacious and nicely appointed. We enjoyed the outdoor grill for lunch and the downstairs restaurant for a pleasant breakfast. Everyone was pleasant and friendly (as is always the case at the Ritz brand) and we were able to relax in our room, at the pool and walking around the grounds. The complementary poolside fruit and water were also a nice touch. We also recieved much appreciated complimentary items in honor of our anniversary in our room and at breakfast. We went to a well respected Disney restaurant for dinner and had a very nice time, but given how nice the Ritz service was, we probably would have dined on property if we had to repeat! We tend to choose Ritz for special events because they truly know how to make you feel special. Interestingly, the rate, while not cheap, was lower than adjacent (and also very nice, but not nearly as special) JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for business in March 2011. It was absolutely beautiful, and I was in one of their newly renovated rooms. I was really impressed with the entire feel and look of the hotel! We had dinner at the sushi restaurant in the hotel (could have been in the one attached) and it was absolutely delicious! I would definitely stay here again if I had the chance. The only thing I do not suggest is the tap water - though that is not the hotel, that could be an Orlando thing.

Reviews.Title: “Relax the best way possible after "the amusement parks"”
Reviews.Author: BAPost
Reviews.Content: Great personal service. Superb rooms and very friendly services. Wonderfull pool and a great spa.

Reviews.Title: “best in the south”
Reviews.Author: Love_the_Planet
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular at Ritz. Same consistent service. Same high class food/rooms. Among my favorite hotel in the south. The golf course, pool, spa are superb..

Reviews.Title: “5 star in a truly affordable way”
Reviews.Author: Bostonian73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights/Sunday Arrival for 2 Adults and 1 Child with the final intention of having a relaxing stay but also a fantastic Disney adventure! and we did!! Let me start by saying that you do not have to be a "Millonarie" to stay at this Hotel! Trust me! We got a package with our Airlane line that included the plane tickets, and the hotel stay- did I say that breakfast was included? Just in breakfast we saved at least 78 dollars a day with gratuities included. We had an ealier check in, oh my! the front desk, door man, parking attendants, were all extremely courteous ! Even with the early check in, we had a room upgrade! Rooms, well is a 5 star hotel! the pool is amazing, warm water, kids friendly and the surroundings so clean and peaceful. Since the Ritz and the JW Marriot are interconnected, you can use the Marriot facilities as well..the pool- lazy river, fantastic (if you plan ahead and bring your own tube-you'll save 7 dollars, but if you are willing to spend it, you can bring it home)- pool towels provided, water and fruits provided, kids menu is way cheap (10 dollars) , drinks reasonable price, room service all night, and first class! I mean what can I say...I found that my vacation package exceeded my expectations for the price paid- close to Sea World and universal (you will need to rent a car) and reasonable to Disney parks. The in room fridge small and with expensive snacks -so we did go to a grocery store and got our own snacks and small beveredges. If you get 1 room, please note that the beds are double, unless you request a bigger room, but is a pretty good size room, with tube, shower, separate restroom, etc.. toiletries come in handy and first class. Valet parking at 25.00 per day, is worht it, as the regular parking is 18 and you will have to walk. Casual restaurante and formal restaurant, good reasonable prices- Overall, 5 star in an affordable way. The trick is, book thru their website or as a vacation package with an airlane, choose end of week arrival and also look for their packages promotions. You pay for the room-you dont pay per person-you need a car to move around-by snacks at a Publix, and enjoy first class without ripping your pockets-compared to other packages at inside Disney 3 star hotels, it pretty much comes closer to what it cost-its your choice., I will come back again and for sure will take advantage or their Spa! Hint: Their Spa prices are at least 30- 50 % lower is you go during the week-gratutities included.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Golf Service in Orlando by Far”
Reviews.Author: Kevin D
Reviews.Content: I have played in most golf courses in Orlando from the very best to the norm and i have to say that the Ritz Carlton without question has the worst service i have ever received the Employees were more interested in getting homes as they watched us clean our own clubs and told us why the pro shop and club house was closed because there was not enough buisness i would of expected more from such a brand that pride itself on the level of service

Reviews.Title: “Florida in August!”
Reviews.Author: Leontes500
Reviews.Content: I visited Orlando in early August in order to attend a wedding. The infrastructure is as one would expect at a Ritz-Carlton; the service was glossily American and strikingly superficial, but I was in Florida! There were a couple of glitches to do with the room, but they were resolved speedily. I dined at "Normans" the "fine dining" restaurant in the hotel and the ambience was lovely; however, the food was almost inedible. I couldn't be bothered to complain, as there was little point in doing so. Having left half of the tapas I'd ordered, two thirds of the salad and 90% of the main course, the very friendly waiter asked if I wanted a "box". WHY! As I left the restaurant bemused and amused rather than cross, the restaurant manager asked if all had been good for me: I replied that it had been one of the most horrid meals I'd ever eaten and he smiled and told me to "enjoy the rest of my day"!!! I laughed so much that it was almost worth the $150 dollars for the experience! If I ever have to return to Orlando, I would stay at the Ritz-Carlton, but dine elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, can't wait to go back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdtd0729
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for our 11 year wedding anniversary. The hotel is Beautiful, the room was clean and fresh, and the hotel staff took care of our every need.
