From the minute you walk in the doors you are treated with outstanding service. All the food was great, from the restaurants, the lounge, and room service. We told to Rosie who works in the lounge one evening, and two days later she remembered our Anniversary and sent us a bottle of champagne to our room. I couldn't believe she remembered. The spa, I highly recommend!!! On our last full day there we spent the whole day there. I had a facial, and a massage................... aaaaahhhhhhhh! there is a private pool which was just what we needed. Oh, and the banana peanut butter smoothie is to die for. so yummy. There is not enough i can say about this hotel. but the best word to describe is..... AMAZING!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel...can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: njbchluvr3
Reviews.Content: This Ritz lives up to the "Ritz" name. My family of 5 stayed during Easter week and although it was at capacity, the level of service remained in tact. Housekeeping was excellent- even at 2 a.m. when my 9 yr old got sick all over the bed! The staff went above and beyond what you would find at any other hotel. We primarily stay at Ritz Carltons and the Grande Lakes property is wonderful. I'm sure we will return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “For those who though family vacation and self indulges don't mix”
Reviews.Author: PegasoMex
Reviews.Content: If you are reading this, you are either a) attending a convention, and shouldn’t be looking into the Ritz unless is the official hotel b) spending your honeymoon with Mickey Mouse c) Taking your family vacations (my guess is 99%) If you are in situation “C”, let me share my 2 cents: I have stayed at different Marriot Vacation Hotels here in Orlando, I have come to some big conventions, and stayed in other Hotels (Swan and Dolphin, Doubletree, Peabody, etc.) but never tried the Ritz in Orlando. This year I came back for a family vacation, and thought of staying again at a Marriot Vacation property (good experiences). I thought of having different rooms for the kids, the kitchen for a fast breakfast, the evening family room, the washer and dryer. You know the story. Maybe just like myself, when you think Orlando, you think of a Villa. Lots of space and independence for all the family members. I couldn’t restrain myself (as usual) of trying to push the envelope for something a little better. I usually don’t travel on a predefined budget, but I try to get the most out of every dollar spent, regardless if it’s one or a thousand. So of course I browsed through the helpful reviews and paid attention to Floridays as number 1 selection. Big rooms and great reviews. No way to go wrong, but it did! Please review my comments, just check in Floridays under “terrible” reviews. http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g34515-d612781-r116043391-Floridays_Resort_Orlando-Orlando_Florida.html#CHECK_RATES_CONT Just to their benefit, the assistant manager, Lisa Robbins tried her best to make it up for me, but it was too late. Floridays might get top reviews, but they are classified as a 3 star resort, and that is what you get. My harsh comments are the same, but an A+ for Lisa and her effort to rescue the name of the property. Now, finally, my comments on the Ritz. In terms of facilities, if you have been to the different Ritz properties, they are very much alike, (like a rich aunt’s house: big, well kept and with very good taste), so they don’t need any description. What really matters is the people that work here. I’ve been to their L. Vegas’, Washington’s, Miami’s, Palm Beach’s, Bay area’s and so on. I’ve heard every single person gets 7 interviews before they are hired. It is clear they are all proud of working here, and it shows. I might have stayed more than 25 times and they still surprise me. I ended up here (still at the property), because I wanted to balance my previous experience at the 3 star hotel (a little mistake I did, since I took for granted that really great reviews only would apply to 4 or 5 star resorts), so I talked to the kids, and changed their “house” for a room. So far, everybody is as happy as a dolphin in a show. And yes, I will rather buy more cloths than send my kid's dirty ones to the laundry, and yes it is more expensive to eat here. Doesn’t matter. We love to feel at home and being taken care of. I called for special requirements the same day I moved in (7 nights after 3 in the Floridays, and 2 more pending at the RitzCarlton in Key Biscayne as a vacation of our vacation at the 1000 parks in Orlando) Tthey set up a small fridge, so the kids still have something to drink or chew at their leisure; the person who received me at the front desk, tried his best for the best available room, and so on. The pool at the JW Marriot next door is great for the kids and the property’s pool is great for an evening swim. The resort is not as close to Disney, but for those of us living in Mexico City, a 15 minute drive there means a couple of blocks in the traffic, so I don’t mind at all. Nothing replace the “it’s not in the menu, but the chef will make it for you”. One more. My 9 year old misplaced her penguin backpack with I Touch, DS, first sunglasses and all her treasures inside at check in, just to find out until the next day I was about to give my I told you so speech, when the Lost and Found brought the backpack, sweater and all to the front desk. Nothing missing! They not only saved me the replacement, but a few hours of stress with the little lady. (I am a single parent, so anything that contributes for my peace of mind is a blessing) I told them about my requirements for a bigger room and they offered a suite as soon as one is available as an upgrade (hasn’t happened yet, but it’s only my second night) So, if you are used to this chain, the Four Seasons and similar resorts, don’t hesitate and stay here. Forget about convenience and enjoy your vacation too. I’ve finally had a couple of decent meals after all the pizza in the parks. Do not sacrifice convenience for service. Make it a vacation you too will remember. Kudos for the staff at the Ritz Carlton in Orlando. This is where dreams really come true (for my kids and myself, of course).

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great experience with one challenge.”
Reviews.Author: dsenden
Reviews.Content: We had made reservations at the JW Marriott Grande Lakes. We arrived from the airport in a cab and had to unload all of our bags while multiple bellman stood and watched us. Not a good beginning. We stand in a line at the desk, and when my associate made it to the counter, she was informed that the hotel was oversold and would we be interested in an upgrade to the Ritz-Carlton. Absolutely! The desk agent at the JW was very engaging and personable and made the relocation that much easier to accept. They did have some problems transferring our reservations to the Ritz-Carlton as evidently, they don't have the same reservation system. After 10 minutes or so, we were set to be moved. We go back out to the bell stand for the ride to the Ritz-Carlton. When asked how that would happen, he dismissively says "You can walk or take a taxi." It's July in Orlando, it's 100 degrees and 100% humidity and I wasn't about to walk 10 minutes to the next hotel. So I asked for the bell captain; he handled it flawlessly and got us there easily and quickly. It's a great lesson in empowerment for their associates. We arrive at the Ritz-Carlton and the welcome is perfect, truly could not be any better. Associates decended upon us to take our bags, welcome us, offer champagne, and usher us to the front desk - outstanding welcome experience. The check-in was swift and pleasant and the 5 diamond service levels were adhered to perfectly. The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed with all of the amenities one would expect. Balconies are comfortable. I had a disgusting experience with the shower cleanliness that unfortunately when unresolved for two days and three conversations with the front desk, including management. I finally cleaned the shower myself and had a face-to face meeting with the front desk manager, who apolgized profusely and offered compensation. I refused (not what I'm about) and asked that they just ensure my shower stayed clean the remainder of stay. It was. At one point, I returned to my guest room while it was being serviced by the housekeeper. She adhered well to the security protocol and made sure my key worked in the door before allowing me into the room. Great training from that angle. We entertained some clients at the Ritz-Carlton pool one afternoon and the staff there did an outstanding job. Jamie Lee is a great server and is to be commended. The pool attendant (name escapes me - young guy) also was very accommodating to our guests. We had lunch in the outdoor restaurant and the server was well trained, friendly and attentive. The bartender went out of his way and provided 5 diamond service. We also had the opportunity to eat at the Golf Club restaurant and again, the server was engaging, personable and provided a great dining experience. Overall, the hotel provides exactly what you'd expect from a Ritz-Carlton with 5 diamond service levels. With the distinct exception of the shower cleanliness challenge, it was an incredible stay and I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything done right”
Reviews.Author: Globalinvestor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a business convention. The hotel is beautiful and the room was great. Everything was up to the usual Ritz standards.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect. Hoping for a repeat next anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: BuddyDoogie
Reviews.Content: This resort is a relatively new concept where a J.W. Marriott is connected to a Ritz-Carlton with shared facilities, like a world class spa, golf course and more. It also means you have a wide choice of restaurants, lounges and shops. My husband took me here for our anniversary and he arranged for us to be on the concierge level and it was almost perfect. The only thing that could have made it better is if we had stayed longer than our two nights. The grounds are perfect, the room was a sea of aqua and crystal and so beautiful. The food in the lounge was outstanding and generous, there was live music in the lobby and the spa truly is perfection. I hope we can repeat this every year. Not far from Orlando Airport either.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mbt72
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice before, this time rooms had been renovated and are just beautiful. Pool area was perfect... fresh fruit and water poolside. Staff was professional and courteous, without hovering. You are given access to the JW lazy river, which was magnificent. Was truely an awesome stay!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury that is worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaPeapod
Reviews.Content: This Ritz, like most others, meets the high standard of service one should expect from the brand. We stay here a couple of times a year when we bring the kids to Orlando. The staff of a luxury hotel is not always attuned to the little ones, but the folks here are! The grounds are beautiful, although the location is not really "Disney" friendly. You will have to drive to get pretty much anywhere (20 minutes to Disney, universal, epcot, or downtown Orlando) although it is right near seaworld - our favorite destination. There are several great restaurants - and all are very good. The pool is beautiful, although it does not have all the bells and whistles. However, the JW Marriott is next door - attached - and you can use their pool with the lazy river etc. The spa, also shared with the Marriott is fantastic. I had the best facial of my life there - this citrus honey something scrub and wrap or something. Simply amazing. If you can afford it, splurge and get a room on the club floor (starting around 400 give or take) and the service ramps up even more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services.”
Reviews.Author: MK20110701
Reviews.Content: There are 5 star hotels and there are 5 star hotels WITH services, Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes is definitely the latter. Beautiful hotel, clean rooms and excellent services. Staff are all friendly and helpful. Our kids had fun at the pools (incl Marriott's lazy river pool). We very much enjoyed our stay there and will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Melwyjak
Reviews.Content: Fantastic 3-night stay with husband and 2 kids – this was a NO PARKS trip and all we wanted to do was enjoy friends and family and this was the perfect place. Lovely lobby, public areas. We had spacious 1-bed suite w/ balconies w/ great views from 6th floor. Big walk-in closet, 1.5 baths, long soaking tub, separate shower. Great HD pictures on TVs. Lots of channels and pay movie options. Housekeeping was excellent but didn't get to room until late one day. Very good room service dinners (note 18% gratuity included to all food/bev purchases onsite –saves trouble of adding tip : ) Orders were prompt and correct (although phone rings a long time). Fabulous breakfast buffet was included in our rate for two adults so we paid for kids’ buffet $10 each – fills you up until dinner. Dinner at Vineyard was okay. Avoid the beet salad. The crab cake and Caesar salads were average. Entrees good. The waiter was rude - guess he knew he was getting a tip, didn't care. Ritz pool is quiet and relaxing. The waitress was always there to take our orders. Beware birds will eat your food! Pool guys nice, lots of towels and complimentary cold water. Hot tub was luke warm though. Spa and golf looked great but we didn’t have time to enjoy. For $25 you can use spa pool w/ no kids if that's your thing. 5-min walk to JW for Lazy River, fun a couple of times around but it was crowded and dirty (timeshare uses too) w/ lots of partying adults/college kids consuming bevs in pool. JW lounge chairs need replacing. The lazy river is lazy slow. We met friends at the JW pool bar and were having a fine time until they closed at 5 pm due to non-existent weather concerns. Everyone was grumbling and unhappy because it was a beautiful Sat night! Great hotel experience on the whole. No more vacation clubs for me – don’t want to cook and do laundry when away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sheryllang
Reviews.Content: A quick holiday getaway turned out to be luxury at its best. After a quick drive from the airport we arrived in the middle of the night to the sight of an extraordinary hotel with gorgeous lighting and a beautiful series of fountains. The welcome we received at the front desk was first class - you wouldn't know it was the middle of the night as the Hotel had plenty of staff on hand to assist and greet us. From the moment we entered the room with the tiled foyer we couldn't have been happier - the decor was lovely and comfortable and the bathroom was spectacular. Dining was ideal - from an ample breakfast buffet to a casual lunch at the pool where we enjoyed a crab cake sandwich and jerked chicken sandwich that we both not consider personal favorites. Classic Ritz service abounds in this fabulous resort - a true five diamond experience.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed staying at the Ritz-Carlton Orlando Grand Lakes. The room was very spacious, had a beautiful view .”
Reviews.Author: Zophia55
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton had a very nice pool but next door was the JW Marriott pool that had a lazy river pool that you could also use. There was music, cafes for a quick bite and the pool was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service & Great Prices.”
Reviews.Author: 5startraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and the package deal we booked thru their website online was wonderful. Our $419 Exec Suite came with free valet, breakfast buffet and $50 credit every day. The food at the hotel restaurant (Vineyard) was wonderful and the service was excellent. The rooms were very clean and tasteful. I never saw the maid once, but our room was always cleaned complete with turn down service. The location was a bit far out for our needs, but the drive was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: TampaNewlywed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on a friend's recommendation. The room price was the same as at the JW Marriott, which is literally right next door. The value you get from the Ritz far surpasses any other hotel. One point to note, though, is that everything is more expensive at the Ritz. So if you are staying with a family, it may be cost-prohibitive to stay at the Ritz. We discovered this when our bill for lunch at the pool- one (delicious) Cuban sandwich and a bottle of white wine came to $90.00! We used our AAA membership to get a great price on the room. The package also included complimentary valet, free breakfast and a $25 resort credit. Our room was spacious and impecably clean. The only slight annoyance was the numerous calls and knocks at the door when we checked in to make sure everything was up to par. (we were contacted 3 times in the first hour of being there..a little overkill) Otherwise we absolutely enjoyed our stay. The grounds are beautiful and immaculate. There is a great running trail around the two hotel properties. The pool at the Ritz was beautiful and the staff at the pool and everywhere else were so courteous. We spent the second pool day at the JW Marriott to enjoy the lazy river. All in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennyBristolUK
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world and this, in our view is the best. We stayed in a club room. The Room was spacious, clean, you could ask for no more, the staff are incredible, nothing is too much trouble. The buffett breakfast is great, with a very good selection and the best omelettes!! The canapé's were stunning. We really could find no fault....well I suppose the wifi was a bit hit and miss. Stay here, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “In love with the ritz”
Reviews.Author: luxuryliker28
Reviews.Content: Amazing upgraded to suites it was gorgeous!!! Two toilets lots of rooms plush and luxury.. All requests honoured staff lovely.. Only faults few smears in my shower and blood on the floor of one communal loo but still an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “A great resort with a relaxed feel.”
Reviews.Author: phantom_49601
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week as part of a business meeting. The room was wonderful and the staff could be better. The restaurants had wonderful food and lunch on the patio was a very pleasant treat. Even while handling a group of about 1500 people the resort didn't feel crowded. The spa and staff make a visit a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Setting for the Most Important Day of My Life”
Reviews.Author: JazzyCazy
Reviews.Content: I've just celebrated my 1st anniversary having got married last year at The Ritz-Carlton Grandes Lakes and I realized I hadn't given my kudos where it is due! The Hotel gave us a superb package for our intimate destination wedding and they were a joy to work with throughout the entire process. We had our wedding in the gazebo and our reception dinner in Norman's and we spent our wedding night in one of their suites. The whole experience was flawless and I couldn't fault any of it. The resort is luxurious, and far from stuffy. The spa is incredible and is one of the best I've ever been to. The staff go out of their way for you are are incredibly helpful. The food at Norman's was superb. Overall our whole experience with the Ritz Carlton was unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite”
Reviews.Author: HinghamPonch
Reviews.Content: I agree with the fellow a few comments below...charging for Internet is chincey...and holding everyone hostage for $22/day parking is bush as well. The valet crew, however, is one of the best. I came away feeling a bit underwhelmed at this Ritz...maybe its because there were so many kids around. The place might be in need of a facelift, especially when compared to the adjacent JW Marriot. The pool area is nothing great compared to the multiple pools at the JW. The Grille restaurant crew for the overpriced breakfast every morning was overmatched and there was a 15-20 minute wait every morning to be seated. The Spa put on a hard sell multiple times during my message, which was pretty stressful and off-putting. On the positive, Normands restaurant, while expensive, was very nice with top notch atmosphere and service. In general, I think the best thing to do is avoid the entire Orlando area in general unless you're coming for cheap golf with the guys and you can stay somewhere thats cheap enough so you are not left disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Delivers!”
Reviews.Author: Chantal42
Reviews.Content: If the Ritz-Carlton Orlando was a city I would move there yesterday! And my children won't stop begging to go back! Everyone is lovely, everything is lovely, and hotel guests just FEEL lovely all the time. There are no oversights and no-one is too busy or important or too rushed for anyone! My youngest son has a new best friend - the most wonderful warm charming Bellman he insists on calling CAPTAIN! And my slightly older son has discovered one of Ritz's most magical ingredients ... as parents we thought this ingredient was pretty special too. Tavelling with young children is great, being able to enjoy most of what's on offer - kid and adult centred-activities, is perfect, but - unless you feel like schlepping along the nanny, family holidays usually mean keeping the kids happy. ENTER RITZ-KIDS! Husband and wife had adult time!!!!! This included one of the best meals we've ever shared, at Normans - on site at the Ritz. Pool-side cocktails and many superb spa treatments were enjoyed by both. All of the previously mentioned activities were stunning and available on the property. We even got to slob around reading the papers... okay junky tabloid magazines... okay emailing smugly about our holiday! This was not a dump and run kids joint. This was a "pleeeeeeeeze can I go to Ritz Kids' whine every morning for two weeks. Loving Hugs for and from an amazing team of girls and a magnificent tantrum on the day of our departure because "why can't I leave school and just go to Ritz Kids?" The Ritz-Kids got fed, played games (real and techno), made great friends, fed the fish, had Wii dance-offs (I saw this with my very own eyes!) and generally ran around discovering the beautiful Rits grounds. This hotel stay helped us to ALL have a proper perfect family holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: eal009
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located near Seaworld and Aquatica. JW Marriot is next to hotel and you can use their pool. Very nice and elegant hotel. Great place for kids too. Breakfast is very good and you can eat from buffet or a la carte. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charging for internet access leaves you feeling ripped off.”
Reviews.Author: Greatelk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in April. I was really surprised to see a luxury hotel charging for in room internet access. I had just come from the Mandarin Oriental in New York where I was not charged and regularly stay in Four Seasons where I am not charged. Most motels advertise free Wi Fi. It looked so mean and left me feeling exploited. It was one of those annoying things that spoiled what otherwise should have been a pleasant stay. I complained twice and on the second occasion the charge was removed. These rip off charges really are disgraceful in this day and age. After all the room rate is not exactly cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Sghoubrial
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the club level with 2 adjoining rooms .....fantastic service aesthetics was outstanding spa was great . The concierge was excellent we also had east access to Disney with courtesy car.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect. Almost.”
Reviews.Author: SteelCityCampbells
Reviews.Content: This stay was incredible--fantastic food, gorgeous views, beautiful interiors. My one complaint is that we had to wait, and wait, and wait for our room. We reserved our room a month in advance, the same time as the others in our party, but we were told upon check in that our room choice was not available, but to wait 10 minutes and we'd be called on our cell. Seventy--70!-- minutes later--while our friends were changed and poolside-- we enquired about our room at the front desk and got blank stares. When we finally got into our room and were ready to change for the pool, we had to call the front desk twice to ask where our bags were. Forty five minutes later, our bags were delivered. It didn't ruin our stay, but not what I would expect from the Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Million Stars!”
Reviews.Author: runrchicMn
Reviews.Content: This place is fabulous. The rooms are spotless, spacious, and inviting. The pools are incredible - bring an inner-tube for the lazy river. It is very close to Sea World. We enjoyed every minute of our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place.”
Reviews.Author: jshayden
Reviews.Content: As always, the Ritz Carlton Orlando never fails to provide great service. My only complaint is the dress code. When I eat lunch or breakfast in a nice hotel, I expect at least people to take off their baseball cap! Seems anything goes and I think that takes away from the Ritz Carlton experience. Oh well, still a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and very pricey”
Reviews.Author: detraveler_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a conference. The rooms are wonderful and the conference facilities are excellent. I'm not a big resort person so the place was not really my taste but everything was very clean and the service is excellent. The pool area can feel small and the music is really loud if you are trying to work or relax. The fitness center is nice and big but shared with the Marriott so it can get really crowded. Two things really bugged me. They have a dress code but don't have a smoking policy. One nasty cigar can wipe out the entire pool area. I would much rather see someone in shorts that are "too short" than be subjected to something I smell throughout the entire area. The other thing that really bugged me was check out was 11 and I wanted to change after my meeting for my flight home. I was told that I had to buy a day pass to the spa to change my clothes there. I have stayed in hotels that charged a day rate for the spa but have never been charged to change.

Reviews.Title: “Champagne Soirees!”
Reviews.Author: Zekebrenner
Reviews.Content: Final 3 nights of our 9-night Orlando trip were spent here. Our package included nightly bottles of Perrier-Jouet champagne, and chocolate-dipped strawberries. The kids enjoyed the chocoberries - but loved the champagne! Every night! (Ironically, I don't drink). (Also included buffet breakfast for 2 [which the kids ate], and valet parking. Price was very reasonable [but not cheap].) Anyway, evrything here is fantastic except, maybe, for the lazy river, which really is very very very lazy. A 10-minute drive, in different drections, to Mall at Millenia, and Premium Outlet Mall, neither of which lost money on us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lotuschic75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business. Fantastic hotel with exceptional service. My room was excellent and very comfortable. The hotel is connected to the Marriot via a conference center. Very convenient and well situated for doing business in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Repeated Unauthorized Charges to Credit Card by Hotel Management”
Reviews.Author: Rzang09
Reviews.Content: As an experienced business traveler, I've run into billing differences that are usually worked out quickly and professionally by even the most budget-oriented chain. In this case, however,the "upscale" Ritz/Marriott organization has both mis-utilized my credit card, thrown multiple roadblocks into what should have been a simple resolution, and when confronted with evidence of their abuse of my card, responded with additional charges to my account. I urge you with all strenuousness to avoid staying here and exposing your personal credit to these people. Following a one-night stay, I checked out of this hotel at 11:30AM on Feb 15th, providing payment to the front desk and receiving a receipt that was inclusive of all charges incurred. I cabbed to the airport and returned home. 2 days later, my credit card account showed a different amount than the one shown on the receipt, this one including an additional night's stay. I immediately contacted the Ritz, explained the situation, and received a "we'll look into it" response. A day later they responded with a "your request for restitution has been denied" citing an accounting department's review that found a guest checking out of my former room on the 16th used the TV interface to settle charges. I immediately faxxed to my contact at the Ritz a copy of my original Ritz hotel receipt, airline flight information, cab receipt, and airport food receipts, all from the 15th. I have zero tolerance for unsupported use of my credit card. My contact then suddenly professed an inability to handle these types of situations and referred me to "customer care". I followed up with this new contact, who professed zero knowledge of my situation (they had been provided with a reference number by my initial contact that apparently is not meaningful to anyone in the organization). With no knowledge of my situation, they requested original documentation for a second time so that they could could initiate a process which would take 30 days to resolve. In my ire, I requested the name and eMail of the General Manager of the hotel - for which i was provided an eMail address and a name that, as I later found out, does not exist. I immediately returned to my initial contact, who did two things. One, recanted on her referral to the customer care organization stating that this issue should not have gone to them, and two, forwarded an eMail from the accounting department that stated "they would not be making restitution, but would as a certusy (sic) refund the additional room charges. It was hard to tell from the wording of the communication, but I took it on its face that a refund would ensue. This morning I received their real response. Not only did the Ritz NOT refund the additional room charges, they instead charged me for another ADDITIONAL DAY. Total cash out of pocket for me - $440. I have referred this issue to the Florida Attorney Generals Office, and will continue to pursue directly with Ritz/Marriott Hotel management in Maryland - as I believe that either site Hotel management is totally incompetent, or there is some sort of scam being run on guests that purposely throws roadblocks to discourage pursuit of recovery amounts. In the meantime, BEWARE... Do not stay here unless you plan to float the hotel for hundreds while you try to get a response to have their own errors corrected. Any customer service organization when faced with this situation would deal with this more professionally - expecting more for staying at the Ritz is only a sad commentary on how low this once well run and service oriented brand has fallen now that it has been taken over by the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a luxurious property!”
Reviews.Author: International515
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in Orlando at Grande Lakes in Orlando, Florida. I will be very quick and concise about my review. Cleanliness: Amazing. You could lick off the floors of this place, it is gorgeous, even the space behind the toilet is spotless, a rather difficult spot to clean at home. ;) Service: Excellent. The desk staff was excellent and very knowledgeable about the hotel and local area. Overall, a fantastic place to stay, good food and service, and a quality you just cannot get at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: u12mjw
Reviews.Content: Insert your superlative here --> ! An amazing experience that is to be saved up for. No point thinking about staying here if your not ready to spend a bit and enjoy the facilities. Eat at Normans....amazing. Enjoy a day or two at the massive and extensive spa....amazing and walk the grounds and swim in the pools. I imagine this place can get busy but it was a joy and a dream in February in 80F heat. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice spot”
Reviews.Content: We had an executive suite on the 2nd floor the room was great, service was as good as always and we love the Spa. For a message ask for Henry and for a hair cut ask for Susan. Henry gives an excellent deep tissue massage and Susan does not cut too much of your hair off. Great place it is a must Just a little pricy $500 plus tax and fees.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Good for business but leave the kids”
Reviews.Author: xy223yz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz for a conference. The service was great. Friendly and helpful staff. The room was large, had a nice balcony and the furniture was upscale. While I didn't use the pool, I walked around the grounds. Very clean. But the hotel is geared towards adults and couples. While they have a kids area, you get the feeling this is a kids are to be seen, not heard type of place. Finally, and this is a complaint I have about all of the Orlando Marriott properties, you have to pay for parking. Even the self park. It isn't like space is a premium. It is just another way to get a few bucks out of you. Haven't paid for parking at Hilton properties, but every Marriott... But overall, a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed - look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: spj1
Reviews.Content: You are greeted with the fact that despite being in a low density, suburban, even not totally developed area, you must pay $17 per day to self park a block away and walk back uphill. How cheesy is that, along with the inconvenience of having to swipe in and out each time, the long walk etc.... ? Our room was fairly worn, although house keeping was pretty good (we tip every day). Our furnace/ac made a noise like a steel door slamming about every 5-10 minutes. The hotel had several nice areas to eat outside, but for some reason that the staff could not explain (they were confused by it also) they all closed before dinner. The real capper was when my wife (a physician) who was ill much of our stay, experienced some chest pains the morning of our check out thought it best that she rest up until we had to go to the airport. I had to personally go to the front desk 2x to plead for a 2 hour late check out. Several of the staff were a bit surly and not particularly helpful. Bottom LIne - there are a lot of choices in Orlando - you can do way better. Don't repeat our mistake (we won't).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, amazing, complete luxuary at every end.”
Reviews.Author: JFILI73
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was amazing and ready to help at any moment. The shofer service in the brand new Cadillac Escalade was nice as we didnt have to drive or get a cab for dinner and drink. He even came and picked us up when we were finished. The bar stayed open late and was very nice. Couldn't ask for better service and the bed was so cozy. Perfect stay in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “ORLANDO PLEASURE”
Reviews.Author: olicanaboy
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the ritz carlton for five nights, including new years eve. We did the theme parks with my wifes 73 year old mother, who had a ball. The hotel, whilst not the cheapest, is just great, with service that you pay for but just cannot beat. From the valet parking to the waitresses in the loby lounge, to the cleanliness of the rooms, everything was first class. The firework display on new years eve rounded off a very good stay and I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Orlando. Ends:

Reviews.Title: “Great Welcoming, after that I was invisible...”
Reviews.Author: tyedyelvr
Reviews.Content: had a great welcoming after that forget it!!! no more service after that, got drinks at the bar sat outside we were outside for an hour no one came back to check on us or see if we wanted more drinks. the walls in the rooms are paper thin which is surprising for a luxury hotel. at dinner my husband dropped his fork waiter didn't offer to replace it and just left it on the floor. the pool was overflowing and the water was pooling up behind the lounge chairs (it was still the same way on sunday when i left). when leaving the hotel the bellmen out front were standing around talking i had to open my own door with my arms full of luggage. on top of all that i wrote to management and coporate to let them know what happened and no response. they definitely don't live up to the brand promise they lead everyone to believe.

Reviews.Title: “Don't come here January to June”
Reviews.Author: cuteworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: We came here twice before a few years ago and really enjoyed the stay. Unfortunately I can't say the same about this trip. Unless you enjoy a lounge full of pot bellied Budweiser drinking conventioneers taking over the hotel, I would stay away - at least during these months. Discreetly speaking to the front desk just produced a shrug and advice to call ahead next time. Waitress at the lounge affirmed that Jan to July is crazy and overrun with the conventioneers. If you want a relaxing and quiet getaway this is not the place. Better to head over to the local Irish pub. Definitely not worthy of five star rating. Management seems only interested in filling the rooms anyway they can.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Ann-70
Reviews.Content: This is by fay the best hotel in Orlando! I don't know were to begin. the doormen, bellmen, maid service, front desk. Everybody was great and very attentive. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like European Ritz chain - don't be misled!”
Reviews.Author: truthtime1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 2nd week over New Year expecting it to be like UK Ritz - sorely disappointed. Arrived to find not given lake view room to see fireworks on New Years Eve despite travel agent phoning them direct to secure it 8 months earlier when we booked. Reluctant to sort it until we called manager and told him he must do something - finally assigned room for us and room for our teenage sons but on arrival in their room they had double bed! So back to reception and 1 hour later with porter as confused as we were we got semi-desired rooms. When we arrived a young man in scruffy attire asked us if we wanted a drink of hot chocolate (don't have it - far too sweet) and we wondered who on earth he was - apparently he was the doorman yet he hadn't opened any doors for us and was not dressed as you would expect. Service was bad in this hotel but particularly bad was the breakfast which they tried to charge separately for when we had inclusive package and another daily argument needed to sort that out. The breakfast was in Vineyard restaurant and it was chaotic to put it mildly with people queueing for ages before being assigned a table. After a half hour wait we were shown to a half-laid table with only 3 chairs! The food was average to poor with every pastry soaked in cinnamon (fine if you like it but I don't). Fruit selection very poor and cheeses cut into lumps! The waiters were being moaned at all round by guests - the manager when we finally called him to our table after other people's kids were running around us as a game, was weak and disorganised and failed to direct his useless staff. The place was totally undisciplined. This breakfast chaos continued throughout the week with the staff hanging around in groups not doing things that needed to be done and simply trouble shooting the table who complained loudest. It was an absolute farce and we have had far more organised meals at the travelodge inn than here! The worse thing was it didn't improve at all over 7 days and there was nowhere else we could have gone. We had to keep checking our bill on the tv screen as they kept wrongly charging for breakfast and for their wretched car valeting (parking) fees which had to be removed constantly from our bill because we argued we shouldn't pay $26 a day for this when we would have liked to have parked our car ourselves but couldn't. The bar area was relatively small and the food the same as room service with no other choice. The weather was cold for December/Jan and the outside pools were freezing, yet shouldn't have been and not a sole went in them for the entire duration. There was NO INDOOR POOL despite our travel agent confirming there would be one and the SPA facilities were shoddy and were extra and would have cost us £100 per day for the 4 of us if we had wanted to use the smallest steam sauna room (located in the changing room)! So we did not have a swim or spa all week. There was nothing to do for the teenagers. Other people's badly behaved American kids ran around everywhere and there was a kids club for up to age 12. The New years eve ball was for over 21's only and no alchohol to under 21's anywhere in hotel. So our lot were understandably bored and fed up. The whole reception area stunk of cinnamon for the duration due to a tacky and poorly built iced full sized santa grotto taking up 3 square metres in reception. Room service was expensive with tips on top of extortionate service charges. We couldn't believe what we were experiencing and to think of the money we paid for this - using the name Ritz is highly misleading for us Europeans and they shouldn't be allowed to abuse it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean glasses?”
Reviews.Author: eyessexy
Reviews.Content: One day I returned to my room to use The bathroom and The housekeeping lady was cleaning The bathroom I asked her If I can used The bathroom and when I enter I can't believe what I saw. One of The sink was full of water with The glasses and glass Wine inside The water. This is not The best way to clean The glasses. Is discusting!

Reviews.Title: “Simply- the best”
Reviews.Author: matissegirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz for our 21st anniversary. We booked through American Express and received a free lunch and breakfast for 2 each day. We dined at Primo at the adjoining JW Marriott. Perfect dinner. Our room overlooked the pool and golf course. The room is bright, clean and beautiful. The bath is marble with floor to ceiling marble, separate glass shoer, smallish tub and a double sink vanity. Big soft towels. Turn down service was wonderful. We did not hear a peep from any neighbors, outside or anywhere. The walls are think! Slept very soundly. The bartender at the lobby bar - Jeff-gave us gratis martinis after dinner when he heard it was our anniversary. Great guy! Primo let us take our wine back to the Ritz- nice touch- we had half a bottle left to drink and they switched out the glasses so we could enjoy the rest of our wine on the stroll back to the hotel. The service at the Ritz is immpecable. The staff is extremely well trained. Two thumbs way up!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shorts1218
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and I must say when it comes to the luxury hotel business, this hotel has got it down pat. We traveled with my two small children, 21 months and 3 months along with my in-laws. We had a great time in this hotel. It is a home away from home, except my home doesn't have maid service :). We used the Vineyard Grill for most of our dining and although a little pricey, the food was exceptional. The servers were also great, bring us complimentary glasses of wine and looking out for our children. They were VERY interested in making sure our 21 month old was happy at the restaurant, bringing him toys, a dvd player and so on. We didn't even have to ask or prompt them, it was over the top thoughtful. The other nights and all mornings we ordered room service and the food was amazing...you can get organic eggs, the best blueberry pancakes ever and wonderful vanilla infused belgian waffles...YUM! The staff was very friendly every time we came in and out of the hotel, greeting us. One night Santa was there and they came up and told us to have the kids meet him and they took a picture of us. The hotel was nicely decorated for the holidays and had a gigantic walk in Gingerbread house as you came in. We couldn't believe it was real, but it took over 1200 eggs to make it and had a sign telling you all about it. I didn't bother looking into the activities for the kids because usually it's for older kids, but I kicked myself one night when my husband and I walked past one of the ballrooms with two bounce houses in them. One was for boys (blue) and one was for girls (pink). Apparently, they had set up activities for the kids inside because of the cooler weather. What great thinking. The hotel itself is very beautiful and kept up quite well. We got a suite connecting to a second bedroom and had more than enough room. Housekeeping was very consistent and they even provided a little package for the kids with johnson's baby shampoos and toiletries and a little night light and such. They also provided REAL roll around cribs, not a pack and play. Our room was VERY quiet and I did not hear any neighbors. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as they seem to really care about the experience you have and again CONSISTENCY is the key at this hotel even in the busy holiday season. We will return anytime to this hotel when we are visiting the parks in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Just what orlando needed”
Reviews.Author: dora_pirate
Reviews.Content: As a local I am so pleased to have finally tried RC Grande Lakes. I took my mom here for a liitle spa weekend and already have another reservation to go back. I am a general devotee of the brand and was not disappointed. The spa gets enough local traffic that the quality was exceptional -- I recommend Amy for a facial and Katie for massage. I think club level is the only way to go and we had excellent sevice all around. The only negative I had was that the mattress was pretty awful in our room (1415). I don't know if that was an anomaly or not as this was my first stay, but it was certainly a surprise because usually the ritz beds are so yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional property”
Reviews.Author: on_cape
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at several RC properties and we have always been very pleased with the hotel and staff. We were again pleased with this hotel, but the staff was absolutely exceptional this time. They were sincere and did not seem to be going through the motions at all. We ate at Norman's one evening and would rate it A+. We had the Thanksgiving grand buffet at the Vineyard Grill and again would rate it A++. The pool areas were great for the kids and the grounds looked nice all the time. We stayed on the club level and it was without a doubt the best club lounge staff by far!!! Kudos to that group. Housekeeping was a little disappointing but it didn't ruin our overall experience. Great job to all of you there!!

Reviews.Title: “Seventh year we have stayed here for our conference - always look forward to coming back”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Mark
Reviews.Content: I have been to this Ritz for several years. The staff is always gracious and attentive, the facilities are terrific for conferences, the golf course is challenging and convenient, and the rooms are always top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: Afowlerco
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I am a Denver based business woman, and I have 30 tattoos, all very visable....you would think this would have NOTHING to do with anything when you're spending $1200 a night(we had two executive suites). My Husband and I have stayed in some VERY luxurious hotels. I was excited when he told me he had booked our company trip to stay at the Waldorf, but then had to move to the Ritz when the Waldorf couldn't let us extend our stay with them because the were booked. Anyhoo, the energy from the staff is lackluster to say the least. They are "programmed" to spout off good evening, good afternoon, and such...they definitely don't seem to mean it. I had to open the doors several times myself with lots of heavy shopping bags, the front desk refused to remake me a key when ours became useless until my husband could come down to verify who I was, and until we rented a Bentley, they could have cared less to help us out. You should have seen the OBVIOUS change in their demeanor when they saw us in that! How utterly ridiculous!! The only people here that were a pleasure to deal with were our bellman and the room service attendants. They were awesome. I'm not exactly sure how they treated our Operations Manager and his wife, but I do know they were not impressed either. I do not usually write bad reviews, but I read these before we came here and hoped it was an anomaly we would not have to deal with. Unfortunately, I wish I would have talked my Husband OUT of booking here. I jus dont want someone else to have high hopes of a wonderful stay to be let down, especially after paying this much. There were also pubic hairs left in our tub as well as some kind of yellow substance on the walls in the bathroom. Very disgusting! There are so many other great hotels here, don't waste your money here!

Reviews.Title: “Ten Previous Visits Were Wonderful - This was Exceptional!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leigherton
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been guests of the Ritz Carlton, Orlando Grande Lakes on over 10 occasions over the past 5 years or so. Usually we are there for our Anniversaries, Birthdays, Thanksgiving and Christmas occasions. The service of this Ritz Carlton is always wonderful, relaxing and we feel special! Mr. Anthony Ullio is the gentleman who was at the helm of superior service while we were guests. However, this visit to the Ritz Carlton Orlando Grande Lakes was EXCEPTIONAL! I was traveling solo for business and knew this is where I wanted to stay while in Orlando. I was cheerly greeted at Valet by Juliana who was helpful in taking my car to Valet. She set the tone for my visit. At the front desk, Edwardo checked me in. To my surprise, he upgraded me to a suite! This was totally unexpected and I was grateful for this surprise. Room 301 was beautiful with two balconies and a beautiful view and QUIET! A few minutes after entering my room, a small gift bag was left for me as a welcoming gift (Archipelago Candles). Amazing! Also, that afternoon, I used the pool area which was bright blue, clean and relaxing! My Room Service coffee, that I ordered, was wonderful too! I had the wonderful Breakfast Buffet at the Vineyard Grille the next morning - super egg omelets to order!!! During my stay, I encountered wonderful hospitality by Victoria, Fagalie, Enrique, Malti, who was super professional in the Gift Shop and when I left Juliana was there again to help as were Alex and Taylor. I love the Ritz Carlton Orlando Grande Lakes and recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to stay in the Orlando area where the service is Exceptional, the surroundings relaxing and the food delicious! Thank you Mr. Ullio and your fine staff and making my stay Exceptional!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: leileiDetroit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel for our 3rd anniversary. We wanted an upscale hotel so we decided on the Ritz Carlton. It is hard to find as the sign off the road is hidden by greenery but once we found it we drove along beautful grounds to get to the hotel. It was late so we decided to go for a late dinner before checking in. When we pulled up to hotel, the valet tenant provided us with several options for a late dinner. After dinner, we checked into our room and we were delighted to walk into a beautiful, clean, comfortable room. The bathroom sparkles! The only complaint I have for the room is the balcony. It needs to be cleaned and updated. It is not inviting at all and we did not use it one time during our stay. The staff is welcoming and extremely helpful. The pool is nice and has several fountains that bring a nice sound to the area since it is not near the ocean. The poolside service is good and there is a bar outside however it is off to the side and could very easily be missed. The hotel lounge area doesn't have much atmosphere so we had all meals and cocktails off of the hotel property. The Ritz Carlton and the Marriott are connected by the spa and the fitness center. It is a very long walk to the fitness center but exercise is the point so I do not count this as a negative. Nice hotel but not on my must return list and I do not believe it is worth the rate.

Reviews.Title: “A real 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandralves
Reviews.Content: The Ritz it's for sure a great hotel group and the Orlando hotel it's just as perfect as the others. Great staff (always welcoming you back everytime you enter), great valet service (a lot of brazilians working! And some valets also spoke portuguese), great breakfast buffet (not everyday is buffet though), greaaaat view from every room, housekeeping is perfect... Thw swimming pool is wonderful. I sure hope to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Very very good!”
Reviews.Author: Earthman83
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and every bit as good as before. This time we had a lovely club floor suite [pictures attached] overlooking the golf course. The living room and bedroom were separated by french doors,and there were two toilets,the 2nd one in the very large L shaped bathroom. Servicing of the room and turn down was perfect,again with clothes tidied as necessary. I can report that the club floor lounge remains the best R-C club lounge I've visited,so friendly and the people there cannot do enough for you. Relaxing with some wine of an early evening,reading the papers on the club lounge terrace is to be recommended. Food presentations there were superb! We were at the very relaxing lobby lounge many times also,having a few drinks and some very nice food-their sliders are superb by the way. Like the whole hotel,it is so very well maintained. Needless to say we also ate at Normans restaurant again.It is a mighty fine restaurant. Breakfast is in the vineyard grill.Chefs specials there did not disappoint either.What a fabulous breakfast! Again I highly recommend this hotel. As regards recent posts on robberies,to be honest I'm surprised.However,even in this hotel,as in any hotel,we always either take valuables with us or put them in the safe. We certainly had no problems like that. I do not know if it's the case here,but in all hotels,it should be policy that doors are closed during servicing so the possibility of theft by an opportunistic passerby during servicing is ruled out.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL THEFT at RITZ CARLTON ORLANDO”
Reviews.Author: LSRANCH
Reviews.Content: HOTEL THEFT at RITZ CARLTON ORLANDO tmalky from Pinellas County September 15, 2010 Quote: Be sure to check all valuables in hotel safe. If your safe is not working ask for a repair or a room that has a working safe. Additionally, anything of value, clothing, electronics, jewelry, money...if it doesn't fit in the safe...it doesn't exist. I recently had an IPAD...3 days old stolen from my room sometime during "turn-down" service. Hotel will not assume responsibility for ANY thefts that YOU cannot prove happened. This applies to jewelry, money, computers, expensive shoes...anything not in your safe is up for grabs. What a dissappointment to learn that Marriott Claims Services addressed the theft by forwarding a letter regarding the "Innkeepers Statue for the State of Florida, putting the hotel "under no obligation for the loss, theft, or unexplained disappearance of guest's money, jewelry, or property, which has not been placed in the hotel's custody for safekeeping. Marriott states in the letter that this information is posted everywhere. No reported follow up with Florida Sheriff's office or Hotel Loss Prevention staff....basically guests beware or leave your valuables in your car. Wonder if this applies to spouses, grandparents and children?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice family oriented hotel”
Reviews.Author: camiohara
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Ritz Grande Lakes for about 12 days,having visited Orlando and we have found the hotel as a very good choice when traveling with young children.The Ritz is conjoined with the Marriott Grande Lakes and being there as a guest you have free access to all the Marriott outdoor attractions (pool,lazy river,activities..etc). The rooms are quite clean (depending on whom from housekeeping you get,but a 10$ tip can go a long way for all that extra service and more bottled water in the room). Food is quite good,breakfast is average,room service is very average and very small portions,but the Grande Grill steaks ( not to be missed for dinner) one of the best Ive had in a long while. The pool area and all the outdoor areas for the hotel are amazing and before I forget -Starbucks is a walking distance in one of the Marriott lobbies.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Paradise”
Reviews.Author: vicki29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Orlando for two nights to celebrate our 1 year anniversary. As soon as we arrived the staff made us feel extremely welcome and were very attentive to our needs. When they knew the reason for our visit they upgraded us to a suite that overlooked the pool and glorious landscaped gardens. The accommodation, breakfast, pool area, Normans the restaurant - all outstanding. Yes, it wasn't cheap to stay there but it was most definitely worth the money. We both loved it and would certainly rate it as one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. I only wish I could've stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lulu59
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an estended weekend getaway with my daughter and sister to celebrate my daughter’s graduation. The service was amazing. They upgraded our room upon arrival and surprised us with a wonderful chocolate assortment and fruit basket in our room. Later, they also surprised us with dessert at dinner. The hotel and pool are beautiful. They also provide a free shuttle to Universal Studios where we were going. The breakfast buffet was amazing and the selection was great. We also had dinner at the Vineyard Grill which was very good and offered one of the best filet mignon’s ever. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable; The bedding is incredible and I wanted to pack the bed, pillows and comforter in my suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: madiandcindy
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort before taking our Disney Cruise. We were there three nights and enjoyed everything about the property. The staff is wonderful, always anticipating your needs and greeting you by name. At check in they had a special check in are for the kids and offered them a free gift as well as served them hot cocoa with marshmellows. I loved that even though its a very upscale resort the french country decor made it feel relaxed. The pool area is fantastic and spa is amazing. We had breakfast at the resort which was top notch, my daughter is a very picky eater and wanted a ham sandwhich for breakfast! When I told her it was breakfast and she should order from the breakfast menu the server quickly added they could make her anything she wanted! They brought her a ham and mayo sandwhich with no crust and a sliced banana per my 8 year old's request! That is amazing service. The room was perfect for us, it had a very large bathroom with marble and separate tub and shower, a nice balcony with a view of their lake and a large foyer upon entering the room. We couldn't ask for anything more on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business travelers and adults in general”
Reviews.Author: Choosy-Guy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of best I've ever stayed in - the staff are excellent, the rooms are luxurious, and the facility in general is beautiful. One of the things I appreciated most about the hotel is something apparently common to all Ritz-Carltons: a dress code and general expectation that people will be polite and respectful. I'm no prude, but really - do people need to go about their daily vacation routines in ripped shirts, flip-flops and bathing suits (while not at the pool)? The conference I was attending was at the the JW Mariott next door, and the Ritz was a short walk through connected indoor and outdoor corridors. Another cool thing about the hotel - they have recycling bins. It may seem like a small thing, but I appreciate it nonetheless; so may hotels seem to just throw everything out - Ritz appears to actually care about the environment.

Reviews.Title: “Never mind all the petty critics!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnanadkaren
Reviews.Content: Well where do i start..We've just spent our honeymoon in this hotel and could not literally find a single fault. It was a fantastic experience full stop. The room and hotel itself was spotless and breath-taking, the staff were exceptionally friendly, courtious and helpful, and the attention to detail was second to none. Any rubbish you read about pool side seats being reserved is just that..rubbish. Your chosen seats are set up for you by the attendant who places a clean white branded cover on your seat/s and also some clean blue towels. So for anyone with a brain it is very obvious that the seats with the white covers are clearly TAKEN. We witnessed several people, including men, who would not open the door of their own cars unitl opened for them by the door man...HELLO Reality check!! These are i'm sure the types of people who find all the petty little things to complain about. Trust me you would be hard pressed to find anything to complain about in this hotel. We booked our room exclusive of breakfast because we intended eating on the go every day, however when the desk clerk heard that we were on our honeymoon she immediatley upgraded our room and included full breakfast as complimentary for the entire stay. Speaking of breakfast, the buffet breakfast is reason enough to stay, you can delight in any, and as much of, a whole host of delights in the vineyard grill breakfast hall. The cheff is also standing by to prepare your choice of omelette and "real" freshley squeesed ornage juce is on tap. In our experience the staff at the concierge desk were excellent and couldn't do enough to help. The room service is available 24/7 and at very reasonable prices and you'll be pleasently surprised at the presentation. The rooms are cleaned every morning and they come back every evening to touch up turn down the sheets. There is a host of standby taxis outside waiting at the clap of a hand to take you to any one of a host of nearby attractions. However beware that these "Black" town cars are more expensive that the standard "yellow" taxis but are much more luxurious so take you pick. So all in all, although this hotel is a little more expensive, its absolutely worth the money and unlike some of the hotels we booked online, this was an unforgetble experience and will definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Some departments are snobs and suck Big Time !!!”
Reviews.Author: family66-68
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, one of the best - no doubt about it but when it comes to helping you when you left the hotel Had to use the lost and found department, Called 3 times, left 3 messages no response what so ever beneath the qualtity of the hotel Lost and Found Ritz Carlton Orlando - You suck ! not even an answer , come on....

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Orlando didn't live up to the Hype”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoBizman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to the Ritz-Carlton Orlando Grand Lakes for our wedding anniversary. Let me preface this review by stating that we have pretty high expectations for the Ritz brand based on previous stays at Ritz hotels and similar chains like Four Seasons. When we pulled up to the hotel late in the afternoon, there was a long wait time at the valet. The valet staff could have used some help, although there weren't too many cars. When we walked up to the front door, there was nobody to open the door. That doesn't really bother me, I'm just making comparisons to other top brand hotel stays. Once inside, there was only one person behind the counter, and the check in took a very very long time. We purchased a Romance package, which included the rose petal turndown, champagne display with strawberries and chocolate, and we upgraded to the lake view. These touches were nice. On the down side, the room was a bit small, as was the bathroom. Also, the balcony affords no privacy. We found the best aspect of the hotel to be the dining at Norman's, and lounging at the massive pool. The service at the restaurant and pool were excellent. Overall, a nice hotel. However, below my expectations based on the higher price and high expectations for the Ritz-Carlton brand.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Much More”
Reviews.Author: 3dogmombbj
Reviews.Content: Hearing so much about The Ritz and their service level, amenities, etc., I expected so much more than 'average'. I traveled with my sister and girlfriend for a long weekend stay. First of all, to charge $7 for a dollar store plastic tube for the lazy river is outrageous. Needless to say I saw no need to float with 100 kids. It's The Ritz. You can't loan tubes to your guests?! Secondly, our room was not cleaned to the level of a Holiday Inn. A half-empty wine glass sat on the dusty tray for 2 days. Our room was never made up until well into the afternoon. Not sure if there is a lack of staff or what. But again, it's The Ritz! Thirdly, an adult pool should be standard at this type of hotel. Maybe because of my stay last year at The Breakers in West Palm I just thought The Ritz would be more on par with that hotel. I'll be at The Ritz in Key Biscayne next year. I really hope these 2 hotels do not compare.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the Gold Standard!”
Reviews.Author: shornilla
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Ritz-Carlton property over the holiday season for one week in mid-December. I booked a package rate that included hotel credit to be used throughout my stay. I arrived late for check-in (11 PM) since my flight was the last one coming into OIA for the evening. I was greeted by the bell staff with a hospitable courtesy that was comforting to encounter after a long day's flight. The staff member at the check-in desk was very welcoming and expedited the check-in process quickly and efficiently so that I could get to my room faster. I booked a Club Level Garden View Room and was then personally escorted by the shift general manager to my room and given a detailed and quick orientation en route as well. Any concerns and special requests were inquired by the manager before his departure from escorting me to my room since he could tell I was tired. He made sure an associate from housekeeping turned down my room and had a warm bath waiting for me by the time I arrived, The room was spacious with a comfortable bed, great amenities, clean shower/vanity area with every attention to detail in cleanliness cared for on a daily basis from housekeeping. The bell staff personally greeted me by name whenever I left or returned to the property for the evening and always assisted me with my chauffeur requests. I had a Swedish Massage at the Spa and the facilities were quiet, tranquil and excellent for experiencing a relaxing atmosphere. The pool was a great temperature (never too cold or hot) all day. The location is great as it is tucked away from the hustle and bustle of I-Drive (property is closer to Sea World). You saw the great views of the tourism areas of Orlando, and downtown in the far distance, while always in a serene and quiet atmosphere. Every time I stay at this Ritz-Carlton property I am always surprised at the level of detail and devotion to the overall guest experience at this property. I have stayed here several times in the past and will continue to stay here when I make my trips to the Orlando area. Thank you Ritz-Carlton for always upholding the Gold Standard!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!!”
Reviews.Author: nmcaleer
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is a fabulous hotel. We wanted a quiet hotel away from all of the craziness Orlando can bring. This was definitely it!!! As we arrived on our anniversary, they upgraded our room immediately. We had a gorgeous room with a view of the pool and golf course. The service at the Ritz far exceeds other hotels. We had a wonderful stay and will definitley return!!

Reviews.Title: “Will always come here for my stay cation!”
Reviews.Author: solotravelergirl9
Reviews.Content: The Grande Lakes property is everything you would expect from the Ritz. Beautiful grounds, precise attention to detail, perfect service and worth every penny. The staff is professional yet unobtrusive, the spa is relaxing and the rooms are lovely. The staff in the Club Lounge informed me that the hotel is undergoing a renovation soon but everything is in very good condition now, so I'm unsure why they are going to that expense. A few pointers: the services at the spa could stand some expansion; I've been going to the Ritz for years and would love to experience some new and different treatments--the menu, though lovely, has not changed. The Vitale Cafe resembles a hospital cafe so hopefully, the renovation will contemplate changing this into an atmosphere that better reflects the relaxed and comforting nature of the spa as a whole. All in all, the BEST in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Great Convention Facilities”
Reviews.Author: soonergirl23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in Orlando, Florida, at the end of June2010. I was visiting for a convention. Checking-in was simple and quick. We did book two rooms together and received two rooms on separate floors. Our party would have liked rooms connecting, so that we could socialize and work some after meetings. They could not accomodate us even after several phone calls. The manager did give us a complimentary lunch in the hotel, which was nice. The hotel beds and pillows were very good. Our hotel room was spacious and cleaned every day. We did travel with others whose room was not cleaned one day. I am not sure why... Our colleagues had to call housekeeping to get their rooms cleaned. We did have a balcony that overlooked the golf course. It was nice to sit out there in the morning (before the horrible humidity set in) and drink morning tea/coffee. The Ritz-Carlton is connected to the JW Marriott by a outdoor breezeway. There were restaurants, coffee shops, gift shops, and bar areas within both complexes. Both hotel grounds were beautiful. A golf course lies behind the hotel. I walked it one morning. The natural landscape is beautiful. The pool area was very nice. Good service by pool staff and waitstaff. The water was cool, and the pool gave complimentary water. It is a little bit of a walk to the bathrooms by the pool though. The convention facilities were excellent. The staff that served during the convention breaks were friendly and courteous. The meals that were served during convention were quite delicious as well. There is a Wal-Greens located right outside the hotel grounds across the street. They carry toiletries and food/drink items. We all enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - but charges for wi-fi felt like a rip off”
Reviews.Author: WendyAM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for two nights. Although most of the time I was in meetings, the room was good. Not the largest ever, but it had everything I needed. The balcony overlooked the golf course and lake, and the pool. Surroundings beautiful. Staff were all super friendly. Only gripes were telephone charges which were huge for short international calls, and the charges for wi-fi. Sorry, but so many cheaper and smaller hotels now offer free wi-fi, I fail to understand why the Ritz thinks it should charge for it, unless you're going to sit in the lobby. Wi-fi these days should be a hygiene factor - like shampoo or a hair dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: travel141
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel and had a practically perfect experience there. We are not golfers, but really appreciated the scenery, beautiful lakes, and walking/biking paths all over the grounds. The pool was gorgeous. The staff was very accommodating, especially to our 5-year old daughter. The whole thing was wonderful. We have stayed at several Four Seasons & Ritz Carltons and the Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes is probably in my top 5 favorite US hotels. And compared to some other high end hotels with similar amenities, I actual thought it was a pretty good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Business for Hubby, fun for family”
Reviews.Author: theresar2004
Reviews.Content: First I must state that we were here for a convention, I would never ever stay here because I just dont like paying for other people excesses. Our first night was at the Marriott next door but since they were booked we spent the next day at the Ritz. I found every employee to be very helpful and inparticular the porter that took out items to our room was very nice in conversing with both me and my son. He even joked with him about the alligator in a picture then we saw one in the lake that very night. Upon check out we brought our own bags down and waited while my husband got our car from self park (you should have seen the people eyes, like OH, SELF PARK, never heard of it) and we saw the same porter and he calle my son Captain again and my son told him about seeing the alligator. I liked being able to use the Marriotts pool but didnt find it convenient to have to trapse from property to property then thru different alleyways to get to some form of breakfast then down to the pool. As you can gather, I would probalby prefer a Holiday Inn or equivalent where you can get free wifi, free parking, nice pool, free breakfast, and convenience for $100 OR LESS A NIGHT. I just can swallow $269 per night plus $20 for valet, $10 for wifi, ?? $$ for breakfast (we went to starbucks and got oatmeal and juice for him and coffee and oatmeal for me for $13 total) , plus what ever else they can nickel and dime you for... Nice if you can afford the luxury and I would recommend it but overall the beds were by far better at the marriott (still overpriced) and the room was cleaner at the marriott. Strangely the walls were thin but the doors very heavy. We only heard noise from one room next to us but no hallway noise nor did we hear noise from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: MCDBaker
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 10 nights in this fantastic hotel and can't wait to return. The standard of accomodation is top quality and the staff are very attentive. We stayed at the same time as the reviewer who commented on breakfast in the lobby. Whilst we do agree that this service was slow on two days we have to point out that the restaurant was being refurbushed on these days. We experienced both the lobby and resteraunt versions of breakfast and have to say that the two days in question were the exception not the rule. The valet staff in particular were extremley welcoming and always provided an excellent service. We were wary of how this service would operate having read other reviews but our experience was exceptional. Standards of cleanliness were outstanding both in the room and around the hotel. The food in the two restaurants was expensive but the food served in the bar was reasonable and very good qaulity. Our only fault with this hotel was that they checked us out!!!! We didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Not Ritz service”
Reviews.Author: pamrod305
Reviews.Content: Like most Ritz Carltons, this property is a beautiful hotel in a lovely setting. Our room was luxurious and comfortable. However, the service was not what we expected for a Ritz. My husband and I arrived first, and we were specific in letting the front desk know that our son and his girlfriend would be checking in later, with a different confirmation number. In spite of this, when they arrived, the front desk personnel checked them into OUR room. If it wasn't for the Do Not Disturb sign we had put on the door and the fact that we had double-locked it from within, there might have been an uncomfortable incident! Next morning, the buffet breakfast in the lobby was a disaster. While waiting for a table for 20 minutes-- even though there were many empty, but dirty tables--about 10 different "managers" kept asking us if we were being helped. When we replied "No," they would walk away to find someone else to ask us the same question! But no one bothered to clean off a table in order to accommodate us. Finally we got a table, but had to desperately flag someone down just to get coffee and juice. There was plenty of staff, but no one seemed to know what their role was and no one was helping the guests! At least this was at a buffet or we certainly would have gone hungry. It was totally absurd and not what you expect at a Ritz Carlton, especially for the prices they charge. In contrast, our dinner at Norman's restaurant was wonderful; the food was delicious and the staff was extremely attentive.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Ritz-Carlton Experience”
Reviews.Author: JaredMillr
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ritz Carlton Orlando was fantastic. Great service, accommodations, amenities and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: alpham0m
Reviews.Content: We went for Memorial Day Weekend with 12 year old twins, and extended family. Family activities were planned all day, and included cupcake decorating. The kids had a blast. We all felt pampered and entertained. The hotel even had fireworks that rivaled any small town's on the 4th of July.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: K_The_Tourist
Reviews.Content: Already dreaming of returning having spent a wonderful week here to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. On arrival, we found a beautiful gift waiting for us in our room and this thoughtful touch set the scene for the whole of our stay. This is a fabulous hotel, which is very elegant and refined from the exquisite lobby with its glittering chandeliers to the delightfully maintained grounds, but it is not in the least bit stuffy. Every member of staff is very approachable and very friendly and certainly knows how to treat you properly. It was lovely being welcomed back 'home' by the valet attendants each time we'd had a long day out in the hustle and bustle of Orlando. Its location on the lake is fabulous, if a little remote in terms of quickly getting to local shops or restaurants but it's fairly close to the main attractions. Facilities are excellent and you can't beat buying a croissant and coffee for breakfast from the little wagon by the bar and taking it to eat outside on the seats by the lake watching the birds and ducks. It's lovely, too, walking through the grounds and seeing the butterfly and herb gardens, as well as feeding the fish at 1pm. You could be a million miles away from Mickey & Co. Sharing facilities with the Marriott hotel next door, which is reached either by walking through the grounds or through the most magnificent interconnecting walkways is pretty good as there is a Starbucks there as well as Citron restaurant, which serves wicked burgers and awesome potato spears.
