Little details such as the iced lemon and tea on tap in the lobby, the supply of bottled water as you're coming in and out and the fast check-out also help to make it a superb customer experience. A couple of things you may find useful to know are that it's valet parking only here, which can be a bit restricting if you're just popping back for something before going out again and also a little costly. Also, this hotel hosts a number of corporate events during the day and evening so has a mixture of guests. Finally, don't forget to take home a lasting reminder of your stay by buying one of the little RC rubber ducks from either the gift shop or the spa!

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding Anniversary Road Trip”
Reviews.Author: tebb
Reviews.Content: WOW! Perfect from start to finish. We arrived at 2am in the morning after an horrendous journey from the UK, to be met with a pleasant young lady who promptly took care of us and we were up graded to a suite, taken to it and made comfortable. From then on, nothing was too much trouble. Excellent, decadent and a beautiful place to stay........

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation with toddler”
Reviews.Author: diney
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Disney World with our toddler (now 3). Last year we stayed at Disney's Grand Floridian and, this time, wanted something more luxurious -- but toddler friendly. This was a perfect solution. Our three year old still talks about the hotel and the fabulous pools. The hotel is a typical Ritz Carlton -- so you know what you're getting. Great service, beautiful public areas . . . Everything was as I expected it to be. I, sadly, didn't try the spa, but will next time. For families with toddlers: my daughter LOVED the hotel and both pools (the Ritz pool and the "lazy river" pool at the adjacent Marriott. In fact, she liked the pools more than the Magic Kingdom! At the lazy river pool, she could float in the inner tube all by herself (with us nearby) and had a great time. Although the Ritz pool is not zero-entry, it is still very kid-friendly, with lots of wide steps and warm water. Also, each property has a nice little playground for kids. Some other things my 3-year old loved: ordering a milkshake poolside and the little Ritz Carlton rubber duckies that housekeeping left in her tub each night. Also, it is not that big of a deal driving to Disney parks from the Ritz. It's about 20 minutes. So unless you're planning on leaving a park and then going back later in the day, it's really not an issue. We had an excellent stay here and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz - never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: AngelMel
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed a weekend here with my husband who was working the NFL Owners meetings, and I got to tag along. This property was hidden, or so it seemed, away from the craziness of Disney, which I thoroughly enjoyed. Getting there, however, be prepared to encounter some traffic at any time of the day. The Ritz and JW Marriott are both located on the same property, which I found a bit odd, but am not sure why both hotels are right next to each other. The Ritz was your standard...beautiful lobby, excellent check-in service, nice, comfortable room. We had asked for a room with a queen/king sized bed, but were given a room with two double beds, which my husband and I kept joking that they gave us two twin beds to sleep in (they were small). We had a lovely balcony overlooking the golf course, and a little sitting area with a desk and chair. What I love about the Ritz is always the bathroom/shower, and the fact that they give you a refrigerator. Considering there was so much activity at the hotel, it was quiet, relaxing, and we were able to sleep. I visited the spa inside the JW Marriott. I was very impressed with the nice-sized gym that had plenty of machines, each with its' own TV, and they had a studio where they taught beginner's ballet. I was very impressed. The spa was lush and relaxing, and I had a prenatal massage there. I highly suggest taking advantage of it, especially the prenatal massage, as the spa uses Mamma Mio products, and you will be hooked. (The only problem was my masseuse would not stop talking and bossing me around about being pregnant and a mother - what is it with people having to give you their every opinion about having a child?) Anyhow, I'm sure the other services were fabulous, as well. We never left the hotel, and ordered room service the entire time. The food through room service was excellent, and naturally, one should be prepared to pay top dollar for a turkey burger. There is a very small shop located inside the Ritz, and they didn't seem to have much in terms of snacks or drinks, so I made the trek to the larger shop inside the JW, which also included a Starbucks. The lobby bar was very nice, but the service was a bit slow. I didn't get to check out the pool because it rained the entire time, but the grounds seemed to be beautiful and well-groomed, and I'm sure using the pools would have been a fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pleasant Stay at a Well Located Resort”
Reviews.Author: JTears
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for three nights before attending a conference in the adjacent JW Marriott (a separate review will be posted for that property). I booked a Club Room package where upon staying two nights, the last night was free. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. Being Orlando, I was expecting the place to be mobbed with families and kids. It could be because it was off season, but the lobby was very sedate and calm. Check-in was incredibly smooth, and bell service was prompt. There is only valet parking available at this hotel, which I usually find annoying because there can be delays in getting your car, but even the valets did a good job. The room itself was well located, a tower room with a view over the flat Central Florida landscape and the pool areas. Because I was on a higher floor, I could even see the fireworks at night from the Sea World theme park, which was a plus. Room wasn't particularly spacious, but was comfortable typical to a Ritz. My main complaint is the lack of soundproofing between rooms - I could clearly hear the television from my neighbor's room, and occasionally conversations. The club itself was fantastic, even if the staff was a bit on the overeager side. The food presentations were all high-quality and generously offered. Staff was very eager to attend to needs. It may be because the week I was there it was somewhat slow, so they focused a lot of attention on the few guests around. Again, a nice stay at a first rate property. Service was good to excellent, although it could have been because of the low occupancy during the period.

Reviews.Title: “Away from Amusement Parks, quiet property..”
Reviews.Author: guoning
Reviews.Content: Room is larger than the other Ritz I have stayed in Florida, everything else seem to be the same, the funitures, the amenities in the room, and the layout of the bathroom. Bed was really comfortable and room service was great. They serve breakfast buffet in the morning, again similar selections as the other Ritz in Florida. There weren't that many families staying at this hotel and the hotel is away from everything, so you get a quiet stay. Hotel is pretty big and shares the golf course with JW next door. If you want a little bit of quiet time and enjoy everything else Orlando has to offer, this may be a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “That's why they call it the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carltons are known worldwide for having top quality service. Many companies try to emulate their customer service policy and incorporate it into their own "best practice" approach. You can see why at the Ritz Carlton Orlando. Every individual, every system has an attention to detail with the guest in mind. From the concierge to the grounds keepers, you are greeted with a smile and hello. The rooms are immaculate and beds are comfortable. Food at our corporate sponsored events was good. The grounds are beautiful and the Spa/fitness facilities are top notch. We especially liked the agreement with the neighboring JW Marriott to use their facilities and pool. The river pool there was fun and relaxing and provided a good amount of opportunity for shade. This is a great way to do Orlando without being Disney-ized.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonpearl
Reviews.Content: Stayed with teens for a week. Top quality attentive service from all the staff from room service to the car valet to reception, always greeted with a huge welcome. Immaculate interconnecting rooms, nothing to fault and I am extremely fussy and bathrooms were likewise. Easy to use pool with towels etc provided, lazy river of marriott a two minute walk away, I honestly couldn't fault this hotel. We stayed alot in Bahamas at the Cove but this hotel beats it plus Orlando - plenty to do!

Reviews.Title: “Tacky, Pretentious and Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Traveler561732
Reviews.Content: Attended a wedding there and stayed overnight. The decor is hideous. Crappy reproductions of French furniture, lot of cheap, pretentious crystal chandeliers and psuedo gilt bronze that the masses think is "elegant". The food was really terrible at the wedding dinner. Most of it had been prepared in advance and it was overcooked and practically inedible. This is truly a Marriott hotel with major pretentions. It's so far below the Four Seasons chain that it's a joke. Not recommended unless you like being ripped off for "faux" elegance at high prices. Would never go there again. Just too trashy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxurious and quiet, yet frustrating.”
Reviews.Author: YaleDad
Reviews.Content: Like most of the Ritz properties, the decor and rooms are wonderful. Staying here for business in Orlando, I was surprised how far it was from the downtown area; it's really closer to the theme parks than the city, and seems very far away. The bed was corporate-level perfection, firm mattress with soft covers and pillows. Business desk and chair-and-a-half recliner was very comfortable even though the room felt slightly cramped. It features, however, a balcony that overlooks the property. We were on the 12th floor and the view was lovely- of the property, not of the parking lot. Bathroom was roomy and well-designed. Entertainment included flat screen TV with digital cable. One of the two room phones didn't work; how irritating. I'm always frustrated that at these rates, wireless internet is NOT throughout the hotel, and wired internet is a surcharge. At these rates, I expect it included. I don't want to pay a surcharge just to check my email before I go to bed or when I wake up. Food and beverage were as expected- high quality, and highly priced. (Approximately $65 for two for a basic breakfast; $25 for one drink at the noisy, crowded bar.) Check-in, Housekeeping and room service staff were ideal- discrete, quiet & polite. I was dismayed that the only parking option was valet (an additional 21/night) and no matter how long in advance I called for my car, it was NEVER waiting for me, I always had to wait for it. I'd stay here again, but only if I need to be in close proximity to the location or for a little escape. It's not worth the extra long drive to stay here unless you can enjoy the real benefits of the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “great to get away from Disney crowds”
Reviews.Author: jessica y
Reviews.Content: Resort was fine. Nice escape from all things Disney since my kids have grown out of some of that. Stay at Ritz pool and don't venture to Marriott's (dirty and overcrowded).

Reviews.Title: “Not that Ritzy”
Reviews.Author: PalmBeach9
Reviews.Content: Attentive service, but it is more of a Marriott than Ritz ( it shares the property with a Marriott). Typical Orlando monster, way too big for a Ritz. The rooms are nice, but the food was mediocre, the worst coffee and tea ever. Although I have mostly given up on trying to drink tea in US hotels, such weak coffee was unexpected. To their credit, after we complained, they made a decent pot, with double their usual coffee, so it was drinkable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wearytravelinone
Reviews.Content: My stay was wonderful. Beautiful well appointed hotel, with courteous, attentive staff. Restaurants were delightful. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Lesser Ritz's I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Thadorian
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is not a bad hotel, but it certainly not great. It is nestled away on a property that is shared by a large Marriott (that I believe is under the same owner) and is surrounded by a golf course. My wife and I stayed here with a few friends for a Thanksgiving trip to Disney World. Perhaps it was due to the holiday or it being fall, but the hotel was largely empty, which was great for us. But only after a few days here did we start to notice a lot of little annoying things that add up over time. The one hot tub is attached to a fountain. Cool idea sure, but the problem is it sprays out cold water which causes splashing onto the parts of you that are not submerged. It quickly made sense to me why it was empty when we got there. The hotel was not built too long ago, but it certainly has some signs of aging. The grout in the bathroom was clearly cleaned, but had aged and was cracking extensively. A couple pieces of the marble flooring were cracked as well. The shower was about average for a 3* hotel, but a bit below par for the image that Ritz tries to portray. I think they just simply need a refurbishment, and we were at the end of the cycle. Parking is expensive at the Orlando Ritz, which is surprising seeing as how much land they have. Its only about $5 more a day to do unlimited Valet, so I went with that instead. Also expect to pay for internet access. The location is great. Many people I know stay at the Disney hotels, but I feel you can get a lot more for less money by just driving 10 minutes each way. You are also not restricted to the highly overpriced meals at the Disney restaurants. The Ritz being surrounded by a golf course allows you to relax and not see cars whizzing by all the time, yet its a very short drive to the interstate. Overall, its not a bad location. Consider it more of a 4* hotel and you will be happier. On that note, don't pay anything more than $200 a night for their lower level rooms. If they are not discounting the rooms enough, try another hotel - Orlando has hundreds - even if it is the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Patrick150
Reviews.Content: A second visit to this Ritz Carlton. Whilst it is still clean and comfortable, it is expensive. In particular, the menu and wine list have become very costly within the hotel - whatever your means, this can be off-putting. The hotel has lost some of its 'frills' in terms of service since the recession hit. On the plus side, it is a fabulous building and this is an experience to behold in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, comfort and fun, not for the casual”
Reviews.Author: sthrottlemeyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Orlando in January, 2010 with two young girls, aged 5 and 2. Its location near Seaworld was convenient to the airport and major attractions. As expected, the staff was superb and did not fail to attend to any detail of our trip. Each visit past the front desk was a chance for the girls to have a cup of ice cream, and everyone was quite tolerant of the kids in this very adult establishment. The highlights of this property for us was the pool, more specifically the pool this hotel shares with its sister resort next door, the JW Marriott. It was a paradise for the kids, and they would have stayed there all day if left to their own devices. Owing to the very slow time of year for tourists, it was relatively deserted, and we found no need to shell out for the rental of tubes to float on the lazy river. The golf course looked very inviting, and the entire property was impeccably maintained. We got a nice tour of the property after a guided kayak tour, which was fun. Note to families traveling with youngsters: some of the restaurants in both of these hotels are talked up by hotel staff to be casual and family-friendly, but I would suggest for breakfast or brunch only; older patrons/romantic couples were definitely not amused by our kids, no matter how well-behaved. The beds and pillows passed a stringent comfort expectation set by my wife, who slept like a baby each night.

Reviews.Title: “What a Ritz should be”
Reviews.Author: dallasdr
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the service and amenities that one associates with the name Ritz-Carlton. Warm, friendly service, excellent facilities, and outstanding restaurants. Unlike Ritz Carlton hotels in other places like Westchester, this hotel is well managed.

Reviews.Title: “The Service Is Beyond Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Allstarcheerleading
Reviews.Content: If you are in the Orlando Area and are looking for a classy amazing resort without mickey mouse evreywhere you turn, you have found your resort. The Minute you walk in thier are ice cold lemonades waiting upon your arrival and even a kids check in. The Food is expeptional. Families beware you may never want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoatMom
Reviews.Content: A trip to the Ritz-Carlton has never disappointed me, and this trip was no exception. Great service and attitude was displayed by all. I stayed in the Club Level, and the food presentations were excellent. The lounge is a great place to relax and have a glass of wine in the evening. The pool was great, again, staff displayed great service. I was at a convention but elected to stay at the Ritz instead of the convention hotel. So glad I did!

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Get Much Better in Orlando - Go For Club Floor”
Reviews.Author: danielleflorida
Reviews.Content: We are repeat guests of this property and have visisted many other RC hotels through U.S. This resort has one of the largest and most accomodating Club Floors imaginable. The staff have incredible memories as far as your likes/dislikes and cater to those throughout your stay. Perfect place for a family and equally nice for romantic get-away. The Spa is very large with great gym - try the Ashiatsu massage with JoJo. Next door Marriot offers casual sushi lounge in lobby, which is perfect for quick bite. We did notice large conference groups while we were there, but it seems they keep busy as the pool and restaurants were pretty empty. Only downside was the recent change in toiletries - they used to always offer Bulgari products, which were fabulous, and now have changed to a standard type product. Not a huge deal, but the other was such a nice touch. Highly recommend resort - splurge for Club Floor, staff and lounge are well worth extra money. Easy to drive over to parks if thats what you are visiting for. Otherwise, nice to get lost within the hotel grounds and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Some early signs of concern”
Reviews.Author: jsjsjsjs
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in late January, and it was rainy/cloudy/cold the entire time - certainly not the fault of the Ritz. However there were signs that the property is changing since our first stay just 10 months ago (Apr '09). The hotel is now almost fully booked, attributed to groups and conventions probably at discounted rates. We respect their need to find ways to navigate this difficult economy, but the British guests who infected the hotel during our stay from Smith & Nephew were outright rude and obnoxious. Examples include leaving broken champagne bottles in the elevator and loud partying outside of our room at 3:00 a.m. We found it challenging to find ways to occupy our time in Orlando without good weather. The hotel wasn't much help when we asked the concierge for ideas. Our last night there we asked the concierge for a wine bar idea and she came up with Capital Grille because they have a good wine list. I responded we want more of a Tapas style restaurant. She responded by recommending Rachel's, which we later learned was a Topless style restaurant ! Another frustration is the business center, which the Ritz claims is not run by them. We had to pay about $15 for computer use when we wanted to change our return flight. At the Holiday Inn Express customers can use a PC without charge ! When we checked out we were asked how we liked our stay, to which we politely replied that the accomodations were fine but the overall stay was not all that great due to the weather. The two young ladies asked us where we were from, and upon learning it was Cleveland, Ohio they sarcastically asked us if the weather was any better in Cleveland ! Pretty rude and obnoxious when you're paying about $350/night. That said, most of our service at the hotel was at the standard one would expect at the Ritz..

Reviews.Title: “Scenic Beauty”
Reviews.Author: dbhatia
Reviews.Content: What a phenomenal experience it was to be at the beautiful landscape of Ritz Carlton, an soother to the restless souls. It’s far from the busy downtown, with a huge lake surrounded by a picturesque Golf course. An absolute paradise in US. The Hotel offers guidance about the city and also provides shuttles for easy transports. The location is just 20 mins from the Airport. Universal studio is within 30 mins from the hotel. The food offered in various varieties of the world. They also have JW Marriot next door, perhaps the same compound, which is again beautifully crafted and designed. An unconditional treat to the guest. I was on a Business Trip so couldn’t go out to explore much of Orlando, still have no regrets – full marks to RITZ CARLTON !!!! Cheers !!

Reviews.Title: “26 hours of perfection - go now!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoArS
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing 26 hours with the special occasion package. The room was gorgeous, the service unparalleled. They gave us a free pass for the spa the first day since there weren't too many people around. It's a gorgeous facility. The breakfast buffet is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Ritz Resort”
Reviews.Author: Z3PML
Reviews.Content: We spent new Years at the Ritz Grande Lakes being in town for the Capital One Bowl Football Game. I traveled with my wife and two "20 something" children. Other than the weather which the Ritz can't control, the stay was perfect. A little shaky on check-in as our rooms were not avaialble until 5PM when promised for 3PM, but they bought us dinner to make up for the lateness so...how can you complain? The rooms were spotless - one small mechanical problem was taken care of in 5 minutes after I called. Every employee of the Ritz went out of their way to make us feel welcome - most called us by name remembering it from the first or second interaction. The lobby bar was great with excellent drinks and snacks. The Vineyard was outstanding (a little noisy the night we were there as there were 2 large family groups having a loud good time) but the food was excellent. We had New Years Eve dinner at Norman's - quite an expereince although the menu was a little out there for my "steak and potatoes" children - but none the less - excellent. We also ate at the JW Marriott property next door (Primo restaurant)and thought it was the best dinner of the stay. It was a quick walk - all indoor - through the conference center to get there. Very nice. I have played golf on the course before but not this time and it is a great course. The SPA is also world class - also went there before but not this time. The pool area is not the largest of some Orlando Hotels, but it is the best run in my opinion. Pool was heated which was also greatly needed this week. Spotless, modern, gorgeous resort. Top of the list of favorites for us in Orlando! One last point - they put on one of the best fireworks displays at midnight on new years eve that we have ever seen. It rivaled anything you would see at Disney/Universal, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ufrc75
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a quick get away or to stay somehwere nice and get away from the disney craziness. The pool is very nice, the service excellent. I am a fan of the psa, which is one of the nicest I have ever been. The rooms are nice, specifically the bathroom, which is enormous (typical ritz). I am not a fan of the Ritz Carlton French Country style with all the patterns, I wish theywould update their style. It is nice having a balcony. If you stay there and are ok with splurging, east at Norman's. It is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The qualities of a 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin1973
Reviews.Content: I found this to be an excellent hotel that catered to my every need. From the decor to the service by the staff I found this to be one of the best services I have ever experienced. I would definatley recommend this to any and all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful memories for a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: lewisnyc
Reviews.Content: We wanted to take a very short (long weekend) trip to Orlando for a change of scenery. We did a lot of research into which property to visit and decided on the Ritz. We knew, as a Ritz, that the property was bound to be lovely, but we were not prepared for just how spectacular a place this is. The property itself was positively stunning from a physical standpoint, both inside and out. Our standard room was very nice, with a large comfortable bathroom. Everything was perfectly clean and comfortable. The service was excellent. Everyone we encountered was professional, polite and extremely friendly! Finally, and certainly not least of all, we were positively blown away by the food. Everything - room service, breakfast at the Vineyard Grill, lunch by the pool, lunch at the Spa and dinner at Norman's - was phenomenal. The food rivals meals we've had at some of the best restaurants in the US. Again, service was warm, friendly and professional. We are so excited to return and to spend more time in Orlando at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “A great Orlando Get Away”
Reviews.Author: MichiganJim2009
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to this Ritz. It never lets you down. The staff is understated but very friendly. The entire property is very clean. Housekeeping is attentitive and thourough. The restaurants serve a wide variety and are family friendly. Normans is the best. I am surpirsed every time how good it is. The pool ws not crowded but it was cool weather. There was still pool staff and wait staff for food and beverage regardless of the temps. It is close enough to Disney to go and come back and the Outlet Malls too if you desire. It is nice every evening to be away from the Kingdom and settle in for a lower key property. You will not be disapointed at Ritz Grand Lakes....I promise.

Reviews.Title: “A great escape from the Disney madness.”
Reviews.Author: catsoho
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day family trip and I can't say enough how perfect this place was. We had a family package for two adjoining rooms and were upgraded to a Jr suite with an adjoining room. Needless to say we had more than enough space for my husband a two little girls age 2 and 3 (3 balconies!). Even if we did not get upgraded we would of been happy with the rooms. From the little Ritz robes and slippers to the kids free ice cream they were spoiled rotten. They really doted on them with little gifts the entire stay. This place is a nice oasis to break from the over stimulation of Disney. We went 3 days to Disney (12 minutes away) and this location is perfect. The hotel is very clean, service was excellent I look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: Seminole97
Reviews.Content: The Ritz in Orlando is one our favorite hotel and Ritz property we have stayed at to date. We have stayed at several Ritz Carlton properties, in several states, over the years and this has become our second home! The grounds and hotel lobby is superb. The staff is awesome! The executive suite is what we always reserve and it is by far the best way to go with a 4 and 6 year old. Normans resteraunt is out of this world good! The pool area is the best. We truly love this place!

Reviews.Title: “It was a Ritz Carlton!”
Reviews.Author: moogie14a
Reviews.Content: My wife was attending a conference at the Grande Lake resort area, my kids and I tagged along to hang out in the sun and have some fun, being from the Chicagoland area, anything south would be better. Upon arriving at the Ritz Carlton we weren't disappointed. My wife was originally booked at the J.W. Marriott next door, which isn't shabby, but was upgraded along with her colleague to the Ritz Carlton. There was a parking valet, a bellhop all waiting for us, there is no self parking at this hotel. My wife checked in and immediately taken to our room. The rooms are a bit more spacious then the J.W. Marriott and all rooms have balconies. We had room number 641 which overlooked the front entrance and was by the elevators. I believe this balcony was a little larger then most since it had a semi enclosed area and wasn't fully exposed. The bed in the room was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on in a hotel, this is no exageration. All rooms utilize bvlgari soaps and lotions, even the toilet paper was softer then most hotels... seriously! We didn't utlize many of the other services spending most of our time at the Ritz pool. The hotel shares ammenities with the J.W. Marriott, which has a lazy river, among other items, we decided to stay. One of the nice touches were pool attendants coming around with samples of smoothies and pieces of fruit. Also there is complementary bottled water at the front desk, valet parking station as well was towel area. When calling down for getting the car, the vehicle was usually there or was there within 5 minutes of arriving out front. The longest we waited for was the bellhop when checking out. This was to be expected since we waited until the last minute to check out. Although the Grade Lakes resort isn't near anything, it is within a short driving distance to most of the attracitons. When the conference was over we did move to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large yet friendly and a perfect base to return to”
Reviews.Author: Earthman83
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed our recent stay here.We were on the club floor (14th iirc) with a large room and terrace overlooking the lake.Our check in experience was effecient and very friendly with just enough chatter to know that the agent was taking an interest in us but not overbearing in a way that would seem false. In fact everyone working at the hotel seemed to know how to do homely here. The hotel is styled like a typical large ritz carlton but with service that was more than capable of coping with being busy. For instance there was a lot of convention activity at the hotel and you wouldn't even notice as people were being looked after and service was prompt at all the facilities. We found the bar and lounge area to have that typically RC comfy feel about it with fine chairs and sofa's. Normans restaurant here is an absolute MUST.It's not managed by the hotel but seamlessly fits into it and boy it is an asset. We ate there twice meaning we didn't mind the expense, the food and wine was so good! If you are European..think Michelin star's and you get the idea. We also ate at the other restaurant in the hotel and while more casual it was another good cheaper option. While I'm here I'd like to say having access to the club lounge here is well worth it. They have a good display of snack bites throughout the day to which some preparation is given.They also do a nice continental breakfast there but we had a full American included so ate at the hotels main restaurant in the morning-nice coffee and a totally tasty buffet with a chefs special each day that was mouth watering. I like a breakfast area that has an omlette station too and this one was very good! The club lounge here is a nice escape to read a paper or to check emails as theres a complimentary pc and printer. It also has a media room where you can close the door and watch a dvd with some friends with surround sound! We found the terrace there very relaxing in the evening sun aswell to sit out overlooking the golf course whilst sipping some wine. In short this hotel is on my list for a definite return and to be honest I will run out of characters because there are too many good things to say about it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: rclaire_cullen
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at this hotel for1 week in early September and were so impressed with every part of the hotel and its staff! We had a room on the 8th floor overlooking the beautiful grounds of the hotel and because it was Labor weekend we were treated to a superb fireworks show on our second night courtesy of the Ritz Carlton. What a start to our holiday! The rooms themselves were lovely, especially the bathrooms are of a very high standard. They were always kept to an exceptional level of cleanliness and we cant praise the maid staff enough. We did not eat a any of the restaurants on site but did have room service one night and the quality of the food was superb therefore if this anything to go by then i wouldnt hesitate recommending that guests try the restaurants. We had no problem with checking out and our bill was correct - the only minor gripe would be the valet parking costs but a small price to pay for a top quality hotel! We have previously stayed at 2 other hotels in Orlando but if we return in the future the Ritz Carlton will be the place we stay!

Reviews.Title: “ahh.perfect”
Reviews.Author: livingthegoodliezzz
Reviews.Content: What can I say.The grounds are beautiful. The service is excellent, The rooms are perfect. The childrens' activities are amazing. You might pay a little more, but remember you get what you pay for. The only minor flaw was that the valet seemed to be pre occupied and not in a hurry to help out. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, we were surprised at the seclusion & nature that close to Orlando & the theme parks”
Reviews.Author: renicksc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a quick weekend getaway trip without the kids to the Ritz in Orlando. We had a phenomenal experience all around. The staff was very professional and everyone went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. Room was great. Spacious bathroom with separate tub, shower and w/c separate from double vanity. private balcony was small (perfectly adequate with chairs & table for 2 people) had a great view of pool, golf course and lakes. We had a couple massage at the spa. It was very enjoyable and the facilities are wonderful. Only complaint is that it was pretty busy but that's what we get for a holiday weekend. We retreated to the spa pool and were able to get some quiet even though it was full. Dinners - The Vineyard Grill ground floor of the Ritz. I had a great filet, my wife the rainbow trout special which was excellent as well. Diverse menu, great service. Normans first floor of the RItz. More upscale than Vineyard Grill. This one is open for dinner only and has a business casual dress code. Dubbed "Floribbean" there are daily changes and a lot of Latin American influences and varying flavors in each dish. Everything we ordered was fantastic. Also not that it was cheap, but I was expecting to pay more for "fine dining" and was pleasantly surprised. I've paid more for less at Morton's, Ruth's Chris and others. We had room service twice and were thoroughly impressed both times. Food was excellent compared to most other places I've been and the service was great! Bill (the head of in room dining department) genuinely wants to make sure everyone is well taken care of. There were a number of families and all the kids seemed to be having a good time too. It was Labor Day weekend and the staff had activities planned at the pool and in the kids area. We hadn't considered it before, but will certainly have this hotel on the list for our next trip with the children. Only negatives or insight - if you're looking for a child free trip you might want to go to the pool at the spa which is adults only. Also, poolside drinks & food are pricey but what you'd expect at a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: flowEssex
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel , but I travelled with my 2 small children and we got put in a small room for four of us on the 9th floor , the balcony was really dangerous which surprise me , the balconies are low and they have a small table and chairs which is placed at the edge of the balcony after 2 minutes in the room my 4 year old had climbed up on the table and was leaning over the edge of the balcony and could very easily have fallen had we not grabbed her , I refused to stay in this room and we got moved to the 1st floor., as we had only been given one room for 4 of us as part of our package we asked how much it would be to up grade to a suite or how much it would be for a joining room . we were offered a rate of $199 per night for a joining room we were staying for 14 nights so my husband asked if we could get a discount the manager refused to budge on the price which we thought was a bit mean but we decided to pay it , my husband then heard the manager giving a rate of $189 to another customer , having NOW read previous reviews and seeing that many people got FREE up grades to suites its even more puzzling as to why the manager refused us even a discount we were paying for 2 rooms for 2 weeks. My other problem with the hotel was extra charges we booked this hotel because it had a kids club but we didn't know they would charge for it ,it was about $10 per hour per child plus they then charged for material for arts and crafts like paints and canvas's: all in all too expensive. I have never been charged for kids club before but maybe they are just free in Europe I am not sure. We ate in the hotel every night which was expensive but easy as we were at theme parks most days and there are not restaurants with in walking distance we thought the food got a bit boring. We ended up having a hefty bill at the end of our 2 week stay the final insult was to be charged $21 a day for parking our car , I can understand this if its a city hotel and space is limited but as it isn't this seemed unjustified. We would not have been surprised to see a charge for the view! We stayed at Disney in Febuary and when we come back to Orlando again will stay there. This is a good hotel for couples but not for young kids especially the problem with balconies. We can't fault the cleanliness of the hotel and the courtesy of the staff , some of them really went out their way to look after us particularly the pool staff and house keeping , We feel the manager treated us unprofessionally and made us feel unwelcome and under valued. I also feel this hotel is too expensive for most families particularly during recession.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carla015
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay at this hotel. Fantastic staff who cannot do enough to help. Some members of staff even remembered us from 12 months before. Beautiful pool. Does get busy round the pool at weekends but during the week very pleasant with lots of free sunbeds.

Reviews.Title: “Best Brithday EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: nancygamez
Reviews.Content: My husband brought me here for my 30th birthday. Hotel - lovely like all the Ritz'. Food was great. Pool was perfect. Lots of kids but what can you expect from Orlando. While our stay there we got to meet and talk to some of the Laker's as they were staying there. Perfect distance to all the Disney parks. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spa Weekend”
Reviews.Author: kmkm
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my mom away for her 75th birthday, and a "Spa weekend" was a perfect idea. We live in Orlando, and I could not leave town, so I thought I'd try the Ritz Carlton. It was a perfect vacation, while staying in town - I felt like I was a million miles away. The staff made us feel special from the moment we arrived. They were very good about recognizing my mother's birthday from the time we checked in, to the time at the spa, and we even had a small gift with a birthday card waiting in our room for us. The room was lovely, we sat on our balcony drinking wine while viewing of the golf course & sea world. Sunday brunch in the "Vineyard" was excellent. As the Ritz is connected to the Marriott, we did a little "pub crawl" and had cocktails and appetizers in several spots between the 2 hotels. The spa is just fabulous. I would definitely put this down as a winner for a special weekend or celebration. Very expensive, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Only 5 star option in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: asia6666
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay , excellent food at both the steakhouse and the signature restaurant, great bar at poolside, lovely massage and spa (easily the best in Orlando) . The best thing is to come here after the Disney parks and just return to peace and quality. Duty Manager was very attentive and professional - the type of service you only get in Ritz. Golf course only one in Orlando with caddies , which was kind of novel. I thought they made a mistake as my golf was $107 for green fees, clubs, balls, caddie. Very good value

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Comfort & Style”
Reviews.Author: caramber
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton for the first three days of a 2 week vacation in Orlando. Despite its size, every aspect of the hotel felt personal and of a high quality. Breakfasts were excellent, catering for each of our family member 's requirements. We mostly dined out but bar-menu items were first-rate. We had in-laws with four children visit for one afternoon and were able to take full advantage of the facilities with them. We loved the lazy river at the adjacent JW Marriott and our own pool. Martin, the bar-man at the pool bar (Bleu), was especially courteous and helpful. Having decided to spend most of the vacation in a rented villa, our stay at the Ritz Carlton certainly spoiled us and has made us consider making this our base for the entirety of our next visit to Orlando. Our only gripes, minor ones, are that exclusively valet-only parking gets a bit wearisome if you want to to and fro from the hotel a few times a day and paying separately for wifi access seems a bit unnecessary for a hotel of this stature.

Reviews.Title: “A well managed Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: IADbound
Reviews.Content: Spent three (3) nights at resort with family. Entrance is discrete and attractively landscaped—visually impressive fountain fronts the hotel. Valet was much better than advertised, as porte-cochere is very wide (enough places to stash cars). Front desk and concierge are easily found, but tucked away. Lobby is predominantly muted marble and very inviting. Lobby Lounge, sitting behind lobby, overlooking an open (concrete) space fronting the pool area, is a nice spot for drinks—service is prompt. Rooms are certainly “Ritz Carlton” standard, but nothing to rave about. Flat screen televisions present well, but without HDTV (as with all hotels), who cares. Extremely comfortable bed and linens will put you to sleep quickly (in a good way). Separate shower and water closet make the bathroom. Get a suite on the Club Level and I can see spending a week here. Grounds of the resort (including neighboring JW Marriot) make for nice walking environment—albeit a small area. Interestingly shaped pool provides dozens of private coves and is no more than 5.5 feet deep at center. Service is very good with staff taking direct ownership of problems/requests. Minor snafus occur, but such is life. Club Lounge is long and narrow with half dozen or so sitting areas smartly separated by thoughtful furniture position. Club Lounge food and service is up to par and family friendly. Area surrounding hotel is residential (conveniently replete with Starbuck, banks, Publix etc.). The Sea World family of theme parks are right down the road, and even Disney is only a 20-minute drive down I-4. Overall, think very highly of the Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton does it again! Luxury at its finest!”
Reviews.Author: Financier_LLC
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We stayed at the club level for a week to enjoy the sights of Orlando. The spa was awesome, the golf course was amazing. Watch out for the occasional celebrity as Kobe and the lakers were celebrating their win in orlando during our stay. Ritz Carlton defines luxury. Not far from the outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: Deb32
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property twice in last 6 months at business conference. The usual fabulous Ritz service which never lets you down. The property is beautiful and maintained down to the last blade of grass. All rooms are quite spacious and have balconies; request a pool view w/private balcony (walls on both sides) if privacy is important. Otherwise the balconies all lined up in a row. All food at venues were consistently wonderful. Beautiful spa; not a golfer but the course looked lovely. Would enjoy staying there again. It is very isolated; if you don't have a car it will be expensive to taxi around to other locations. Did not go next door to the Marriott (its sister hotel) but heard good things about it also.

Reviews.Title: “A Gorgeous Hotel with a Great Spa”
Reviews.Author: napagirl2
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge on the club level since we were having a special birthday celebration. We feel that it was worth every penny and we would recommend spending the extra if you are celebrating a special occasion. The club level rooms are not any larger than the regular rooms. The club level is on the 14th floor and the views from the lounge are beautiful. The staff in the lounge is very accommodating. The food is great. Breakfast consists of eggs, oatmeal, cheeses, bagels, pastries etc.. Plenty of food for a hearty breakfast. You can help yourself to coffee, tea and they have a great espresso, cappuccino machine. Lunch is served from 12-2. The wine and champagne comes out around noon and you can have as much as you want. They also serve beer and mixed drinks which the staff will bring to your table. Lunch is great sandwiches and salads. Light offerings are served from 5-8 and dessert from 8-10 with cordials. If you choose to, you can sit in this lounge all day and night and just eat and drink. You feel relaxed and pampered. We only had one complaint about this lounge. One night hotel guests brought in friends of theirs who were staying at the JW Marriott which is right next door. They were a very large party with many young children. The kids were out of control and very noisy. We couldn't even check our email. They were spread out all over the floor playing games etc... We left because we couldn't take it. It seems that anything goes at this place because the staff doesn't want to offend any of the guests. Well what about the guests who don't have unruly kids who are bothering others? The pool is gorgeous and it wasn't crowded at all. The guests from the JW are allowed to use this pool. Don't let anyone at the pool hog the blue floats that are free and can be used by all guests at the Ritz. People who are sitting by the pool try and take the floats and put them by their chairs even when they are not in use. I had 2 old biddies from the JW cop an attitude when I took one so that I could use it. I don't agree with their policy of allowing the JW people the use the Ritz pool but the properties are adjoining. The staff at the pool sets you up with chaise lounges with nice towels and an umbrella if you wish. They have cabanas for rent. 200 for the day, 100 for half a day. The cabana is very nice if you want to splurge. They have a fridge, a safe and a tv. We got one for the day and had a nice time. Our only complaint was that we thought the staff could have been more attentive and took things away like wet towels and garbage. A waiter came by a few times to ask if we needed anything from the bar but that was about all of the service we received. I would recommend the spa to anyone. It is huge and beautiful. I had the best massage that I ever had at this hotel. I would recommend the 80 minute signature massage. 50 minutes just isn't enough and 80 minutes is so much better. I was lucky enough to have Rick V. as my masseuse. He was very professional and wonderful. I felt like a million bucks after my massage. I would recommend him to anyone. You can call and request Rick if you would like to. Originally I had called and requested a woman. After meeting Rick, he put me at total ease and he didn't disappoint me. I would go back to this spa just to have a massage with Rick. The spa has their own private pool and you can have lunch there if you wish. Your partner can also get a spa day pass for 20 dollars if they just want to use the pool with you for the day. Overall we were very happy with this resort and would recommend it to anyone and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: jimglobe
Reviews.Content: The property itself is beautiful. Wonderful grounds, great walking trail. Landscaping is fantastic. I didn't use the Ritz pool. I used the JW Marriott next door (which you can for free). They have a lazy river at the JW Marriott, and the entire pool area at the Marriott is way bigger and nicer....especially is you have kids. The room is smallish but nicely furnished. Very clean. Large wonderful bathroom. Service was mostly good. The valet service is very slow. They did a really poor job for a 5 star resort. Free ice cream hunt for the kids. Nice touch Fitness center was very nice. Great equipment, and large assortment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... but not five stars...”
Reviews.Author: higpaws12
Reviews.Content: Before I book anywhere I have started reading all the reviews for lodging and I have found more frequently than not that the most experienced travelers are the ones who know what to complain about in relation to the expectations set forth by star ratings and such. I have to say I agree with most of the positive ratings but also agree w/many of the negatives. First, the property is just phenomenally beautiful. The landscaping and decor, design, flow and function of the place are superb. It is immaculately kept. If I were reviewing just these factors, it would be TEN stars. It is both luxurious and friendly, romantic and suitable for families (who know how to behave, that is...). I stayed in a deluxe room with two small children (ages 4 and 6) and found it to be very comfortable for the three of us, and one night we had local guests and slept five with a rollaway squeezed in, had in-room dining twice, and we made it work. The room is very well equipped for a business traveler and is less comfy for children- no DVD player, lots of hook ups for business equipment., teeny fridge packed to the gills with the Ritz' "entertainment items" (read $8 water, etc) and I was barely able to squeeze in a few things I picked up for my diet-sensitive family. Big closet, generous hangers and valets. Not enough drawers for all of us. The room was mainly prepared as I'd asked. My son is sensitive to down and I'd asked for it to be removed entirely from one bed, and it was, but they had 4 foam pillows on one bed and only two down on the other bed. Kind of odd. We all got luscious robes (ask for robes in your children's sizes and don't forget the slippers) but for some reason my housekeeper (who was NOT tipped, read on there...) refused to leave me slippers all five days we were there. As others noted the bathrooms are HUGE for hotel baths in any case. Elegant and well appointed. We did not eat at the Grill or Norman's. We ate outdoors mainly at Bleu (food, great. Service, sketchy... the first time I ate there after I had to get my own adult menus. the waiter asked how we were and I responded I'd be better if I did not have to get my own menus... hmmmm... then it took ten minutes to get the kids' menu... which BTW is the same throughout the resort. Just memorize it day one and you'll have an easier time of it). Bleu is only open mid-morning to 4:30 and I don't suggest trying it too close to closing time. Quench next door at the JW is a fine alternative... food is not as good but I found the staff. and bar staff to be friendlier and more service-oriented. I could care less how polite you are so long as I get my food, as ordered, and provide me with prompt and efficient service. Omne not so great experience was followed with one that was just great so I'd call it hit or miss. Complaints about pool service are warranted. There was generally one person on staff for the entire pool... for towels, chair set up, refreshments, spontaneous fun stuff they include for kids/families like S'mores at the firepit near the pool, etc... so Glen who we saw most (and was GREAT!) had to tapdance quite a bit and I heard people grumbling about him, but he is only one person spread thin. The pool itself and seating, great. Towels soft and warm if you don't mind getting them yourself. The lazy river next door was great and while the floaties are overpriced for us it was worth the $14 to have them pre-blown up and my kids loved that we wrote all over them and we brought them home with us. The pool at the Ritz is not deep and just fine for the kids. They have nice adult size foam floats, big fountain spray was fun for them. We booked on the kids-free program and it was well worth it. In fact we paid less overall. including food here at the Ritz than we did for Concierge-level service at a luxury Disney resort and I think the kids liked it just as much. Now other service... the valets do a poor job of handling busy times and provide complete service. For the daily cost plus tips (still worth it if you will be in and out a lot, otherwise park with "the peasants" as a guest said...) I timed it so that I wasn't in or out at peak times, mostly, but that should not matter in a five star, ever. The bell staff mainly held the main central doors open. I did not find them particularly helpful other than taking bags to/from the room. Unlike others I did not find it took too long to get the car but I made a point of calling down for it ten minutes in advance. I did have a maintenance issues that went unresolved that was quite annoying. The bathroom (lovely. well equipped. gross mouthwash tastes like the shower gel which does smell great... but lay off if you have sensitive skin as it is drying as other reviewers noted) water pressure is awesome and the showerhead feels like acupuncture, in a good way. However- that same pressure made the toilet that has (I say has., sure it still does) a slow leak the NOISIEST toilet in the UNIVERSE. No kidding, the re-fill on it woke me up at night with the AutoMystery Flushing. It would slowly leak just enough to flush itself and refill. I could not hear the leaking. I COULD hear the toilet refilling.Not just a little. I mean it sounded like a water cannon blasting the porcelain top tank. It was so bad my last night there I went to the bar and had two drinks (I am a lightweight) in the hope of sleeping all night and even over my snoring, it woke me. I called maintenance too many times for this issue which could have been easily resolved and was not, ever. It's a toilet, not rocket science. I did share another negative experience that others ran in to with billing. I was supposed to present a voucher everywhere for the kids eat free program. That in and of itself is a silly annoyance. It is one child per paying adult so I should have been paying for one of my two children's meals. Every time for the first three days I had an issue. I heard "we'll fix that for you" frequently. We got in-room service a LOT and every time I'd have to call for a correction which did not happen. It was resolved to my benefit however in response to my other issues, and all the children's meals were taken off the bill. Lastly I had an issue with housekeeping. No- a few issues. As other posters reported, sometimes you get turn down. Sometimes you don't. There was a glass in my bathroom that had a black icky thing in the bottom of it, so I put it at the edge of the counter to see if it would be washed the next day. It was not. Same thing the next day. And the next day. And the next day. The first day the coffee bar was not completely refreshed and since I'm a caffeine head, this was an issue. The maid took a soaked floor mat (still a mystery how it got that way...) and moved it instead of replacing it with a fresh one. The maids at Disney were more thorough and thoughtful. It was not all bad by any means and in general we enjoyed many things about the property. Rent one of the Italian bikes and drive around the properties! There are bunnies everywhere that are not afraid and my kids loved that. Try to time it so there are no weddings to interrupt... and a lovely place for a weddind it is. Inm fact I'd say it's a better business property than anything else. Many locals visit the restaurants and the lobby bar which is very nice.The chef's garden and butterfly garden were delightful for my children. The children's play area was safe and fun for them. You will not be served food there from the outdoor grill but you CAN get room service there. Go figure. Gratuities are included. Good if the service warrants it and I'd say it's up to you to be sure that you get your money's worth there. I found the meals there no pricier than at the Marriott and the Angus burgers were excellent. Breakfast was ok. Pastries - the danishes good, everything else just ok. Skip the bagels. The tomato basil flatbread at Bleu was huge and could feed two In all the annoyances were **not** a deal-killer, but they do not at all equate to 5-star service. 5-star property with maybe 3.5 service at best. I am planning on going back twice this year because it is STILL better than what else you'll find out there no matter the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: FroggyWestSussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night with my wife and daughter. This was at the start of our holiday. I let the hotel know when booking that it would be my birthday. On arrival we got upgraded to a suite with a pool view. Great attention to detail. Every member of staff we interacted with was helpful and seemed happy in their role. The room, although in need of a little updating - being really picky here! - was exceedingly comfortable. The pool and surroundings again were great. The only slight niggle I had was the cost of the meal we had in the Vineyard Grill, it did not deliver the quality expected. Lunch and breakfast were very good. We would stay at the Ritz again in Orlando without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Kinsa
Reviews.Content: Was only here for 3 nights while my husband was attending a conference at the RItz, so my use of the facilities is not as extensive as others. You really can't go wrong staying at this hotel - it is a beautiful resort. Nicely laid out, beautiful nature all around, easy walk to the JW Marriott and use of all of their facilities. The standard rooms are not overly big for a Ritz, but they are fine, nicely appointed overall. The service is typical Ritz, anything you could want will be done with a smile. Pool area is nice and quiet no screaming kids, the pool has lots of raft floaties which are nice, added bonus if you are traveling with kids is the use of the JW Marriott's fantastic lazy river pool. Maybe that's why the Ritz pool is so nice and quiet. Poolside drink/food service is pretty lame, had to flag someone down every time I needed something, but really this is the only criticism I can think of, so the Ritz is doing pretty good overall. The gym is really nice, a bit of a walk from the rooms, but hey, you get your exercise getting there! I didn't use the spa, but my husband had a massage and said it was great - they are offering a lot of discounts right now on spa services so make sure to ask around before you book. Restaurants are typical Ritz with delicious food - also recommend highly the Italian restaurant at the Marriott - delicious! Valet parking is the only option, I believe it was $22 night. A rip off, but what are you going to do? No other option. Overall very nice experience, and if you don't like this hotel you must be very hard to please!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL! Beautiful and romantic- will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SBJ486
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first anniversary. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in!! Service was exceptional- everything you could expect for the Ritz. I loved the Victorian-style furnishings (rivals Disney's Grand Floridian resort, which is the utmost in luxury!) and the bathroom was incredible with separate marble shower and tub. The only draw-back is the location is not desirable to Orlando attractions. The hotel was beautiful and they made our first anniversary one to remember!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: thebridekiddo
Reviews.Content: After much debate with my husband we decided to go to the USA for a holiday instead of Jumeriah Beach in Dubai. I am so glad we did. We stayed between the 10th and 17th of May 2009. It is a hotel which is about 15 minutes drive from the Disney Parks. What a fantastic hotel! The hotel is very beautiful and opulent. It has ample staff working there, 4 people to open the door for us and wish us a good day when leaving and entering! We had a hire car and used their valet parking facility $20 for the day plus tips. They were very friendly and always asked if we needed directions. Always gave bottles of water and helped with the luggage. You can be cheeky and just park in the Marriott car park but we didn't. The rooms are really nice and big. Separate shower from the bath which is a nice touch. Tea and coffee making facilities, iron and ironing board. The rollaway bed was $15 a night and well worth it as we needed a good night sleep after the parks. The balcony was lovely as was the pool view. I didn't let the kids on the balcony on their own and I didn't think it was too safe (4 and 1 year old). The breakfast was a buffet for $50 a day 2 adults including children (kids eat free). Alot of variety and it was very tasty. My daughter couldn't get enough pancakes and maple syrup! If you can sit outside for breakfast it had such a nice view and not many people out there. The Ritz has 2 pools, the kids pool is quite nice with a adventure frame to play on and the main pool is great with an adjoining whirl pool. It wasn't too busy and the staff again were only too happy to lay some towels out for us with a sun shade. Just a 2 minute walk to the Marriott hotel means you can use their lazy river pool which was very nice too. Although alot of leafs and bits were in it. You have to buy a rubber ring for about $5 but it means you can keep it. We decided to leave ours as bringing back to the UK wasn't a sensible option! The Marriott also has a kids pool, volleyball court in sand and a pool table which are all again very good. Back at the Ritz we hired a bike for $20 and rode around the grounds in the midday heat which wasn't a sensible thing to do but great fun! I have to warn you it gets tiring after 5 minutes but the views are lovely of the lake and golf course. Lunch was always in the bar by the pool and it was just delicious, we had the beef burgers always! The chocolate mousse's and shakes went down very well with the kids and us. The Ritz has a spa facilitty in the grounds which is just amazing. That again is highly recommended. High speed internet was $10 for the day, it's all wireless so you can surf from anywhere. Checking out has to be done by 11:00am but our flight was at 6:00pm so they allowed us to check out late at 3:00pm. This is a very very nice hotel, the staff are all lovely, the grounds are beautiful and yes it is pricey but you get what you pay for. Worth every penny. We will be going back definitely next year!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Stay for a Family”
Reviews.Author: ztaboose
Reviews.Content: Wow...that pretty much sums it up. From the complimentary upgrade to an executive suite to the amazing service and child-centered mentality, my husband and I were blown away by this resort. We were a bit nervous about how child friendly this would be for our 2 year old, and even thought of moving to the JW Marriott which we thought might be a better option for a family, but this hotel and staff impressed us every step of the way. The room was amazing, very spacious and luxurious. The grounds were beautiful and immaculate. The staff aimed to please and exceed expectations. The staff treated our 2 year old as if she was royalty, even leaving a little gift for her in the room. Just amazing! Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious overnight”
Reviews.Author: steviegene
Reviews.Content: We stayed one (fantastic baby-free) night at the Ritz Orlando. It was, in a word, fantastic. Our room was spacious, with a nice view of the pool & lake. The bathroom was oversized, with double sinks, watercloset and marble floors. The staff was outstanding - going out of their way to accommodate and impress. The answer to every request was "its my pleasure". The grounds were beautiful set alongside the river - with a gazebo, walking paths, a bocce court, etc. The pool was stunning - with an infinity edge and fountains. The pool attendant brings you pool chair covers, and waiters come around taking drink orders. Its also a great bonus that you have access to the JW Marriott pool too, with its fun "lazy river". The only downsides I can see are... 1. I don't know how convenient it would be to stay here if you plan on visiting Disney everyday. We were not, so not an issue for us. 2. The valet parking is $20 each parking. Otherwise, no complaints - one of the nicest places we have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in a tranquil locale”
Reviews.Author: Proseco
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here during a very busy time---spring break/week leading up to Easter. We were upgraded from the JW Marriott and were quite thrilled that our room was exactly what we requested at check-in---golf course/pool view on an upper floor. The rooms are well appointed and staff overall is very attentive. Loved the quiet elegance of the pool area. Only negative was that I had to leave the outdoor cafe because I could not get waited on. This was made up by the courteous and speedy service I received in the lobby/bar area. I do get peeved that there is a daily charge for internet service ($9.95) and feel that a hotel of the Ritz's stature should comp this. I hear complaints all the time from fellow travelers about this---lesser hotels do not charge. The hotel is not far from Sea World and Universal and we were able to get around quite easily to Millenia Mall (absolutely beautiful) and restaurant row. Fitness Ctr was awesome---best I've been at in a hotel setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal415
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I decided to stay at the Ritz even though they live in Orlando because I was visiting from California and "they wanted me to come back." They chose well by bringing me to the Ritz. The service was excellent and the spa was fantastic. Don't miss the spa- you can check in early to enjoy the pool, gym, steam room, etc and make a day out of it. We worked out, enjoyed bloody marys by the pool, received our services and then recapped by the pool. The spa cafe is also great (I recommend the Bento Box). The property was beautiful and far exceeded my expectations of Orlando (I was half expecting to be greeted by Mickey Mouse when I checked in). I am headed back to Orlando next month for a conference and I switched my hotels after staying here and am looking forward to my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avalon99
Reviews.Content: Our family had a relatively short - 1 week vacation and wanted a good accommodations with quality. Our stay at the Ritz Carlton met and exceeded our expectations. From the minute we arrived the staff were outstanding in their attention to detail. They greeted us regularly by name and were accommodating at every turn. They could not enough for us. Despite being a high end hotel, they were extremely welcoming to families. The rooms were beautifully appointed. We have three children (8-11) and had adjoining rooms which I highly recommend. The hotel was neat, clean and luxurious as in Ritz Carlton style. The pool area was relaxing with beautiful scenery. The amenities such as the spa and fitness center - fabulous. The lighted pathway to The JW Marriott - the adjoining hotel is lovely. The "Lazy River" pool at the Marriott was great - (JW Marriott owns The Ritz Carlton). At The Ritz, we ate at "Bleu" - the pool side restaurant, The Lobby restaurant and The Vineyard Grill. Each had good choices on the menu and required "resort casual" attire which worked well for families. We did not eat at Norman's but the reviews are excellent. The children's menu had good healthy choices for the main course and sides which allowed several combinations with good portion size. You require a car to do any travel to the theme parks and the hotel requires valet service which costs $20/day +tips. This might be a turn off, but it is actually quite nice and is really what you would expect at a hotel of this quality. Overall, this was a great vacation and after a busy day at the theme parks or shopping, it was so nice to come back to a serene, beautiful environment to relax and wind down. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next vacation to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A top rate hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: tabathan
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised to read someone rated this a Motel 6. I think we may have been staying at different resorts? The Ritz-Carlton Orlando was one of the BEST hotels my husband and I have stayed in (and we have stayed in A LOT of Ritz Hotels - Singapore, Portugal, London, Berlin.) This Ritz did not disappoint. We took our three children with us this time (a first) and were astonished at everything the hotel had to offer in terms of activities, Ritz Kids programs, arts and crafts by the pool, Easter Egg hunts, Easter bunny deliveries to your room - you could even have the Easter bunny himself tuck your children into bed for you on two of the nights! As for the adults, it is as civilized and luxurious as any and all of the Ritz we have stayed at. The hotel was clean, the food was great, the staff were pleasant and the amenities were first class. My husband and I will most definately be going again - with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruann23
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a Ritz but have always wanted to stay in one and I can see now why the hotel is raved. It is fabulous. The main lobby is mesmerizing and our room was gorgeous. The bathroom, I must say, was my favorite. It was clean and very roomy. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “motel 6 service”
Reviews.Author: joelfranceusa
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel we stayed, service motel 6 level, food bellow average, very disappointing for a Ritz Carlton, we stayed at the Ritz in Tyson Corner, in NY, no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: aajjk
Reviews.Content: My first stay at a Ritz and the service completely lived up to any expectations. I am a pretty independent traveler and I was actually not used to such a level of assistance for my every whim. The Vineyard Grill was very nice. Excellent food and service- although it should be for the price and al a carte menu. The other clientele was generally a subdued crowd, business, older folks, etc. The grounds are lovely. Nice course, beautiful pool. The spa is wonderful. Nice service, supplying anything you might want or need. Also, the spa has a private pool for use only by spa customers which is another nice perq. Overall, the Ritz at Grande Lake was everything I would expect from such a caliber of hotel. No disappointment at all.

Reviews.Title: “great relaxing vacation at a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: tekma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise. This place was wonderful! The decor is beautiful. The spa is the best that I've ever seen! And the employees of the Ritz really go out of there way to make you feel special! We were traveling with our young children and they also thought the Ritz was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ritz Carlton, Best service, best of the best!!”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslandVic
Reviews.Content: I've visited this hotel several times and it is head and shoulders above any other hotel that I have been to. From the the valets to the front desk, housekeepers, everybody, the staff is fantastic! The food is amazing. Don't miss Sunday Brunch! Stay on the Club level for extra snacks and the fantastic concierge. I can't say enough good things about this place. Cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing spa vacation w/ spouse”
Reviews.Author: MaineMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned after 5 days here. After much research, we picked the Ritz because we did not have the kids and were not going to visit any parks. The AAA price made it affordable. The spa was definately worth a trip. Yes, they do auto-charge your room if you bring a car with their valet parking of $20/day. We knew that up front because of Tripadvisor. Checkin was easy. Upon arrival, they gave us a "best-view" room looking over the pool and golf course. Room is spacious. Bathroom includes double sink, separate room with toilet. There is a bath tub, as well as a shower - which is nice to not have to climb into a bathtub to take a shower. Nice flat screen TV. I would return just for the spa experience. We chose the couple's massage - cost more than a night's stay at the room, but we got a day within the spa - including sauna, steamroom, indoor jacuzzi (sorry, not co-ed). Also, you get access to the private out-door pool and jacuzzi to share w/ my husband. There are also "calming" rooms with fruit, teas, cushy recliners, blankets. When you arrive, they give you a robe and slippers to were. My husband cracked up when I told him that on the female side (sauna, steam room, indoor jacuzzi) all the women wore bathing suits. I guess the guys only wear towels? Even if you do not schedule a spa service, as a guest you can enjoy the spa areas for a daily fee - I think $20. The gym room is fully equipped. TV's at each of the aerobic machines - ear phones provided. Free weights as well as weight machines. Loved the infused waters adn fruit provided. Gym room is available free for guests at Ritz and Marriott. Restaurants on the property are expensive. We did eat at all of them and the meal at Norman's was wonderfule. Most of the other guests were there for business meetings it seemed - so the pool area was only about 5% in use. It is out of the way. We thought about using the shuttle to Sea World - but since there was only one drop off time and one pick up time/day - it would not have been convenient for us.

Reviews.Title: “watch what they charge you”
Reviews.Author: bwanas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice but the vallet only parking costs around $20 per day plus tip, upon check out we paid the charge and were fine with it and then found an additional charge for something on my cc I still don't understand.I had to remove there stuff from the fridge to put my stuff in. I think all in all we woudn't ever stay there again I don't trust them plus they charge 9.95 per day for internet. Residence inn is by far a better place at a third of the price and you can park for free and not wait on your car.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to believe Marriott owns Ritz Carlton...not your Marriott experience”
Reviews.Author: JQ_08
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Orlando is a great choice if your not going to Disney World. Great for Sea World, Universal or enjoying the resort ammenities. Nice room with beautiful and large bathrooms. Balcony, too.

Reviews.Title: “nice Concierge Level amenities”
Reviews.Author: eekthetripsinaweek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for several nights, following a visit to the Mayo Clinic in Jacksonville. He has family living in Orlando, so we figured we might as well take a side trip. We met his brother with family in tow here for several days. They made extensive use of the swimming pool facilities, and of the Concierge Club Level amenities. In the daytime, we did all the usual Orlando tourist activities. At night, we were absolutely thankful to have such a relaxing refuge, away from the theme park hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to stay at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningTraveler88
Reviews.Content: After three days on property at Disney, we were so happy to see the beautifully manicured grounds of the Ritz Carlton as we turned into the driveway. We were pleased to be greeted by name upon arrival and our check-in process was very smooth. Despite minor hiccups -- first room smelled like smoke despite hotel's no smoking policy - and some cleanliness issues (toilet) in the second room, we were throughly pleased with the staff and the attention to detail. The restaurant there (grill) and the Italian restaurant at the neighboring JW Marriott were truly outstanding. A great place to stay with kids - all the staff were extremely kid friendly. One of my favorite Ritz properties in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “a taste of luxury”
Reviews.Author: ayoungpretender
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for a wedding. I am usually a bargain shopper when I travel but circumstances made the Ritz the best option. Everything was way beyond my expectations, down to the smallest details. The service was exceptional. I must admit I felt out of place in such fancy accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ike7101
Reviews.Content: I was recently a guest at the Ritz for a business conference and it was a beautiful hotel! The pools were clean and looked like they would be a lot of fun but while i was there the weather was cold so I did not use them. The hotel staff was awesome. They clean your room a couple of times a day and keep things fresh. When I was looking for the closest bathroom while walking around the hotel I asked one of the staff and they walked me directly to it. They didnt just give directions, they actually took me straight there! ALL staff was extremely friendly. The rooms were very comfortable and i had a balcony off of my room that overlooked the "lakes". Not really lakes but ponds, however, gorgeous! The hotel was decorated for Christmas and had quite the display of gingerbread houses out. The food I cannot comment on. It was SOOOOOO expensive I could not fathom eating there. A peanut butter and jelly sandwich was about $12.00. Instead we took our rental car off of the property and ate on the economy. I did not see a whole lot of children there, but I noticed that they had a special sign in book for them at the registration desk and they also had some type of club that you could join them up in for playing games, swimming, etc....there just wasnt a whole lot of activities going on at the time I was there due to school not being out for the holiday yet.
