But if you want to take your kids, MOST DEFINITELY do so. I am sure that the staff will be VERY accomodating. There was a full bar and snack bar as well in my room. Though quite expensive. A bottle of beer was about $5.00 and you could simply go across the street off of the resort property to the PUBLIX market and buy your own much cheaper. The bathroom was heavenly. A separate shower with see thru glass doors (very large) and a separate tub. The toilet was also in a separate room by itself (with a phone as well). It was all tiled very nicely. The bath products were bvulgari and just heavenly! They had complimentary shoe shine service as well which I thought would be wonderful had my husband been staying there since he travels for business and would have partaken in that service. The beds were so awesome I did not want to get up every morning. Lots of pillows and really really wonderful mattresses. The temperature was easy to maintain in the room and you could not hear it when it would go off and on. It just maintained the temperature. The walls were thick. I never ONCE heard my neighbors and I knew the girl who was staying next to me. and she was going out till odd hours every single night drinking but I did not hear her come in not once. I would most definitely stay there again. I had a very pleasant experience. Definitely tip your housekeeper handsomely. They do a fantastic job! Check in and check out were super easy. I had actually booked my room from 7-13 December but they were overbooked for our conference so I was sent to Shingle Creek which is right down the road (ANOTHER AWESOME RESORT). But a couple of days later I moved to the Ritz and the hotel took care of it all. They sent a town car over for me and moved my luggage all the way to the room and everything. I had to do absolutely nothing. They called me and asked if I would like to be moved. I did ONLY because my conference was actually at the Ritz and it made it much more convenient to sleep there as well. Otherwise I probably would have stayed at the Rosin Shingle Creek. (see the review on that one as well). I would never be able to afford to come to the Ritz so I am really happy I experienced this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC971
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 10 day stay at the Ritz Carlton. Arrived on Boxing Day after a long trip and got a nice friendly welcome. Our rooms were adjoining with the kids and were spacious and bright, we were on the 11th floor. We were on a free breakfast deal which was excellent, as the self service breakfast was fantastic. The pool area was great and the staff were brilliant, I have never had so many towels on a lounger. We did Universal and WDW and I felt WDW was a bit tired and preferred Universal for more up to date rides. My wife used the Spa pool for swimming and as she got out of the pool was given hot towels and a bottle of water....five stars. Overall a great hotel with a couple of moans - 1. Valet Parking - $20 a day even if you dont have a car, someone managed to break into my hire car a stole the GPS. 2. There a 2 , 4 person bicycles, we though were free to use between the Ritz and the Marriottt and found out they were only for hire. Why charge for this, no need. These moans aside, I would hurry back to this hotel it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Ritz Orlando”
Reviews.Author: chitownMS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz after 4 days in a condo style villa on WDW property with family. So a nice recovery from a family vacation. We arrived having come directly from spending our final hours at the pool at our other hotel - we would not do this again - luckily no one commented on our shabby appearance and we were given a room with a view of the lake. The room was very nice and the bed extremely comfortable. The only thing I did not like was the Bvlgari toiletries, the scent was so heavily perfumed it made me feel a little sick to my stomach. I would strongly suggest bringing your own toiletries or you might be able to ask for different ones. We had a package that included breakfast buffet daily and a $50 resort credit. The breakfast buffet was very good but I would never have paid for it ($57 for two people was the listed value). We used the fitness area which was really nice – one of the nicer facilities I’ve seen. Plus they play music that you actually want to listen to when you work out. My husband and I both had spa treatments – I had a stone pedicure ($90) and he had a signature massage ($120). I would have to say that the pedicure was not worth it and is the reason for the 4 and not 5 stars. The massage according to my husband was the best he ever had. Also it seemed to me most of the appointments were for massages so maybe that is what they do best. The spa pool was also very nice and virtually empty when we were there. I would just pay the money to access the spa and skip the treatment. We also ventured over to the JW Marriott which is next store and has a lazy river pool. We actually had to use the pool there because the pool at the Ritz closes earlier and the JW Marriott pool stays open later. The valet parking was a little annoying but we always called down and our car was always waiting for us. Most of the time they just handed us the keys and we walked over to where they had parked the car. Also my $50 resort credit was not automatically credited so I had to stop at the front desk – it was handled quickly but I always wonder why these things don’t get handled automatically (I swear the first hotel that handles a resort credit with no issues will get my loyalty for life!) Overall we really enjoyed our stay and we are already planning to return in March.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stefhef
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 8 nights. Very nice hotel - all you would expect from Ritz Carlton. Definitely a nice place to stay in Orlando. Golf course was nice but not much of a challenge. There are better ones in the area but it sure is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at the Ritz Orlando”
Reviews.Author: AJRPERTH
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying a week at the Ritz, wow what a hotel. The staff were so friendly and could not do enough for you,the food was first class as was everything else about thishotel.I will be back again without any doubt this was paridise in Orlando if you can get such a thing .The only dislike was the valet parking which was compulsory @ 21.30 dollars per night it added quite a bit to the bill plus you still felt obliged to tip the parking attendants as well.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING IN EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: babymelon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night (we were in Orlando for a family vacation) in a club level lake view room to celebrate our Anniversary and our 1st trip away without our children in about 5 years. The service was AMAZING, couldn't have asked for more. We were upgraded to a suite that was just beautiful!! I had been working with numerous people (Special thanks to Kristin, Mike B, Melissa & Cindy) trying to make our stay very romantic and perfect. We did order a picnic basket that was just wonderful, everything delicious. Because my husband was sick, Mike went out of his way to leave blankets and set up a fire pit for us to keep him warm. They also put in a special Anniversary cake (chocolate my husbands favorite!!). I ordered rose petals to be arranged at check in, the were scattered throughout the room and shaped in a heart on the bed with 2 cute bride and groom rubber duckies, I also left tealites and chocolate to be scattered around the room, it looked wonderful, especially since it was a suite (sent hubby to the Lounge area so I could light the candles). The lounge was great, offered much more than expected and everythhing delicious (cont. breakfast was much more than just cold breakfast, night snacks were great, especially my favorite, fondue!!!) Champagane and wine were a nice touch, available at anytime we went to the lounge). The service was amazing, nothing as too much to ask (my husband left his shirt and cig. in the car and they brought them to us). We were left a nice personal note wishing us a Happy Anniversary as well as a beautiful picture frame as a gift. If you would like to be treated like royalty this is the place to go!! For picinic baskets, Kristin and Mike were amazing, for congierge Melissa and Cindy couldn't have done more for us, just wish we had more time and hubby wasn't so sick!! It was very, very cold in Florida! It gives us a reason to go back!! Thank you to all that made this so special for us!!

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Runnergirlnyc
Reviews.Content: This is fabulous hotel. The grounds are beautiful. The rooms are large and well-appointed. The staff is attentive and helpful. The food is first-rate. There is nothing negative to say about this hotel (except that it is in Orlando - I do not see anything overly appealing about Orlando.) If you must stay in Orlando, definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above”
Reviews.Author: Reauxbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in Orlando for a week in October 2008. The service was tremendous. Every aspect. Even a minor irritant like in-room coffee not refilled, was addressed quickly. The parking valet was not generally very quick, but not a real issue. The valet is required...there is no self parking. At $21.00 per day, my expectations were higher than was delivered. But the team was always moving to take care of the waiting drivers. My wife thoroughly enjoyed the spa and the 500 acre property is well-maintained. It is a non-smoking property, so I had to put away the cigars to my dismay. It is clear that all employees are either trained in the highest levels of customer service or the hiring office is doing a spot-on job. Kudos to this resort. With the shared amenities of the JW Marriott property next door, I do not see a reason to consider another site next year.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: lazy_curmudgeon
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3-year old daughter, and I spent 5 days and 4 nights at the Ritz Carlton in Orlando. This was our first time staying in a Ritz hotel. We generally stay in Hiltons or Embassy Suites (that caliber), but we have stayed in some luxury hotels including the Phoenician in Scottsdale, La Valencia in La Jolla, Chambers in Minneapolis. The Ritz was the best, for sure. The hotel is very accommodating to children, very clean, and the staff is extremely friendly and efficient. Early check-in was no problem, with our room totally ready with a little welcome kit for our daughter, which she thought was so exciting. She carried her little Ritz bag all week. We used the concierge to make reservations at Roy's, and we received total VIP treatment at the restaurant including a cheese quesadilla for our toddler upon arrival and a free dessert for everyone. The room we had overlooked the pool, and one night there was an extremely nice fireworks show as a result of a corporate event occuring on campus. The pool is very nice, and the pool and lazy river at the adjoining JW Marriott is perfect for families. We ate at Bleu, the hotel restaurant by the pool, as well as at the Vineyard Grill in the hotel basement. Both meals were excellent. We ordered room service for one meal, and the delivery was prompt and pleasant. We enjoyed the complimentary bottled water throughout the hotel (by the pool, at the front desk, in our room), as well as the excellent lemonade next to the front desk. It is true they charge you by the day for valet parking ($20) and wireless internet ($10), but we found the valet to be very attentive. We did travel in mid-September, which I don't think is a very busy time for the hotel or Orlando, so that was nice. The hotel is very near Sea World and some shoppting. A bit farther from Disney, but that was fine for us. While it does cost a lot, if you can afford it, I highly recommend the Ritz for a relaxing, quiet, luxurious stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST - as always!”
Reviews.Author: momto3yearold
Reviews.Content: I am addicted to Ritz-Cartlon hotels! I swore to myself that I would stay on Disney Property the next time we visited the Orlando area, yet i just could not pass up a wonderful stay at the Ritz. While I love Disney, we were not anticipating going to the parks every day, so I wanted to be somewhere where I felt we could enjoy a true non-Disney experience on our off days. We have a 3 year old and I have never found another hotel chain to be as accommodating to children as the Ritz. At the Amelia Island Ritz, they delivered a bucket and sand shovel with cookies/treats to my son on our first night. That is just a small example of the extra effort that the Ritz displays. The Orlando Ritz is wonderful! Clean, clean rooms with the most comfortable beds! What I really love about this hotel is the accessibility from all points - quick trip from the pool to the rooms. This is a great layout when you have small children. Valet parking is easy as we called from our room and the car was always waiting for us. I personally think a car is needed when staying here. Disney was about 10-15 minutes away. Easy trip. Seaworld was maybe two minutes. The Marriott is next door and they have a great lazy river pool with tubes. You can take a beautiful walk by the lake and the Marriott is just a few minutes away. It is nice to have other food and store choices so close. Meals - there was always a cart with coffee and bagels/breads in the morning so there was no need for a long sit down breakfast . Anything to avoid a long meal with my toddler! We ate at the pool restaurant everyday for lunch - great salads, sandwiches and pizzas. Always a nice children's menu! They had a nice children's playground with a kiddie pool with lounges for the adults. This is separate from the adult areas, so no need to worry if you are kid free!

Reviews.Title: “excelent!!”
Reviews.Author: dantudor
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel with loveley grounds! Stay there in aug during Fay tropical storm,so a lot of rain but still a great experience! The hotel is in very good shape,very clean.Rooms are big enough,well apointed and great views. Both restaurants excelent for evening.Breakfast great. Staff very frendly and attentive.Location great for all Disney,Universal and Sea World. A very good choise if in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: carbonsa
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 day trip to Orlando, spending 6 nights at the Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes. From the moment we arrived they treated us like VIPs. The grounds are well kept and beautiful to stroll through. The resort is quite away from the hussle and bussle of International Drive which suited us fine. It was a pleasure to return back to the resort daily after spending time away shopping or visiting the touristy attractions. The staff were very pleasant. Our room was on the 9th floor overlooking the lake. We had dinner at Normans a couple nights and also ate at the Vineyard.Both meals both were execeptional. Normans a little pricey but fab quality. Due to the poor weather we were unable to make use of the facilities by the pool, The front staff are very helpful with any concerns on directions. Our only gripe, is the valet parking. There were times we had to wait ages as the hotel can be quite busy and even when we called down to arrange for our hire car to be sent round we waited a bit during busy times...Also the cost of valet parking which is $21.30 per day including tax is a bit steep but thats expected. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, it was well located as we headed off to Tampa for Busch Gardens, the hotel is easy to find from airport and a real pleasure to experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel should be like!”
Reviews.Author: Sevaer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited this property with our two sons. We had two rooms reserved. We had one room with two beds and the other room with a king bed. When we arrived for check in, we were informed that they had upgraded our single bed room to an executive suite. This is a classy property with the lobby and rooms tastefully decorated. It is clean and it smells good. The staff is amazing in how they try to make you feel special. They had live music in the lobby bar which were wonderful. We left a treasured item in our room and realized it when we arrived home. I contacted the hotel and the lost and found coordinator said they would retrieve the item if found. About a week later, I received via UPS the item we left sent at their expense. I have stayed at some of the highest rated hotels in the world, but never have I enjoyed a stay as much as this. I wish I could have stayed longer. I hope everyone's experience will be as good as ours was.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, odd location”
Reviews.Author: adamunc
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here in August 2008. This Grande Lakes resort complex [the JW Marriott and the Ritz] are in a strange location--in the general neighborhood of the airport expressway and International Dr. It's not far from SeaWorld, but otherwise it seems a strange choice for a place to put a resort of this size. It appears they mostly do convention business; if you're a vacation traveler, then you'll really only want to stay here if exceptional service is your highest priority. Check-in was smooth and I was able to get the room I requested at 9am, so that was a good bonus. Rooms have the typical Ritz layout, but more cheerful colors than others I've stayed at--springtime yellows and greens, with vine-print wallpaper in the bathroom. I had a good-sized balcony but did note that many rooms had smaller balconies. The rooms adjacent to the elevators have truly private, walled, larger balconies while others have smaller ones that are directly open to the neighboring rooms. Incidentally, I wouldn't bother about paying more for a view here--they're all pretty much on a par. One side overlooks the front fountains and downtown Orlando in the distance, the other side overlooks the pool, part of the golf course, and the sunset. No matter which room you're in, you'll have a "lake view"--the property is dotted with a bunch of little ponds. [I wouldn't call any of the lakes "grand", so the name Grande Lakes is a bit of a marketing ploy.] There were a couple of housekeeping issues in the room--dust on the back of the desk, a cobweb on the balcony, and a four-day-old newspaper and Cheerio under the ottoman. The linens, bathroom, and other main surfaces were spotless. Service here is top-notch, even by Ritz standards. Each area of the resort was always fully-staffed, so there was no wait for anything. Cocktail waitresses, bar staff, concierge, room servce, spa attendants--everyone was right at hand and efficient and friendly. The spa was exceptional--with a different design scheme and layout than any other I've come across. The waiting area had charcoal curved sofas with burgundy accents and looked like someone's sophisticated Manhattan apartment--very appealing. The spa pool is also a great spot to spend some quiet time. It was far less crowded than the main pool and almost as large. There are several dining options and all the ones I went to were strong--Norman's is a must, and the Fairways pub at the Golf Clubhouse makes a terrific crab and corn chowder. All the amenities of the JW next door are also available--and make a trip over to eat at Primo [separate review]. All in all, the property is very solid, just in an odd place. I'd definitely stay here on business, but probably not as a tourist again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in all regards”
Reviews.Author: TheScottishwanderers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Ritz Carlton at the beginning of July. We can't speak highly enough of the hotel, the staff and the great customer service we received. Staff made every effort to remember our name despite the fact that the hotel could be very busy at times. Room service and front desk always called us by name when we called. Such efforts are to be applauded as it is something that we have experienced in only the most customer service orientated of hotels. The room was well appointed, very clean and fresh. We also had a great view over the lakes and golf course. Room service and house keeping were excellent and we had no problems with them at all. Stocks of complimentary water and bathroom toiletries were always replenished, often more than once in a day if required. Turndown servcie was always timely. The hotel was immaculate in all regards and we enjoyed relaxing days at the pool where bottles of complimentary water were very welcome. Food was execellent and we found the breakfast menu good value for money. We also ate in the hotel restaurants and lounge area. Although a bit pricey we felt the food and service was of a high quality. Took the hotel eco-tour. Although we originally felt the cost to be a bit expensivre, we thoroughly enjoyed the trip and our tour guide made every effort to inform us about the local area and point out the wildlife in it. We were very well looked after with towels and bottles of chiled water made available to us. We enjoyed the experience so much that we hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Wished we could have stayed longer.”
Reviews.Author: kateinthesun
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at RC Grande Lakes during the first week of July. We booked 2 deluxe rooms through an excellent Virtuoso Agent and received a fabulous upgrade to a Suite with a connecting kids room. We have enjoyed many worldwide Ritz Carlton stays and this property, though not the prettiest, offered the best family-centered service, we have experienced. Our young children enjoyed their own check-in desk, scavenger hunt, complimentary ice cream and certainly the best surprise, a room completely decorated especially for children, with trundle beds, toys, litttle step-stools in the bathroom so they could reach the faucets, boy/girl quilts, a little table and chairs...wonderful! During the holiday weekend, the staff setup Bouncy castles, terrific fireworks...we did not want to leave. Having already visited DISNEY, we avoided that Park and went instead to UNIVERSAL and SEAWORLD, both very close to the Hotel. We used the complimentary shuttle from the Hotel to get to Universal on the first day but we had to take a cab back as the shuttle runs infrequently. In traffic, the cab ride cost $25 for 2 adults and 2 children. All members of staff greeted us by name 95% of the time, and with smiles and friendly service. Breakfast buffet in the Vineyard Grill was extensive and good, lunch at Bleu also good but very hot in the Summer sun. Room service surprisingly affordable, especially off the Children's menu. The exterior of the Hotel is very average. Once you step inside, the elegance, typical of Ritz Carlton emanates. The service is really what makes this Hotel distinctive. I hope they can maintain the high quality...I'm planning a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not too "ritzy"”
Reviews.Author: oliveoyleFL
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night and 2 days at the Ritz Grande Lakes. Although the property is beautiful and the weather was perfect, we were disappointed with the quality of the service. It was July 4th weekend, and the property, along with the JW Mariott (adjacent property) were teeming with WAY TOO MANY people, a lot of whom looked like they may have just come to play for the day (and were not staying at either of the properties). On Saturday, July 5th, we could not find a single pool chair at the JW or the Ritz pools. We ended up paying $20 dollars for access to the Spa pool-- best money spent! The private spa area and pool were a true retreat. Despite the enjoyable spa area, we felt we had to keep "checking" things on our reservation-- regarding a credit we received for dining services and late checkout. We had a 4pm checkout with our Amex card, and the other couple in our party actually received a knock at their door seeing if the needed "help with their luggage" since check out time had already passed (it was only 2:00pm). The room was nice, but our room faced the courtyard (3rd floor) and was actually loud for a portion of the night (around 10pm). The Ritz and the JW should really try to control crowds in a more effective manner. Paying guests do not appreciate hoards of "visitors" taking up chairs and pool space. I'd recommend heading to the property on a slower weekend and investing in the spa area. Not quite as "ritzy" as we expected...

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: stylizpinkangel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay at the Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes over July 4th weekend. We were celebrating our anniversary and from the moment we walked in we felt wonderful. We were given a great view and a special gift was waiting for us in the room when we arrived. ( I noted in the reservation that it was our first anniversary) The bell hop was very friendly and eager to please us. We found that 99% of the staff gave us outstanding service. The only restaurant we ate at was the Vineyard Grill for breakfast. As others have said, the food is a little slow to come out but nothing to complain about. We enjoyed our breakfast. We spent most of our time at Disney World during our trip but when we were at the hotel any special requests we had the staff bent over backwards to meet. We got married at Disney last year and stayed at the Grand Floridian Resort. It was a great experience and a beautiful hotel, but for a lot less you can get that in a more personal atmosphere at the Ritz Carlton. So in less it's the closeness of the parks you're after or the half price valet parking, I suggest staying at the Ritz. The only rude staff member we encountered during our trip was on the very last day as we were leaving, a valet guy was obviously not having a good day. Over all we had a very nice stay and we will most definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “So this is what great customer service is like!”
Reviews.Author: Courtesy_Flush
Reviews.Content: I came here for a two day meeting (the Ritz is a VERY popular meeting hotel), and it was my first time staying at a Ritz Carlton brand hotel. I was completely blown away by their amazing customer service. It is like nothing I have ever experience before. Just to get a couple negatives out of the way, the housekeeping was the one and only area that didn't live up to my expectations. This seems to be a recurring problem at the majority of the places I stay at. The other negative about this particular property is the location. It is a 30-45 minute cab ride (without traffic) to get to I-drive, Disney, and other attractions. As I stated before, I have never had such good customer service. At the front desk, the person who checked me in also walked me to the elevator and called my floor. Every worker greeted me with a smile. Snacks, fruit, and water await joggers in the morning. While sitting in the lobby, a clerk brought me a cold bottled water. And so on.... I also had the pleasure of eating at the Vineyard Grille, and it was a terrific meal. Definetely the best swordfish I've ever had! It is very expensive as items are a la carte. The bed actually beats out the Westin Heavenly Beds, a feat that I didn't think was possible. I also enjoyed the Bulova tolietries which had a nice sophisticated scent to them. I wouldn't stay at the Ritz for a Disney vacation, but I pray to the travel gods that I can attend another meeting here sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: UKElr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights (2-6 June) with my husband. I had requested a lake view room in my booking which was as usual not visible at check-in, but after asking the receptionist, got a lake view room afterall. We stayed in room 415 which was a lovely clean spacious room with a fantastic view of the lake and a lovely balcony to sit out. There was an in-room safe, fridge, 37" plasma tv and an extremely comfortable 6 foot bed. There were also some small complimentary bottles of water which was replenished daily. The bathroom was big with a bathtub (no shower overhead), shower cubicle, toilet (in a cubicle with a door), two sinks, bathrobes, slippers and lots of clean soft towels. We only ate once at the hotel and that was room service one night. The quality of the food was very good albeit expensive, but room service always is. Maid service was always efficient and to a very good standard, although on one morning the maid wasn't particularly 'friendly' when asked to come back later. Staff around the hotel were always friendly. However, on the first morning we asked concierge to bring our car round for us. Having waitied a good 20 minutes at reception I asked my husband to enquire as to the whereabouts of our car, only to be told (by the same concierge) that the car wouldn't be brought in to us and that we had to go outside for the car! I thought this was rather rude. How were to to know how their valet parking operated? Also, everyone else was offered bottled water except us that morning! The hotel pool was nice - clean and lovely temperature. Bottled water was complimentary (you just helped yourself) and there was no signing in/out of pool towels. However, the spa tub was a little too hot. We had a look at the neighbouring JW Marriott's pool after reading reviews about it and it was just okay, nothing special, so I don't understand why some reviewers were raving about it. (The Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress pool is fantastic if you want a great pool). However, I have to say that the JW Marriott's reception area is a bit more grand than the Ritz's, but the Ritz wins hands down on everything else. The charge for valet parking (you can't self park) is a bit of a rip off and it wasn't even run efficiently. There were many occassions when we stood waiting for either the car to be collected or dropped off. All in all a lovely hotel if you have the money to splash out on something a bit more upmarket.

Reviews.Title: “OK really nothing special”
Reviews.Author: NHamptonTraveller
Reviews.Content: Things got off to a good start when i checked in and was given a cold towel for my sweating brow (it was hot outside). I was staying in Orlando for a conference. The hotel choice was out of my control as it was attached to the conference booking. The room was surprisingly small and only had a shower. I was somewhat jet lagged when i'd arrived after an 11 hour flight so didnt really notice the bathroom until the following morning. This was when i noticed no bath and a shower only (it was later on i noticed they'd put me in a disabled room). Overall the staff were cold and uninterested especially the check-in and bag staff. Room service was an improvement and the one area that did impress were the house cleaning services. Would I stay here again? There is certainly better in orlando, the cyprus grand hyatt for example which i would probably stay at instead next time. There were also limited dining options within the hotel itself although with a bit of a trek you could goto the sister hotel which sits on the same site. I was personally disappointed with the hotel and staff for the reasons above - small room, disabled room, badly designed shower which drenched the entire toilet everytime i used it and cold staff with the exception of the folks performing the nightly turn down service.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Beltasic
Reviews.Content: We are a honeymoon couple and stayed at the Ritz for two weeks while investigating all that Orlando has to offer. We booked following plenty of recommendations that this hotel was the most luxurious and best suited for a special stay. Generally the hotel lived up: tastefully decorated and we had a very nice room of reasonable size (fairly large by comparison - the Ritz London, UK standard rooms are only 2/3 of this size whereas their junior suite is about the same) with a view overlooking the pool. Food/buffets/entertainment over Memorial weekend were very enjoyable and they hosted the best firework crescendo I have ever seen at a hotel! Grounds and pool are extremely pleasant and were very quiet during the week - a number of big accountancy conferences being hosted at the time. The service was very good for a large proportion of our stay, not perfect but not far from. Anytime we needed anything they came straight away and catered for a few of our unusual room service requests too - at a price! The spa is also really something, both my male therapists did a superb job - best massages i have ever had and not really expensive when you consider what spas charge in the UK. My only moan was that they did not upgrade us to club level which i was expecting given that it was our honeymoon. Despite telling us on arrival 'they would do all they could to move us to a suite/club room etc.' predictably, it never happened (despite other staff telling us club level was not at full occupancy) so i was rather disappointed with this aspect. However we did receive a token savings card for our extra expenses at the hotel. The other slight gripe was the valet parking which at $22 a day was totally ridiculous given that it is a 5* resort and something they really should offer as part of the guest service. All in all i would definitely stay in another Ritz Carlton if it lived up to this standard and would probably go back if i was staying in Orlando. I am however planning on checking out the Ritz in Miami when we return next time.

Reviews.Title: “what you would expect from a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sora21
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Ritz as a treat during Memorial day weekend and we had a great time. The room was clean and super nice ....the bathroom was huge with plenty of amenities. Nothing but the best from the staff from check in to check out. The hotel next to the Ritz is linked via sidewalk and has a great kids pool/play area. We kept a 4 year old and a 1 1/2 year entertained all day. Also, had areas with shade and plenty of servers walking around to assist with beverages or food. The pool at the Ritz is more for adults. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best option for Orlando.....pretty nice (but not perfect)”
Reviews.Author: andrew_branham
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Orlando is probably the best option for 'luxury' accomodations in Orlando. It is not perfect, but is far better than any Disney property and gives you the peace and quiet of being off-site. The good: -Location.....close to Disney, Downtown, and Discovery Cove/Sea World. -Peace and quiet and away from the crazy Disney properties -Awesome service from start to finish......they make you feel like royalty -Very good food and much cheaper than I expected (much cheaper than Four Seasons) -Very nice and quiet pool with great service and a nice bar -Very clean, nicely decorated, nice landscaping -Connected to the JW Marriott (sister hotel) with a really nice and long lazy river -Club floor....well worth the extra cash.....food all day, all you can drink of anything, etc -Discovery Cove....the twilight evening is a MUST DO! The OK: -Rooms are clean, nicely appointed, but much smaller than I am used to -No complimentary transportation.....for these prices they should offer a shuttle service like One and Only and Four Seasons does -Golf course is dry and just 'ok' -The view.....blah.....looks over a dried up, brown, muddy pond Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Still the Ritz, but just okay”
Reviews.Author: baxwelll
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was a little disappointed with my stay because when I think Ritz, I think service, and it was lacking here. A wake up call never occured. Lunch was extremely slow at the place on the bottom level (the name escapes me now), so much so that it was comped on one occasion. The rooms and facilities were all great, although the grounds were not quite as palatial as I would have expected (looked sort of dried out and dead in some places). There is a nice path that wraps around to the sister JW Marriott if you are looking to get out and get some fresh air. On check out they were giving out vouchers to come back and stay again at a room rate of $179 (vs. my $300). Make whatever assumptions you want about that, but it tells me things aren't quite up to snuff here.

Reviews.Title: “LATE HONEYMOON HEAVEN”
Reviews.Author: pauldebBasingstoke
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ritz Carlton after extensive research into locating a hotel that could provide everything my wife and myself wanted for 8 days over our 18th anniversary, something we regrettably missed when we married. From the moment we arrived and prior through e-mail communication we were given a level of service that was absolutely second to none, I have stayed in many hotels around the world and would recommend this hotel above most others placing it well within my top 5. We had an club level suite on the 14th floor, great views with a fantastic view nightly of the fireworks from epcot and Magic Kingdom even though they are 10 miles away. We had peace and quiet, total relaxation with the knowledge that the team within the hotel would do their utmost to provide you with everything you find necessary for your perfect stay. If you can, go with club level, food and drink is included and although this balances on cost it is a lot more convenient, remembering that drinks, cocktails, breakfast, lunch, and evening selections are available to the club level guest. The staff are magnificent, again my thanks to Katie, Jason, Trish and our room maid Violette. Valet parking excellent and prompt but at $20 a day is really unnecessary at this level of hotel. No other negatives. It was great to leave the hustle and bustle of disney for a 15 minute car ride to an idyllic haven recommended at families as well as executives. You won't be disappointed, if you are then stick with the disney choices but be aware that you will not receive the same attention to details throughout the day as you will do by staying at the Ritz Carlton. Remember, disney want you out of their hotels and in their parks. We will be returning to the Ritz Carlton by the end of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Not Excellent........just nice”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel39
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband just returned from a 7 night stay in the Ritz Carlton, Orlando.While overall we had a nice stay there were some aspects that we found disappointing. As we were staying in a Ritz Carlton property and the fact the hotel is apparently 5* we obviously had certain expectactions. Upon arrival at the hotel, I was suprised that there was no one to help us with our luggage. After myself and my husband dragged our luggage in to reception I was very disappointed to learn from the less the friendly receptionist that they could not accomodate our request for a king bed.(I made this request 6 months in advance).I asked if there was any way that they could facilitate our request over the following day or two.The answer was a straight no,no apology, no compromise.Basically he said that the King rooms were on a first come first served basis and they were all taken.I was particarly annoyed when I learned from another member of our party who checked in the next day that they got a king room even though they had forgotten to request it when booking. We were brought to our room which had a fantastic view over the pool area and the golf course and got the sun in the evening. We really enjoyed having a drink on the balcony before we went out in the evenings. Rooms were nice but having stayed in many 5 star resorts in Europe and Asia I would not class them as 5*.They were very small and the 2 beds in the room which were supposed to be 2 doubles were tiny. Myself and my husband tried to sleep in one of the beds together the first night but there was no room to move so we ended up in seperate beds for the week.....not exactly a romantic start to the holiday!!(I'm only 5'3" in height). The pool area is lovely, never a problem getting a sunbed.Plenty of water available and fresh fruit. We also availed of the pool facilities in the JW Marriott as we had family staying there.Really enjoyed the lazy river. Food: We found the food in the hotel expensive for very average food. Breakfast: We had breakfast a few mornings in the Ritz which was nice as there was an al a carte menu as well as a buffet option. We eat in bar bleu - food was nice for a snack. Eat in Quench (JW Marriott) - Food okay but again expensive.Ordered drinks by the pool from Quench bar staff one of the days, 4 cocktails cost $69....she had added an 18% gratuity for my convenience!!!!. My final negative was the service. There was a constant expectation for tips in both hotels. I never felt any service was genuine , it always felt like staff only did something for you if they thought they would get a tip.I don't agree with tipping for everything, we were staying and paying up front for a 5* hotel so I don't think you should have to tip to ensure that you get 5*service.When we were leaving the hotel no one asked us how our stay was........maybe they just don't care. Unfortunately my final memory of the hotel was as follows.. Our bags were taken down from our room to a town car which was taking us to the airport, we tipped the guy our last $10 bill.He left the bags at the car and another guy put them into the trunk of the car, I could not believe it when he stood there expecting a tip for lifting 2 suitcases into the trunk .( we had to leave him standing there as we were heading back to the land of euro and had no more $.........)

Reviews.Title: “Great for Orlando- Good Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: roar_03
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 day conference at the RC Orlando. I really can't comment on the location of the hotel since i didn't leave it to see any of the attractions in Orlando. Check in was a breeze. There are greeters who take you to you to the elevator and show you around the lobby. RC makes a point of addressing people by last name. The lobby was nicely decorated and clean. The designers resisted the urge to make the hotel too traditional as many RCs are -think French country decor. The room was large and similarly decorated. The bathroom had a little too much floral wallpaper but it was clean and stocked with Bulgari toiletries. The Bed was great as were the sheets. I had a terrace on my 3rd floor room (most rooms have balconies) It was great having it- partial views of the pool and the immaculate grounds. A couple of minor issues. The terrace looked like it had not been cleaned in a while, there was a used plastic fork on the ground and paint smudges on the chairs outside. I know how difficult it is to maintain outdoor stuff in the tropics but this is the Ritz Carlton. The tap water (for showers etc) has a slightly strange smell, I don't know if this an Orlando specific problem. The conference facilities were flawless. All my meals were eaten at my meetings. I normally detest buffets but the staff managed to arrange it in a way that kept it clean and always well stocked. The quality was very good. I imagine that the restaurant meals are equal or better. I used the gym one morning. Its shared by the neighboring Marriott. Good equipment and nice staff. I am not sure of the value of this hotel (i didn't pay) but if i do return to Orlando I would consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “NOT RELAXING!!”
Reviews.Author: lakeeriesailors
Reviews.Content: Our entire purpose was to go to the Ritz and spend a couple of days at the great spa. We have been to the spa many times before, and they are fantastic when they get it right, but REALLY ANNOYING when they get it wrong, which seems to twenty percent of the time. Yesterday we were at the spa pool and never had a server come over to us, although a group of six women seemed to have three servers fawning over them. After chasing down a server and ordering two glasses of wine, we waited 45 minutes - no wine. Back inside to find out where the wine was, yes, the server apologized, and they gave us a bottle of wine, but, that was not the point. The group of six women seemed to be drunk, horsed around like kids in the pool, screaming and swearing. Another couple around the pool must have had enough of it, and must have called the hotel, because a 'manager-type' came up to us and asked if we called the hotel. It wasn't us, but someone came out and spoke to the group of women. Later, as we sat in the outdoor hot tub, two of the group got back in the pool and started squealing, when one of their group told them to hush, one in the pool said "[--] them, I'll make noise if I want to". One of this group was also smoking all afternoon. This is a non-smoking area, but evidently the spa personnel does not seem to want to enforce a 'spa-like atmosphere' when it comes to groups of women. I tried to overlook all of this, until, someone from the spa came out and asked me to move over to the side of the spa pool where this group was, since there was a private event going to occur at the pool and they were closing the area I was sitting in. I didn't want to sit down wind of the smoking, swearing party girls, so I just left. Even a call to the General Manager of the Ritz, did not really get us anywhere. We have been regular visitors of the Spa at The Ritz, but are hesitant to go back again. The personnel in the Men's locker room are evidently incredible, but the women's side is just lousy. BEWARE! - Although they have told me cameras are not allowed in the locker rooms, these groups of women are using cameras in the locker rooms to capture who knows what - I suggest you use the private changing rooms, if you don't want pictures of you showing up who knows where!

Reviews.Title: “Not What it Used to Be”
Reviews.Author: mookie61
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family when it first opened-and it was not very busy. Apparently that was a good thing because it was really top flight. I just had the displeasure of spending three days there on business. What a clunker-mistake after mistake. They delivered my bags to the wrong room and it took hours to find them; my smoke detector kept going off and was finally replaced after two service calls; the phones required a service call as well. WOW! That was just the first night. Here is the rub: it is a BIG hotel..and the Ritz concept doesn't work in a convention hotel. Ritz is owned by Marriott and it shows..there has been a "dumbing down" of everything-the food, the housekeeping-even the newspapers available. (And you really are paying for much better than this!) BUT is there anything better in Orlando? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Tom2002a
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orlando Ritz for 3 nights 4/08. Attended a business conference solo and was very impressed with this hotel. I received a quick orientation from one of the managers after check in and on the way to the elevator - nice touch. Room 351 was a oversized king room that faced the spa. Furnishings, fixtures and attention to detail was perfect. Upon getting up to the room I realized I had left my Blackberry in the rental car - one phone call and they ran it up in 5 minutes. I rented a car but did notice that there were always at least 10 or so “black car” Lincolns by the entrance. Conference food as well as a meal at the Vineyard Grill was fine as well. All staff encountered could not have been more pleasant. Most guests were in on business events and the lobby bar was packed at night - although no service complaints. Don’t get me wrong there were plenty of children as well and this Ritz has extensive children’s programs. Its just that the Ritz has a much more adult feel to it. The pool was sedate, well attended and spotlessly clean. Very relaxing, never crowded and most importantly - no “saved” chairs. The Ritz shares the property with a JW Marriott and they connect at the meeting center. The JW is larger with a free form pool and looks nice as well. The Ritz golf course was great. Although caddies are mandatory - which I usually hate as they seem to lose interest in beginners; our caddie Dean was outstanding and put us at ease right off the bat. Further, for $20 you can get rental clubs and all day access to the driving range, putting and chipping greens. In short, I really enjoyed the Ritz. I have stayed at several Disney properties; Swan, Shades of Green, Grand Floridian, etc. and must say that the Ritz is a refreshing change “off property”.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - with some important caveats”
Reviews.Author: sharrob
Reviews.Content: Let's get the negatives out of the way first. As previous reviewers have noted, the hotel uses an outside company that supplies town cars for transportation. We attempted to pre book our arrival pick up and departure on line - and it was bungled at every turn. It is too long to relate all the negatives with this (and I am sure most would not believe all the things that went wrong) - but my first piece of advice - pick up the phone and call the concierge if you are trying to arrange something; and even then be prepared to never quite get what you think you are getting when using the concierge or the car service. The next negative was the description online vs the actual room we received. We booked club level, lake front, king room (609 USD for March spring break). Here is my second piece of advice - make sure you get what you pay for. For example if you really want to be on the same floor as the club lounge - not the floor below (so that you don't have to navigate either a stairway or elevator to bring your loved one a glass of wine back to the room) - then specify that is what you want. Club lounge is on the 14th floor (actually the 13th), our room was down on the 12th. "Lakefront" also does not capture what we received. True - our room did face towards the lake, but the view was decided "Lakeview" (a difference of $30 USD per night). This brings us to the "last straw". The first morning, we had found the duvet on the bed too heavy for our taste and asked house keeping to bring us a blanket we could substitute for the next evening. They delivered a tattered and worn out blanket that looked more appropriate to be spread over the back seat of the car for your dog to jump on after a swim in the lake. This brings me to my last piece of advice - complain. I took the blanket downstairs with me and asked to speak to the on duty manager. We had a brief discussion of my disappointments and he offered to reduce the rate of the room to the regular rate of $459. With only two small caveats (more on these later) - the general trend of our stay started to alter course. So lets review the positives. The hotel itself is very nicely done, very grand and well laid out. (Indeed my wife and I can't remember ever being in a hotel that had such grand public washrooms - we even snuck into each other's to see the mosaics and furnishings). The spa fitness building and it's associated private pool deserve special mention. The gym is extremely well equipped and very clean. The men's and ladies private rooms were spectacular - with saunas, whirlpools, private waiting rooms. The general waiting area is one of the most remarkable spa rooms I have even been in (the website features a picture that only hints at it's charms). The pool area (which unless you have a treatment booked for the day is 20 USD) is peaceful and serene - adults only. This complex alone is worth a positive review. The hotel staff are extremely well trained and seem genuinely happy to serve. The grounds are beautiful and the entire property was well cared for. The club lounge is especially remarkable in the food that they present. I am quite prepared to believe that some club level guests who never purchase any food while on the property. If so they are missing out. We ate in three of the properties restaurants. Primo's for our second evening (its over at the sister hotel - the Marriott), Bleu (the casual restaurant near the pool) for lunch, and finally Norman's for our final night. All of these did an fabulous job and both me and my wife highly recommend them. (I note a previous reviewer did not like the service at Norman's - our experience with our waiter was completely the opposite - he was very helpful and very professional). In conclusion - the Ritz Carlton is a big luxury hotel with some very nice amenities, great food, and willing staff. If you are looking as we were, for 3 days of relaxation in the central Florida area, we would recommend this luxury choice. But be forewarned, it is a big hotel - with all the problems that 'big' can bring. The last two issues? When I went to check out, the rate had been adjusted for only 2 of the promised 3 nights, and the blankets - the second set that were delivered - even after the complaint to the Manager - were for twin beds!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and classy. Best if your company is paying though.”
Reviews.Author: mooshai
Reviews.Content: Was there for a conference and was impressed (highly) with the facilities. Luxury destination on all counts. Spacious, first class, well mantained and excellent but discreet service. Good food / restaurants and only 10 minutes from Epcot/MGM-Disney Hollywood Studios, and 5 min from Sea World. Only down side is the price - not for the thrifty.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Normans, but the hotel is lovely”
Reviews.Author: 5starsforme
Reviews.Content: First, I will explain that we expect the best when we travel. We always stay at the best hotels and are very demanding and we watch everything, from the service to the food, very carefully. From the moment we arrived, the Ritz philosophy was in full force. Our daughter loved the lemonade beautifully arranged in the lobby. I was impressed by the friendly greeting and small talk from the bellman. My husband was glad the valets were so attentive. It is often a hotel's first impression that lasts the whole trip...and this hotel delivers. The room was fine...nothing special...but the view was lovely. Ask for a lake and pool view. The spa was terrific and ask for Joana, who was awesome. The kids had a blast in the little water playground and room service was really fast! Also, no mistakes with room sevrice, like many other hotels. It is the details that are so important, and I loved the presentation from the towels to the sheets. The only weak link....Norman's restaurant. The service was so awful and condescending. Our friends wanted to inquire about a seasonal price-fixed menu and the waiter acted as if we were asking him for something beneath him. He was snooty and rude. One of the appetizers was apparantly forgotten and when I asked about it, he sniffed as if I shouldn't care that he forgot it...no apologies or anything. I honestly can't believe he was so awful. The service was so bad that we left without dessert; we couldn't take the wait or the attitude! I'm sure we spent at least a few hundred per guest, so the bill for 4 people was probably over $800 because we always order expensive wine and appetizers, but I think for the first time ever my husband left a 10 or 15 perecnt tip instead of 20 perecnt, or more. He shouldn't have left anything! Dinner at the steak restaurant was fine, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bryan5150
Reviews.Content: We booked the Ritz in Orlando for a family vacation with my wife and 2 year old. The main reason we booked the hotel was to use the facilities at the adjacent JW Marriot, which was sold out. This was the first time we've stayed at a Ritz Carlton and we truly enjoyed the spoiling experience that only the Ritz staff can do right. The check-in went incredibly smoothly with the bell-hop providing a wide range of information about the hotel and the room. Speaking of the room, wow is all I can say. We could not guarantee a king when booking, but the front desk staff made it happen with no problem. We also checked in at noon instead of the standard check in of 3pm. Once again, no problem at all with the front desk staff. They didn't even question us showing 3 hours early. The room came with a crib for our daughter that was decked out with a gift bag for her (swim dypers, rubber ducky, etc.) and looked straight out of Pottery Barn. The king bed made the Westin heavenly bed look shameful. The bathroom was huge, with a lovely tub and separate stand up shower with private toilet area. The patio was nice with a lovely view of the adjacent Ritz Spa pool. Speaking of the pool, it was very nice. It was heated and huge. The JW Marriott facilities are open to the Ritz guests and their pools is out of this world. The lazy river is very long and very slow. They have a great grill and awesome staff as well. We ate at the Vineyard Grill at the Ritz and had roomservice for the other meals - all great. This goes without saying that you obviously will spend an incredible amount of money at this hotel; however, I did not feel like they nickle and dimed me the entire time. At the pool, bottle water, swim dypers and ice cream are free. The lobby has fruit and water for joggers with towels. Additionally, unlike other hotels, the business center was complimentary for internet/pc use. Great hotel overall and I would recommend it to anyone staying in the Orlando area. Especially great if you want to get away from all the Disney paraphanalia floating around the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: colttravel
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited the Ritz over the President's Day Weekend. WOW! Were we were pleasantly surprised with the resort. The children (7 years old) enjoyed the warm pools, and thought the Marriot pools next door were too chilly to swim in. Beds comfortable, and the family rate package we had was great since we had two connecting rooms with one king, and two doubles. Definately made the stay more enjoyable. PROS: The staff was attentive at the pool, we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff. Vineyard Grill-- great tasting food. Clean rooms, beautiful resort grounds....felt like a tropical paradise. CONS: Pricey room service menu--, some cleanliness issues with bathroom, but only minor. Since we had always stayed in a Disney Resort, we were a little hesistant at first staying far from the parks. But, we did not even venture out once from the resort ! The kids were having such a great time at the large pool. Fantastic! If you are looking for a lowkey, self contained resort, this place is for you. The grounds are impeccable and remind you of Hawaii. (Of course without the beach) but the lake view is nice and there are little touches of rocking chairs, bike rentals, and even a small playground/spraypark for the younger guests. It is very large that you can find a place to sit and relax without people coming and going around you. THe marriot next door was far more crowded, and not as relaxing as the RItz. We immediately felt the difference. However, since both properties are connected by an awesome walking path, you can enjoy both properties. We look forward to coming again and enjoying the beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “top service when it counts”
Reviews.Author: travlindudeMiami
Reviews.Content: The great deal about this property is location: you are in orlando for all of its uglyness, but inside the serenity of a Ritz. This property is on the campus of the Mariott, so if you are at the Mariott for a convention, stay here instead. I will do that again in a few months. VERY close to the amazing Discovery Cove (the only Orlando park designed for upscale adults). I love Discovery Cove and will again stay at the Ritz for that. Fantastic service: I forgot my laptop charger at checkout, they found it and FedExed it to me the next day at no charge. Never had a hotel do that before since it is much easier to say it is just lost.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Orlando- Five Star Exeperience!”
Reviews.Author: javatrader
Reviews.Content: We generally like to stay at "the best" places and I have to say that the Ritz Carlton in Orlando ranks right up there with best hotels in the world to stay at. If you are familair with Ritz Carlton properties, then you know about the service that you have come to expect (and let's face it, pay for). Well, they do it absolutely right at this Ritz. From the doorman and bellhops, to the counter people and concierge, they have it all down pat at this location. For those of you thinking about an off-Disney-site property, all I can say is "STAY HERE"! If you are like us, and hate the small Disney hotel rooms and the impersonal service and crowded resort feeling, then you are probably considering one of these off-site hotels. You will not be disappointed with this selection. The rooms were spacious and the beds were super comfortable. We looked forward to coming back to the room. The service was spectacular, and not lacking in anything. We used the concierege on two occasions and were blown away by the reservation they made for us at Roy's Restaraunt in Orlando. All I can say is, if you stay at this hotel, have the concierge arrange dinner for you there. Trust me on this. We also had dinner at Norman's which is located in the hotel. The literature had it highly ranked and it lived up to it's billing. The food and service were top notch and I would highly recommend having dinner here at least one night. It's dressy, so the kids can come, but punish them by having them dress neatly. I would not recommend it for young children however. Of course, cost is a factor when traveling and this Ritz is no different than the others, it's expensive. But you truly get what you pay for on ths one. Well worth the money and this is now our choice for Orlando stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: EinWI
Reviews.Content: Well I guess you could say I'm a bit biased since this is the first time I have stayed at a Ritz. I have stayed at some very nice hotels but this was great. The amenities were outstanding and I really have to say I enjoyed and was not expecting a balcony. Glad it was for business though because it was very pricey drinks and apps at the bar...don't think I've ever paid $30 for buffalo wings before. Service was great, room was very nice, the gym was excellent. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual high Ritz standards”
Reviews.Author: NorwichScot
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at quite a few Ritz's and although this one is very good (and probably the best hotel in Orlando), it fell short in a number of areas when you compare it to other Ritz Carltons. Rooms were nice and spacious with great beds and showers. The bath-tub isn't deep enough though. Spotlessly clean. Breakfast service was poor and the choice at the buffet was just ok. The biggest problem though was that somehow they managed to check another guest into our room and I kept getting messages for this person and whenever they answered the phone it was for "Mr.........." and not me. This made me nervous and I kept a close eye on our account to make sure things didn't get wrongly charged. As Ritz's go this one is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: dlist25
Reviews.Content: The Beds were very comfortable, and the staff was very attentive, however, I did not feel the food or rooms were Ritz quality. An above average hotel but closer to a JW marriott than a Ritz Carlton. We would stay at this hotel again as we enjoyed our relaxing experience. If you have stayed at the Ritz Carlton Naples Beach, there is no comparison. There are waters in the morning for after your jog, and coffee and Cocoa at night for when you are coming in. Nice touches

Reviews.Title: “Ritz lives up to reputation”
Reviews.Author: ybgdess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Maui, Hawaii and loved it! We heard great things about the Ritz in Orlando and decided last minute to stay there on our way back home from Ft. Lauderdale. As always, the service was impeccable. Everyone was extremely helpful and nice. I can't say enough about the front desk staff! The hotel was gorgeous, as expected. We had a lake view and it was very pretty (we were on the 5th floor). The room itself looked about the same as our room in Maui, so I assume all Ritz rooms are nearly identical. The only difference I noticed was that the Ritz in Orlando did not have a tub/shower AND a standing shower - it only had a tub and a standing shower. Not a big deal - more than more hotels. But I had liked that in Maui my husband and I could get ready at the same time. The bed is the most comfortable bed I've ever stayed in. My lower back hurts a lot in hotel beds. We had just gotten done staying at a wonderful Marriott resort in Ft. Lauderdale, but my back had even started to hurt there. I had no back trouble at all with the Rtiz bed - I wish I could bring the mattress home with me! We had room service for dinner and breakfast, so I can't speak to the restaurants on site. But the room service was great; very tasty. It was highly priced, but room service always is. The grounds looked nice. We got in late and didnt' have time to enjoy most of the amenities, but the pool looked nice. Plus, there were hammocks throughout the grounds, boats to rent, bikes, boce ball, etc. The spa is shared with the Marriott, which also looked nice. However, I was more impressed with the pool (and grounds in general) at the Ritz in Maui. The hotel is somewhat in the middle of nowhere and since it is a resort, it can sustain itself. But, if you're looking to be close to attractions, this is not the place to stay. It also annoyed me that you have to pay for parking. The hotel is not in the middle of the city where parking is limited and the hotel has to be pay the city for parking spots (like in big cities I've been to, such as Seattle). So they charge you $20 + tax a day for parking and do they really need to??? No - they are in the middle of nowhere - tons of parking availabiliy. It's just another way to make money. And with the rooms being as expensive as they are, I wish they could just let you have free parking! Also, there didn't seem to be a restaurant on site that was inexpensive - everything was pretty pricey. Overall, I loved my stay at the Ritz. The people were fantastic and the beds and room service were great. I LOVE Ritz Carltons in general and was not disappointed here. While I was highly happy with my stay, I have to say that I think the Ritz in Maui is hands above this one. But it could just be the wonderful location! ;-) I would definitely stay here again though!

Reviews.Title: “Still Great-- Two Years Later!”
Reviews.Author: tradergirl93
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience in April of 2006, and twenty months later, the hotel is still fabulous. Come to the Ritz for the personnel-- they are fabulous. No employee ever passes the buck, and our stay this time was no exception. It's Orlando, which means that this Ritz is as kid friendly as any on the planet. There's a kiddie pool and small playground, and of course a giant kids menu. Children are given either crayons or a sticker activity at the restaurant table. Kid entrees run between $7 and $9 generally. The room service menu (for kids and adults) is outstanding. The only trouble we had was with billing-- we had 3 rooms under one name, and somehow a day before we were to leave, one of them was bizzarely "checked out" ahead of time. It took awhile to straighten out, but they got it right, with many apologies. Whoever wrote in another review that the pool was "small and cold" is nuts! We swam on a cool rainy 72 degree day and the pool was, as promised, heated to 84 degrees. The only trouble was getting out! Combine that with the extensive JW Marriott on the same property-- you can use that pool too-- and you'll never want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando's Best Secret”
Reviews.Author: lwsathome
Reviews.Content: Attention Theme Park Patrons: Forget the overpriced, below average Holiday Inn knock-off rooms offered by Disney. Spend your money on the beautiful Ritz at Grande Lakes and drive (yes, drive) the 15 minutes to the parks. This property is beautiful, the Spa is the best in Orlando, the food outsanding, and the service is true to Ritz Carlton tradition--superb. I can't understand why people pay $300 or more to stay in those shaby rooms at crowded Disney resorts. If you want to stay at a Deluxe Disney resort, be prepared to shell out at least $300, and prepare to be disappointed. Our room at the Ritz Grande Lakes the weekend before Christmas was $235, and was luxuriously appointed with a huge bathroom stocked with Bulgari products. As far as being family friendly, the hotel offers a special "Kids Check-in" at reception, had a Teddy Bear Tea, Tuck-ins by Santa, a Gingerbread Village and train in the lobby, a kids playground and pool, and even kids spa treatments! My kids loved the Ritz Grand Lakes so much my daughter wrote out on the hotel stationay, "I love Ritz Carlton. This place is fun." She knows the deal--and she's only 6! They do offer town car service to the parks, and will give you all the brochures you want at the Concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Property”
Reviews.Author: LuvGolfTravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Ritz Orlando for a quick two night getaway. I travel frequently for business and pleasure and found this to be one of the more pleasant experiences that I can remember. First and foremost, the staff was outstanding. We never wanted for anything and were treated at all times, by all hotel personnel with the utmost respect and attention. The property itself is beautiful. At first, I thought that sharing the property with the Marriott was unfortunate, but sharing facilities actually allows each hotel to offer a continguous and beautifully manicured outdoor lawn and pool area. It also has resulted in a spectacular spa. We took the golf and spa package. The Norman course was attractive to me because it has no buildings on it. While it's not the most dramatic or challenging course, it is very well kept. For 2 days, I had the course and the impressive practice area to myself (literally, it's not as busy during this down season). You are assigned a caddie for the entire round and it ends up being an 18 hole lesson. Ask for Caddie Nick, a good guy who provides solid instruction. I've played many better courses, but I've had few golf experiences that were as pleasant. There were a few drawbacks that, in fairness, might affect someone more sensitive. While the food on the patio is excellent (and accompanied by great service), there is the typical price gouging you'll see at a 5 star resort. I'm not sure if this is a seasonal thing, but it also seemed as if the Ritz was punting some of its facilities to the Marriott. The Ritz outdoor jacuzzi was cooler than desirable, and the otherwise stunning, "heated" pool was ... not so much. Again, could be a seasonal thing during a down time. I would definitely return to this hotel, particularly for a short getaway because of the staff and the convenience and quality of the hotel, spa and golf facilities.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun for adults!!!”
Reviews.Author: KellyinKentucky
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay. We booked the reconnect package, so you get a $50 spa/golf credit as well as free breakfast buffet in the vineyard grill - which is soooooo yummy!!! ..... I highly recommend booking this package. The holiday atmosphere is soooooo perfect. Everybody goes above and beyond to make you feel so special and really adds to the beauty of the resort. Gorgeous pool - wonderful spa! A great weekend escape for adults!!

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 star quality hotel at a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: HonestandReliable
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Deluxe room. This is a genuine 5 star quality establishment with superb friendly service, food and furnishings. The room was immaculate with a marbled bathroom containing separate WC area, bath and shower, twin sinks, Bulgari toiletries, plenty of soft clean towels and gallons of HOT water. The daily breakfast buffet (downstairs restaurant) was excellent and only $20. If in a hurry, grab a delicious coffee from Peet's coffee stall in the lobby. The downstairs restaurant is of Michelin star quality at fair prices. Very accessible for airport and all attractions-25 mins max. Quality live music almost every evening in the lounge. Concierge desk is the most helpful I have ever experienced, nothing is a problem. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “They sure love to spoil your kids!”
Reviews.Author: Iprefer5stars
Reviews.Content: We left a resort called the Ginn Reunion because of a bad service and rude staff especially the front desk staff and moved to the Ritz Carlton during a recent vacation to Orlando. The Ritz was great! The property was next door to the JW Marriott and shared pools and spa. The pools were nice with a beautiful lazy river and hot tubs. It was huge. Around the pool were kids activities, a pool table, ping pong, tether ball, chess games. The recreation department was wonderful and the staff would do stuff with your kids. My 11 and 12 year olds went missing and I found them playing games with the staff. They also get free ice cream at with a wrist band they get at the pool. The service is great and as you leave for a park they give you water bottles. A great breakfast was included with our room, which was perfect before spending the day in Orlando. The only bad thing about the Ritz is that the rooms were uncomfortable for a family, beds were small and rooms were small, but it was okay because the staff and service was fantastic. I would recommend this hotel if your want to hand out by a nice pool and play and to go to parks like Universal and Sea World since they are so close by. It is really close to airport too. Be sure to check out the spa which is nice and you can use it just for the day. It is also a great place for couples. Give it a try on your next Orlando visit, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect from a Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: AriGold444
Reviews.Content: We have come to expect high standards of Ritz-Carlton properties as with the Ritz Carlton Key Biscayne. We have been in Orlando for two weeks in August 2006 for the Mensa World Gathering, and rather than to stay at some run-down Disney property, we figured we´d stay at the Ritz Carlton. The pricing was about the same as the Ritz-Carlton Key Biscayne, sky-high, so we expected similar levels of service. It became obvious, however, that our expectations were way too high: Whilst the Key Biscayne property sits in a secluded oceanfront lot, the Ritz Carlton Orlando basically sits right in the middle of nowhere. True, there is a golf course close by, but that doesnt really justify a $600 a night price tag, does it ? Valet parking was available at $28 per day, but obviously, the parking lot wasnt paved, as the car arrived dusty and dirty every morning. The rooms were ok-ish, but: again, the Ritz Carlton bathroom doors look more like closet blinds than doors. The TV set was old and the picture quality very poor. The pool was rather small, too cold and dirty. But the most annoying thing was a high-pitched, screeching noise that was interrupting the silence anywhere on the property every ten seconds or so, it made it hard to sleep at night. We attributed it to some screechy AC on the roof, and we had housekeeping check into the noise several times - all to no avail. Then, during the second week of our stay, some engineer figured that this noise was designed to be there to get rid of the birds ! Apparently, guests are not supposed to hear the noises at all because they are in a frequency range normally not detectable by humans. Well, either we are freaks or silly, but my wife and I both could not sleep for two weeks because of that noise, and it sucked. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: skella
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Nov 10. It was a nice Ritz Property. Kind of pricey. Very clean, staff was very helpful. Pool was beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Unsanitary Drinking Glasses”
Reviews.Author: atatn
Reviews.Content: Let's get right to the health code violation. One day I was in my room while the housekeeper was cleaning. I witnessed, with my own two eyes, the housekeeper rinsing dirty drinking glasses in a dirty sink. She put them on the counter as if they were clean. They may look clean, but we all know better. Infectious diseases can live on these glasses despite their "clean" appearance. Hopefully, the glasses are changed out between occupants. But, who knows? I kind of doubt it. A champagne glass in my room had lipstick on it - that's definitely not clean. This is a health code violation without question. (A television report from Atlanta that recently aired found the same problem at the Ritz Carlton in Atlanta. That television report recorded this happening with hidden cameras.) Obviously, this is company policy and not an isolated event. Advice: Bring disposable cups or stay somewhere else. On the bright side, the room was really quiet, had a nice view, and had a very comfortable bed. All of the staff were really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Forget Disney Hotels, to really spoil your family take them to the RITZ”
Reviews.Author: KMWShropshire
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this fabulous hotel and I have to admit that I was a little concerned that it wouldn't be as good as the first time - I worried for nothing, if anything it was even better than I remembered. I took my family and grandchildren this time and as before booked us into rooms on the club floor. What a wonderfull surprise to be upgraded to a corner suite with an adjoining bedroom for my grandchildren. We all had a fabulous time at the Ritz Carlton, the staff seem to be programmed to know our every wish before we did, it really was like a home from home. Housekeeping, room service, concierge, Bell Captains, Receptionist were all friendly, welcoming and totally professional. Whilst we were there the space shuttle was launched and the evening before we recieved an invitation from the Hotel Manager to join a viewing party for the launch. How thoughtful not only to remind us and invite us but to also serve iced lemonade whilst we watched and waited? The Ritz Carlton kids club is better than anything you will find at Disney. The kids have their own area in reception to check in and are given bands to wear which allows them to have free ice cream anywhere in the hotel. They also had their own robes and slippers, when you are aged 4 and 6 it's really fun to copy the grown ups! I couldn't fault anything about our stay, and will be returning as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Yarutsi1014
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Ritz Carlton in Orlando. It was our 2 year wedding anniversary and we visited this property at the suggestion of a family member and it was wonderful! Since the hotel knew it was our anniversary, the room was prepared with rose petals prior to our arrival. They even had classical music playing in the room when we arrived! The staff at this hotel is incredibly helpful and friendly. We stayed in one of the executive suites which was huge! The beds at this hotel are so comfortable you don't want to get out bed. The property is fairly expansive with the JW Marriott next door. We wandered the property on our last day there and it was really beautiful. The only downside was our restaurant visit.
