We ate at the Vineyard Grill. While the food wasn't bad, it certainly wasn't worth the $110 bill. I ate some of the weirdest tasting mashed potatoes I've ever had. They literally tasted like Cool Ranch Doritos. Not bad, just strange. Although, my husband had a steak and enjoyed it. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for pampering off the beaten path in Orlando. Keeping your distance from the Disney area is definitely good for the psyche.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: mifeliciano
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for Labor Day weekend and had a wonderful time. My husband, my two kids(7 and 5) and myself usually stay at the Disney Deluxe hotels but we had a gift certificate to the Ritz so we decided to try it. It was wonderful! The staff, the room, the room service was excellent. My kids really enjoyed the lazy river pool at the adjacent Marriott and they loved being able to watch the fireworks display the hotel put on from our balcony. We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: koala
Reviews.Content: We have been here several times now and everytime we are surprised by the whole atmosphere of the hotel. Unfortunately we arrived during Labor-day-weekend, very busy, very crowded, kid's everywhere. Pool area very busy, club-lounge very busy. On monday-afternoon the hotel turned back into the normal quiet, peaceful heaven as we know it and the rests of he day's we had a very relaxing stay. The Spa was superb! The massages were awesome! And the facial-treatment the best!!!! We loved drivin' around in the hotel's mercedes-benz (special package)! Very nice, lovely suite. We felt home away from home again and will go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandTinkerbell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 17th July 07 for 3 nights.We were a family of 4 and we had the most wonderful end to our holiday.The hotel is amazing- the rooms are sooooooooooo luxurious,the staff couldn't be more helpful and the food out of this world!.The reception rooms are vast and everything is gleaming! .First class facilities for adults and kids and the spa is extra special! To sum up this has to be the best hotel in Orlando,and possibly one of the best in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Who let the dogs in?”
Reviews.Author: Bosworth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Ritz Carlton for a wedding anniversary celebration. The staff were excellent and the room was delightful and very clean as usual, but that was about it. I can only think that the RC has chosen to go after a different kind of clientele. Usually any RC is a haven of peace, quiet and tranquility and that is why we stay there. This was not the case with the Orlando hotel which was full of brash, brassy noisy and pushy 20 and 30 somethings many with kids that they did not control. We actually saw a guy sitting in the lounge wearing an undervest and shorts. Nobody asked him to cover up. In the evening there was a nice Latin band in the lounge, but the 20 somethings (in Jeans !!!) allowed their pesky kids to inhabit the dance floor at 10 in the evening. One child - no more than two or three years old - was tottering between the mamboing adults. She was about knee height and could not be seen easily by the dancers. It was a serious accident waiting to happen, but nobody from the hotel staff asked the mother to control her child. The RC should certainly tighten up on their behavior and dress codes to justify their premium prices.. Additionally we were charged a $20 fee per night for parking. There was no alternative. This was very aggravating and certainly very bad customer relations. There is no need for it and it is simply nickle and diming. Not appropriate behavior for an hotel of the calibre of the RC. Where can one go now for a refined and tranquil weekend surrounded by ones peers?. It seems the RC has lost it, more is the pity.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: zhangpianist
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed here was two years ago, when the Ritz-Carlton Orlando was fairly new. This time, the staff is just as nice. They even provided bottled water and towels at the front desk during check-in while we waited for the processing. They upgraded us from a $199 standard room to a $259 lake-golf-front room for FREE! We arrived at the room and the view was AWESOME!!!! The room offered 4 bottles of free water, 2 double beds, flat-screen TV, suit hanger, double-door closet, and the Bathroom was the best part. To the front was 2 sinks with white marble countertops. Under the sink were four boxes, 2 on the left, 2 on the right, all of which contained the towels. To the left were a glass-enclosed shower, and a toilet in its own private room! to the right was the separate bath tub. There were two robes given, but there is one thing I must complain about. Since last year, none of the Ritz-Carltons provide slippers. Back then, the slippers were actually pretty special. There was actually a determined left and right foot slipper, but now, there are no slippers at all. I don't know what happened. But other than the slippers, the room is perfect! Toiletries are Bvlgari, and if you were to get them at the store, it would cost almost as much as the hotel room, so you might as well get them at the Ritz for FREE!!! I also went to the pool and then sneaked over to the JW Marriott pool. They were both AWESOME! At the Ritz-Carlton pool, they offered free towels and free bottled water, and the pool is ENORMOUS! Overall, this was just flawless. But because of the slippers, I do drop this from 5-star to perhaps 4.6, 4.7, or 4.8 star. The best thing about all ritz-carltons is the niceness of the people. This is the reputation of all Ritz-Carltons, even if the rooms aren't so good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: FLTraveler1221
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes for one night. We had 2 adjoining deluxe garden rooms. The rooms were spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated. The service was outstanding. We would definitely return. The hotel is located less than 5 minutes from Seaworld and Discovery Cove.

Reviews.Title: “How the Mighty have Fallen”
Reviews.Author: RichTBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I almost feel like rating this one as "terrible." The property itself would seem to have a lot to offer: beautiful rooms, expert grounds, lots of amenities and facilities. But we were here as part of a convention, and I have had better experiences at two-star properties. The simplest directions are often gotten wrong, the food is marginal, complaints are virtually ignored, and for the amount of money they charge, you expect more attentive service. If you can get this place for under $200 a night, then consider it, but if you're looking for a "grand Florida experience" you'll be disappointed. For these prices you can stay at a Disney resort and they'll make sure you're pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: pvtsms
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Ritz around 1:30 am on 7-19-07. Needless to say our flight was delayed and we were exhausted - mom, dad, 2 kids. The front desk staff was so gracious and helpful and escorted us to our room. We booked the family escape package and the suite we were given was beautiful and very large. The package also included breakfast for all of us. The beds are comfy and and the layout of the suite was exceptional. There was the kids' room with a full bath, the living area with a half bath and wet bar area, then the master bedroom with a king bed and an oversized bathroom that included a bath, separate LARGE shower and makeup/vanity area. Amenities were top of the line. 7/19 was my husband's birthday and we are Ritz loyalists. They sent up a bottle of superb champagne with a beautifully decorated plate of cookies and chocolates. What a wonderful touch! The kids also received one of the kids' bags with cameras, wrist bands (for the free unlimited ice cream!) and a few other goodies. The Ritz pool is great for relaxation, but the Marriott pool is more fun for kids with the lazy river and tubes. We enjoyed both pools and highly recommend them! The spa at Grand Lakes is nicely done as well. We did not have any services, but used the gym every day. It is a fair size with Precor equipment and free weights. There are plenty of cold towels and drinking water and headphones available. We ate at the Vineyard Grille for breakfast each day and were greeted with enthusiasm and smiles by all. We were fortunate enough to have our same waitress almost every day of our stay which was a plus as she remembered all our preferences. The buffet chef was phenomenal and quite personable. The food was good, not outstanding. But, remember we only had breakfast there! The hotel itself is gorgeous and connects to the Marriott through the convention area. We had a truly wonderful stay and each employee we encountered was friendly, courteous and seemed to genuinely want to make our day better and brighter.

Reviews.Title: “loved the reitz orlando”
Reviews.Author: ma1018
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel. Staff is superb. Donald Stamets is the general manager he runs his facility better tha a five star. We keep going back .Ritz kids is the ultimate.Club level staff treats you like royalty. Best place to take your kids in Oralndo. Beautiful rooms great pool, and delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “Jaw Dropping Experience!”
Reviews.Author: chrismmiller123
Reviews.Content: OK FOLKS......My company just held a National Meeting at this AMAZING piece of Real Estate. The staff was excellent and the rooms were wonderful. I look for good beds when I stay somewhere......well.....NO worries here....they were great! If i were to stay in orlando again.....I would have a hard time staying anywhere else.... honeymooners, or for a one night surprise.....this one is HIGH CLASS! Before you decide on a place to stay....please seriously look at this exceptional property. ...oh and lets not forget about the BREATHTAKING views!!!.....

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: northamericatourist
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Orlando spending 5 days at the resort with my 13 year old son. We couldn't of had a better vacation thanks to the Ritz. I was a little concerned staying away from the parks but realized quickly how nice it is to return to such a beautiful, quiet, stress free enviroment. We played lots of golf at the resort and never ran in to anyone on the course, before 2 they pair you up with a caddy which is nice helping you with strategy on the course and plus you can pick his brain for local restuarants. I was curious with the JW Marriott next door and truly you can't go wrong with either resort. The Ritz is more quiet, and the guest seem more affluent, honeymooners, business travelers, etc... You will see the difference at the pool whereas the Ritz isn't as busy and people laying out reading, whereas the Marriott you have lots more kids, interaction in the pool, fun times. I must say the coffee was better at the Marriott being a Starbuck's plus it's cheaper, worth the walk in the morning. This place is truly amazing and such a nice quiet enviroment away from Universal and Disney. We did eat most of our meals away from the resort dinner especially, One of my favorite steak houses is the Palm and there is one in Orlando at the Hard Rock Hotel at Universal. I gurantee you will not find a better piece of meat than here, plus there half/half is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Warning about valet parking - self park if you can!”
Reviews.Author: formerphap
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Ritz on three occasions prior to last month and never had any problems whatsoever. It is a lovely property. However, during a recent stay in May my car was returned to me from valet parking with contents from my glove compartment, center console, and gym bag strewn all over. Obviously someone had gone through it while it was parked in valet. While there was no forced entry, I suppose the doors had been left unlocked. When I spoke with the manager on duty, I found that this is not an uncommon problem at this property and numerous break ins have occurred in recent weeks. The most disappointing thing about this situation is that no one offered any consolation for the stolen property, even after I wrote to the general manager of the Ritz! My opinion of the Ritz Carlton chain has been severely tarnished as a result. It's really just a higher level of Marriott - forget the five star service you might expect!

Reviews.Title: “Not immpressed with this Ritz”
Reviews.Author: risabar2
Reviews.Content: After staying at a number of Ritz Carlton's thru the years, I expected much better from this establishment. The staff was cordial at best, the food overpriced and mediocore and the grounds just average. A party of 6 for dinner wasn't told gratuity was included and we grossly overtipped, still waiting for that to be rectified. Asked a staff member for a quick lunch and we were directed to the extravagant Sunday brunch - in our bathing coverups. Went for a swim in the JW Marriott, the pool was better, especially for children. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Must have stayed at a different hotel from other reviewers!”
Reviews.Author: Christina B
Reviews.Content: Someone we were traveling with on this trip aptly stated: "When you stay at a Four Seasons, it's all about YOU; when you stay at the Ritz Carlton, it's all about THEM". When we checked in, we were informed a room with king bed (per our request) was not available. The desk attendant told us there were very few "king rooms", and they were all taken. She was very business-like, and we really didn't get the impression she had any interest in anything other than getting us away from the desk in spite of our pleasant acceptance of our room assignment! We were checking in early so can't imagine how "all king rooms were taken", but . . . We were told we would be "compensated" by being upgraded to a room with a view. This upgrade turned out to be a fifth floor room over children's pool and restaurant with distant view of piece of golf course. Bottled water was handed out to guests checking in by a man who was the only one with a sincere smile! The room was nice enough but nothing special especially for the rate we were paying per night (in excess of $325 with tax). Ice was not offered to us. There was a small balconey which had a table and two chairs covered with bird poop! It was not cleaned during our stay. We had a need to call housekeeping for an issue, and the woman on the phone was lovely and assured us someone would be right up. A half hour later, housekeeping came to the door to see if we'd been taken care of. When we said no, she said, "Oh, OK . . . I'll do it right now". I believe she was the person originally asked to come and had just taken longer than necessary so was covering her delay. The hotel is not convenient to any shopping or attractions, but they do offer a shuttle to Universal and Sea World. When we spoke with the concierge about this service, we were told the shuttle had already left for the day. We asked about other transportation, and he said a car to take us to the malls was $25 each way, and the price to be driven to the Disney parks was $30-40 each way. These prices did not include the necessary gratuities. When we did not jump at the offer to book a car, he had no further interest in helping us with any other suggestions. We should have inquired about cabs; there were none outside. We did have a fantastic dinner in The Vineyard with Michael as our superb waiter. The Caesar salad was excellent, soup was fantastic, and the wine list, albeit expensive, was top notch. Wonderful experience in this restaurant and definitely best part of our stay at the Ritz. We actually cut our trip short and left this hotel to stay elsewhere (Ginn Resort in Reunion), and it was the second best part of our Ritz experience. We have not stayed at any of the other high end resorts in Orlando so can't make a comparison, but we certainly would not call this Ritz an exceptional experience based on our recent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Solic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz last August and considered it the best hotel we have stayed at in Orlando, including the Grand Floridian. The service is exceptional and the rooms beautiful. The advantage is that whilst you can enjoy the theme parks you can escape and relax and feel that you are somewhere else. The only complaint, if any, is the fact that you have to valet park at about $19 per night (plus tip) but if you factor in the cost when making a reservation then it is not too bad. When you do need the car you just telephone down to the Valet and it is there when you go down. Would definately stay at this hotel again if travelling to Orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Done Right!”
Reviews.Author: akoser
Reviews.Content: I frequent most of the Florida Ritz-Carlton locations for both business and pleasure, however this was my first visit to the Orlando Grande Lakes location. My best regards go out to the management of this hotel as this property is a shining star in every respect. I traveled to Grande Lakes accompanied by my family to attend a conference held jointly and the Ritz-Carlton and the adjoining JW Marriott. From check-in to check-out, every aspect of my Ritz Carlton experience was flawless and most enjoyable. My children really enjoyed the Kid's Check-In that allowed them to register while sipping complementary lemonade as well as being presented with wristbands that could be shown at any hotel eatery to get free ice cream. The room and bathroom were absolutely spotless and well maintained as were all common areas. The pool was lovely and uncrowded even though the hotel was at capacity due to my conference. Perhaps another reason for the uncrowded pool was that Ritz Carlton guests could use the incredible pool facility at the adjacent JW Marriott. The Marriott has a great pool with a fun lazy river to be sure and is only about a one minute stroll from the Ritz pool. Lots of different pool "areas" at the Marriott allow for a very uncrowded environment. Poolside expenses at the Marriott pool may be conveniently charged to your room at the Ritz. After staying at the Ritz/Marriott complex, I found myself wondering why someone would stay at an overpriced Disney resort when this complex is by far grander than any Disney property I have visited and is only a 10-15 minute drive away. Food at the Ritz was top-shelf indeed. Upon arrival, we had a late dinner at the Ritz's casual dining restaurant and were very impressed. I had an incredible porterhouse steak and my wife had a lobster salad that was the best I have ever tasted. My family ate one luch poolside at the Ritz and enjoyed it very much. We did not use room service during our visit. I attended a private luncheon related to my conference at the Ritz and was really impressed with the food, especially after experiencing the conference lunches served at the JW Marriott which were almost uneatable. No comparison possible with respect to food. Conference facilities at both hotels were very nice. We did not use the spa or golf course during our stay. We most assuredly look forward to another stay at this fine complex.

Reviews.Title: “Unlike any other hotel in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: hotchr
Reviews.Content: Lots of families and conventioners here but that's to be expected. Far more luxury for far less money than the pseudo-luxury Grand Floridian on Disney property. You think Disney's gonna splurge for Bvlgari White Tea shampoos and soap at any of their resorts? Puh-lease. BTW I doubt few couples come here but that was the case with me so you won't get a family perspective here. Anyway I digress...upon driving up you are greeted with a panther fountain (perhaps a nod to Florida's panthers?) and a choice to go to the JW Marriott or Ritz. Pulling in valet rushed over, took our car, and had a bellman whisk away our luggage. Scented cold towels and bottled water? Check. Woman checking us in with a heavy accent? Check but whatever. Next something unusual, a manager of sorts escorts us with our room keys over to our room. Nice touch, personal service evident. After he leaves bellhop arrives, notices our bottle of wine we purchased on the way over and calls up room service for a chiller, another nice touch. Amazing balcony, oversized room, incredible shower. Next we decide to head over to the pool...get our towels at the cabana poolside but are offered by an attendant to "set us up" sure thing. We scout out the pefect spot, he places three towels per chair, tip him for his efforts. Ended up spending the entire afternoon here, and yes the attendants come by with all kinds of goodies: pineapple slices, smoothie samples, cold towels, Dippin Dots, snow cones, etc. Ordered a snack from Bleu, the pool bar...lobster quesadillas were outstanding. Always called down to valet 5-10 minutes so they'd have our car ready, exceptional. Live steel drum music on a Saturday afternoon was pure paradise. Missed it on Sunday. Ate at the Vineyard Grill...not too impressed. Heard Norman's wasn't worth checking out so didn't bother. Did have tea in the lobby lounge, which btw the lounge at this Ritz is way too noisy and yes lots of conventioners with their crackberries sort of killing the vacationing mode I was in but I'd rather see them than kids running barefoot through the lobby of a 5 star hotel. Improvements? Really nothing, except not allow so much abuse from guests of the JW Marriott next door to use the Ritz's pool, it was evident in the louder guests by their bathrobes emblazoned with the winged lion logo. This Ritz is probably the most outstanding hotel in Orlando. By no means should you consider a deluxe Disney resort if your ok with spending this kind of money, the service continues to decline and service is no where near as personal, the extras aren't there and if they are Disney nickels and dimes you to death, and you end up paying even more than the Ritz. P.S. I read a couple of the negative reviews about this place but realized they were few and far between. The comment about "being swarmed with bugs" is in fact true...if you consider love bugs a pest (when in fact they are not). Esp. if you hang out by the pool areas during certain times of the year but you shouldn't be bothered by them whatsoever, they don't even bite or sting...it's kinda nice to see something in nature that mates for life.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service”
Reviews.Author: kksdc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 3 nights and couldn't be more impressed with the extremely professional yet friendly staff. Everyone we encountered, from the bellmen to the people on the phone taking our room service order, really went out of their way to be gracious, attentive, and courteous. Check-in was great--very speedy, and even though we arrived early we were given a great room with all of our requests met. Our daughter really liked the kids' check-in with fresh lemonade and cold towel-- The hotel is lovely--well-maintained, with nicely decorated rooms, Bulgari toiletries in bathroom, and I believe all rooms have a balcony and overlook either the pool or the golf course. Although it is about a 20-25 minute drive to Disney, it is well worth returning to "civilization" after the Disney crowds-- It is definitely a family-friendly hotel and they really did a nice job catering to children while maintaining a level of sophistication and decorum. The food was excellent wherever we ate-- My only complaint was the spa. I went there 2 different days and both days the waiting area was taken over by large and very loud groups of women. Other spas I have visited have signs designating some rooms as "Quiet rooms"--sad that people should have to be told to keep their voices down, but apparently it needs to be spelled out for some people. There were several weddings while we were there and the members of the wedding party, not hotel guests, brought huge suitcases full of clothes and makeup and took over the locker rooms, shower area, etc. Again, a spa of this size should designate one locker room to groups so that the rest of the guests can enjoy a little peace and quiet... Overall, though, I give this hotel rave reviews. We've been staying at Ritz-Carltons for 15 years and definitely noticed a difference in the staff this time--like they have been recently re-trained--I was really, really impressed and will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FriscoTX_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a beatiful property!!!! There is so much to do just on the property itself. The pools were amazing along with the restaurant selections. My husband loved the golf course. It's close to Disney and right across the street from Sea World. You can get the Orlando experience but feel you're staying at a Caribbean resorts while not attending the theme parks! And the spa is to die for!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: tstaack
Reviews.Content: A couple of my friends and I recently visited the Ritz for a "Mommy's Spa Getaway," and I am so glad we did! From the moment we arrived, the service was superb. We stayed in the Excecutive Suite with a lake view, and it was gorgeous - two heavenly beds, two balconys overlooking the lake and pool, plenty of towels, a robe for each of us, and a super comfy couch (that I ended up sleeping on because one of my friends snored too loud). The spa was equally impressive. I had the custom facial with Angela, and it was the best facial I've ever had. Likewise, the Citrus Pedicure was so luxurious and relaxing. Days later, my feet are still soft and pretty. The food and wine at The Vineyard Grill was excellent. I had the Blackened Snapper, and I only wish I could duplicate it for my husband because it was sooo delicious. I highly recommend this resort. We all decided that we will spend every "Mommy Getaway" at the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful retreat”
Reviews.Author: ACPACPACP
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Orlando is a newly erected hotel, a few minutes driving from Disney World. Together with the neighbouring Marriott it is surrounded by a golf course. We were booked on a club floor (14th floor), which features spacious rooms, an extra recpetion and 5 food presentations daily. They charged 10$ for 24h wireless internet and 20$ for overnight valet parking. Unfortunately we only had a 2 night stay, but next Disneyworld visit will come for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: WishWeCouldSeeItAll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights and 3 days at the Ritz Carlton and I truly have nothing negative to say. We arrived at 10am (an hour before check-out) and were given every single request (high floor, non-smoking, kind bed) and escorted to our room getting a friendly tour of the hotel as we did. Your bags are completely taken care of (as they should in 4-star hotels), every staff member greets you and is informed and polite. The room was just great, clean, well appointed and as other reviewers have mention - great bathroom. I especially liked the Bvlgari toiletrees (as I am a fan). We had a wonderful pool view from the 11th floor and enjoyed a gorgeous sunset every night from our balcony. We had booked in advanced for a table at Norman's (however, the restaurant never completely filled during the evening) and well, the food was just amazing! We do eat at a lot of great restaurants and are somewhat hard to please, but we were stunned. The service was great and polite. Only thing I will say is they need to work on their desserts - neither of us loved ours, and mine was bad and taken off the bill (I appreciate that, so not really negative). Compared to other hotels of the same standard there is absolutely nothing I can say in the negative - and that is great! I would stay here again, in a second. We never ventured to the JW or it's restaurants, so I cannot comment. The pool was great, large and lots of room for lying around it. The pool staff were extremely friendly and helpful (one weird thing is I've never been to a hotel with BLUE towels - I did miss the clean-look of the white towel - but they're just as absorbent, so no negatives there) Oh, while you can very easily get yourself a Town Car (our preference), we did ask for a Cab and were just given a Town Car. Perhaps we were misunderstood, but preferred the Car anyway - it's almost exactly the same price, everywhere you go. I would recommend you call the Hotel before your stay and request a Town Car pickup if you're flying in - it was $45, and was great and convienent (plus they know when you're arriving. Perhaps it's why our room was ready so early).

Reviews.Title: “Not Disney, but Total Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Travel101-Trip
Reviews.Content: This is five star and total Ritz but allow me to tell elaborate: Location: Much like Walt Disney has done with Disney in transforming swamp into gold, Ritz Carleton and Marriott have done with this site. You need to know that is is not at all adjoining the Disney parks and is in fact quite a drive if that is what you are looking for. Just as it is removed, you will not find any association to Disney nearby. No mouse ears or theams anywhere. Also, the site was created from the ground up which is good and bad. Good in the sense that they could create everything from scratch, bad in that it is removed. Again, much like what Disney did. Transportation: Before I go too far I need to point out transportation. If you are like me and staying mostly onsite for business, you will NOT rent a car. No rentals are on-site at the airport so you need to take the dreaded bus. My taxi ride from a stand at the airport was $45 with tip. My ride back from the Ritz in one of the many Limo's they always have standing by was $47 with tip. If you are staying at the hotel, have them arrange for your arrival at the airport. Service and Quality: Classic Ritz. When I checked in even though it was not a terribly warm day I was offered a cool towell and iced lemonade during checkin. I had two people assisting me throughout the checkin process. I did have a special rate at $229 per night. I've been at Ritz Carlton quite a few times before at both MUCH higher rates and even at lower rates and the service is consistenet. Room: I found the room to be exactly what you would expect from this hotel. The bathroom was huge with a seperate shower and tub, a digital scale, and Bulgari shampoos, condiditioners, and lotions everywhere, which is a big plus. Two months later and I am still using the lotions. All doors were solid wood, closet lights turned on when opened, and the entire room had a fresh rose potpourri scent throughout, even after I had been there several days. Not that I have a foul smell, but I could not ever figure our where this plesent scent came from. Dining: When I first checked in it was evening and I just ordered room service. I must say the service was excellent, and my simple Club sandwach with a Side Salad were both excellent with the service. Also the price was right (as opposed to going off site and finding McDonalds). However, another night in my stay I did dine at Norman's and was not impressed. While our service was great, this was possibly the least memorable meal I've had in this type of resturaunt. I do not even remember what I ordered and if I enjoyed it. Neither do any of my guests. We do however remember our primary server and his service. This unfortunately does not make up for our lack of rememberance of our other servers. Pools / Spa's: As stated earlier, this property was created from the ground up so the pool area is wonderful for adults. Kids might enjoy the lazy river at the JW adjoining property. I cannot comment on the spa's. Summary: This is a classic Ritz property and you will be treated with respect (Yes Sir/Mam, No Sir/Mam) and the ever peresent "My Pleasure" which they mean. I give this my highest rating also because it is attached to another major resort (JW Marriott).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Week at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: TripAddictIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week as part of our honeymoon. Overall we had a great week. However, we did not receive any upgrade / benefits even though we were on honeymoon which I was a little disappointed with. The staff were great at this hotel. Everyone made us feel very welcome. I have stayed at the JW next door on another trip and I found it to be very good also. In fact the buffet breakfast is much better in the JW, and we ate there most mornings. We used the Town Cars on two occasions and found them to be great. If we do go back we will use them all the time. The pool area was fab at the Ritz. The Italian restaurant in the JW was our favourite and the manager there really did his very best to make us feel welcome and made a fuss of the fact that we were on honeymoon. He was great! My husband met John Travolta in the steam room which made his honeymoon as he loves his movies! We had a couples massage which was only OK. Expensive for what we got I thought. Overall - a great experience. We did have a problem one night in the bar where nobody came near us and the service was very poor but we left no tip in response. In general we are v generous tippers but on this one night the service was really appaling. Also at the weekend it tends to become "Conference Central" which we found a little off putting as we were on honeymoon and wanted to relax. Book it if you get a good rate. The room and bathroom were fab also!

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerM
Reviews.Content: We were staying here for a convention and LOVED IT. Impeccable service from the lemonade they offer while you wait to check-in to the assistance they offer in telling you where things are located..including the direction to your room. The suite we had was so beautiful and PERFECT...sparkling clean, luxury linens....this hotel is well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: flamarlin
Reviews.Content: Our family of four has stayed in this hotel several times. The Club floor is great, we eat most meals there. It is nice just to lounge in as well. The staff is helpful, the service is fantastic. If you want a luxury experience, this is your only chance in Orlando. Yes, the Grand Floridian is on Disney property, but it is a Holiday Inn dressed in fancy clothes

Reviews.Title: “Once again loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: bubba89
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my 3rd stay at the Ritz Orlando, and once again had a great stay though only 2 nights. I had absolutely no issues with my stay even though the hotel and the connected JW was full of conventioneers (which is the only thing I dislike about this Ritz property, hope it is not a trend with the Ritz. I adore the spa and the fitness center, 5 stars all the way. Enjoyed the Sunday Brunch as usual and tea in the Lobby Lounge. My stay was perfect and relaxing and the staff attentive to my needs, though I must say I am not a "demanding, needy guest", we come here to relax at the spa and sun by the pool and we did just that once again. Avoid the spa on Saturdays, way too busy to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: GBF44
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks in October, my third at this property. A number of problems mainly to do with staff. Like a previous correspondent there was nobody to welcome me on arrival at the hotel, I had to carry my bags into the lobby myself Even at check in the girl appeared oblivious to the fact that I was toting my own luggage and she didn't offer to show me to the room as in previous stays. Anyway I didn't want the Club room they had selected as it was too near the lifts, so I waited in the Club lounge for another offering. The rooms are still immaculate and cannot be faulted. My main complaint was the overcharging errors that appeared regularly on my account, four in total. All I got from the clerk was "oh dear I will ensure that that is rectified is there anything else I can help you with" I eventually spoke to a supervisor who simply repeated the same sentence. These mistakes continued right up until my checkout. If you are going to pay a premium price then you expect 5 star service accross the board, this isn't happening at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “A Marriott covered with marble”
Reviews.Author: Roskolnikov
Reviews.Content: Attended a research meeting at the Ritz, which is connected to a JW Marriott, a hotel I have also stayed at. Having experienced both hotels, it is evident that the Ritz is the same hotel, with some extra marble and wood scrollwork slapped on. My room was no larger or better appointed than a standard 3-star hotel room; the hallways were ordinary business hotel decor; the common areas were no more than conduits to the bars and restaurants. The swimming pool was adequate only for a hotel half of the Ritz's size, and was distinctly inferior to the Marriott's. Service was excellent from the registration and concierge staff, but the valet parking (and there is no other kind!) was like molasses in January. Bring a winter jacket if you're going to the meeting rooms; you'll be glad you did. Only bright side was that I didn't have to pay the 5-star rates for this jumped-up 3-star hotel--the meeting sponsor did. If you are going to Grande Lakes, save your money and stay at the JW Marriott

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: D-Critique
Reviews.Content: I am quite surprised by the number of raving reviews for this hotel. I stayed at the Ritz from Sept. 29-Oct. 1 for a conference and I was far from impressed. I arrived in a taxi and was greeted by the bellhop (so far so good) but then he disappeared before I got out the car. He did not ask to take my bag or if I need help. I get to the hotel doors expecting the bellhop to open them (like any other upscale hotel) or to have the doors swing open automatically (like any 3 star hotel), again nothing. I had to open the doors myself with my bags and then proceed to the wrong desk for check in. I know this may seem petty, but if you pay for the Ritz you expect the Ritz not the Red Roof Inn. Once I was pointed in the right direction, I checked in and this was a pleasant process. I get to the room and again nothing special. The rooms where fairly small for an upscale hotel. The amenities were great but the room itself was the size of a normal 3 star hotel. The biggest disappointment was the service; it was terrible. The first night we ate at the hotel's steak restaurant and waited at least 1 hour for them to bring the food after we ordered. Then the busboy began picking up my food before I even finished. The waiter did not come around to ask if everything was okay. It was also nearly impossible to get service at tables in the bar area. We had to get up and get drinks at the bar twice although there were waitresses. Unfortunately the staff has no sense of urgency about serving guest or trying to please guests. The service is comparable to that of a Caribbean Island. I also played golf on their course and it was okay. The course was not worth the amount they charged. I have stayed at plenty of 5 star hotels and this clearly is not one. I would say it is 4 stars. If the hotel significantly improves its service it has potential.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: spanielmom
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 year old son and I stayed at the Ritz last year, in early December. We loved the Ritz. It's hard to imagine staying anywhere else. First, we were able to stay at the club level because my husband had accumulated points through his business purchases. When we arrived at check in, someone was there to offer us cider and towels to wipe our hands. It was just great, as we had just come from the airport, it was late at night and we were tired. Then, when we got up to our club level room, we were very courteously shown the amenities and the concierges offered us milk and cookies. The club level was fabulous--a quiet place to rest, with 5 different food presentations every day. The only downside to the club level is that I don't know if there are suites. We stayed in a standard size room which was tough with a 2 year old. A little more space would have been great. After 3 days we were moved to a suite of rooms off of the club floors (we had been unable to book 7 straight days at the club level) and we actually liked the regular suite of rooms better. The bathrooms were gorgeous. Room service--excellent. Housekeeping--excellent. Spa--don't miss it. Hospitality--the best. The club level food was delicious. The club level is great if you enjoy wine/cocktails, etc. I was pregnant at the time and my husband doesn't drink so it was a bit wasted on us. And I did feel a little uneasy bringing our 2 year old in there, even though he is well behaved. I think the club level is better if you have older kids. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays. Every night there was a storytime with Santa for the little kids. And every day there were cooks working on a huge gingerbread house with wonderful desserts for the hotel patrons to try. The spa services were UNBELIEVABLE. The best spa I have ever visited. I think there is a massage therapist named Amy--fabulous. The private pool area for spa guests was so beautiful, I didn't want to leave it. I could ahve stayed at the spa all day. I thought the regular RC pool was terrific too. A wonderful toddler pool area for little kids. Even a playground area. The lazy river pool at the marriot next door is so much fun. A couple of problems: the second night we were there, our bathroom became soaked with a leak from the ceiling and we had to be moved at 8 at night. However, we did not get any kind of apology or reimbursement for this until we asked a few days later. Second, we never got vouchers for our breakfast meals even though they were included in the price of our room. I had to ask for those. Also, a package was delivered to our room (wasn't ours) and we had to ask someone to return it. Having said all that, of course these mistakes can happen at any hotel. My only complaint is that no apology or compensation was offered until we asked for one. But I do recommend this hotel. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “must be the best in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ang&tom
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Ritz Carlton for a few days before moving into a house for our holiday. Having stayed in a number of Orlando hotels over the years, none have come close to the Ritz. What fantastic luxury and comfort. Our room was near the top of the hotel, looking over the pool, with fantastic views over the lake to Sea World. The bed was as comfortable as any we've had and the bathroom the last word in luxury. The staff were all superb as well, with nothing too much trouble. Yes some things were pricey, but that is the nature of this class of hotel. The valet parking team were excellent, ensuring car was delivered efficiently, with air con cooling the inside and bottles of water supplied for the journey. Food was all well prepared and presented. In all, the best place to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN FLORIDA”
Reviews.Author: sminty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz for our 10th wedding anniversary and we could'nt have picked a better hotel. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite, which was trully WONDERFUL. We found all the staff excellent, this includes all the outside staff ie: Pool and outside workers. The Pool and outside areas were lovely, you could always find a quiet place to sit and relax. The Golf is an experience in itself. From the time you walk into the clubhouse you are treated like Tiger Woods. The course itself is challenging with all holes with either water or sand, or in most cases both. You have your own caddie, who gives you all the advise you need [ like a professional]. We would recommend this hotel to everyone and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz - Average? It's true.....”
Reviews.Author: BlondeAndBlue
Reviews.Content: I was an attendee at the same conference as the August 26, 2006 poster. My room shared the same orientation as the prior author - very nice overlooking the pool and golf course. Decore of room was nice but nothing in my opinion to say, "Wow, this is really pretty and different!". Bed was indeed very comfortable. I always review TripAdvisor prior to heading to a new location and found *one* review that noted oddly - paper thin walls. I brushed it off as over sensitivity. My experience was significantly disappointing for my very first stay at a Ritz. To give readers an idea of where I'm coming from, I've stayed at some of the finest hotels in the world along with my fair share of middle of the road "suite style" locations - finding tremendous value and enjoyment at *both*. My core standards might be on the high side compared to the majority of people, but I also appreciation for those suite style/extended stay locations because they are clean - comfortable - and QUIET, all for a very very reasonable price. On the flip side, I've stayed in hotels at $700+ a night to have a bathroom with window overlooking the city. And been happy to pay every dime. (I am a woman for whatever it's worth.) So back to thin walls. My first night there prior to a week long conference, my next door neighbors were two young women who rolled into the room about 12:30 a.m. and I was shocked to discover I could hear their conversation VERBATIM. Simply sitting in my room. I could hear the clanking of a darn water glass on the glass shelf in their bathroom. And yes, I could hear activities from the water closet as well. Thank heavens those nice women checked out and a new quiet conference attendee checked in the next night and from that point on I had no issue with noise - other than I did hear him snoring my last night of the week long stay. This was a major disappointment to me in that I've stayed at motor inns with thicker walls than this. I am due to return to the area for the same conference at the same time next year and I'll reserve a room at the Marriott. The price difference in no way warranted a return trip to the Ritz. However, with regard to the spa - BEAUTIFUL. I had two treatments and I can see why this spa has been voted number one in the country. Lovely little grill/restaurant, very impressive gym, treatments and staff - all TOP NOTCH. Truth be told the spa alone is worth a visit to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrea.italian
Reviews.Content: Back to the RC after my first visit two years ago. And I did celebrate my birthday this August at the Ritz Carlton in Orlando .. The hotel is absolutely beatiful , all the people working at the RC Orlando is extremely professional and I did enjoy everything. The rooms are not very large but very comfortable- We had a nice room facing the lake and the golf course with a beatiful view ( and in the evening the fireworks at Disney..) The main swimming pool is very nice , the Spa wonderful , the Golf Course a must place where to play a wonderful round of place or just spend some time at the range. I have to say that in my experience is the best RC for service and personal details ; this resort is extremely recommended and is the best Ritz in Florida.. I have been few days later to the Ritz in Naples and It was a big disappointment.. Chapeau !! A personal note : the Veranda Restaurant is too cold and we did enjoy much better to have he breakfast in the patio outdside than to stay in the chilly dining room..

Reviews.Title: “Sheer luxury...”
Reviews.Author: Micky112
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a few days at the Ritz. My husband was attending a conference there, and I joined him for a few days, (along with our two kids, 5 & 3 years old). From the minute we pulled up, the service was fantastic. Sure, you get what you pay for - as others have said, valet parking is required and is $15/night, plus you have to tip them every time you come and go, which can get expensive. But I'm assuming the guests that stay at a property like this on a regular basis wouldn't bat an eye at that, or at the high cost of everything here. : ) After all, it is the Ritz!! So if you come with that expectation, you truly do get the service you pay for...for example, when we left, the valet gave us four bottles of ice cold water as we departed. Loved that, especially in the Florida heat! Property - lovely. Hotel is right next to the Marriott. My son loved all the tiny lizards running across our path as we walked throughout the property (be warned if you don't like skittering reptiles - ha-ha!) Room - gorgeous. The decor was upscale, calming and beautiful...without being too over the top. Our room overlooked the fountain, the pool, a lake and a hole on the golf course - wow. Sitting on the balcony was heaven, listening to the tinkling fountain. A few downers - there wasn't a fridge...the shower, although beautiful, was a bit cramped for leg shaving, etc. But the bathtub is large, so I guess that makes up for it. Bathroom is awesome, lots of marble, with separate room for toilet. The Bulgari bath products smell divine. King bed was SO comfortable, and we loved the chaise-like chair that sat by the sliding doors. Pool - beautiful, with huge dolphin statues all around spouting water into the water. We didn't use the Ritz pool b/c we had little ones - we went over the Marriott where there is a GREAT zero depth entry shallow pool that leads into a lazy river. As a parent, it's wonderful, b/c you can hang out in slightly deeper water (3 1/2 feet) while watching your kids in the shallows. My husband and I took the kids around the lazy river over and over. Although they charge for innertubes, lots of people left them behind (purposely) when they left the pool. A few times we were offered tubes from guests that were finished with them...we took the first couple up on their offer and just held onto the tubes for the rest of our stay. Food - We only had a few meals at "Quench", the poolside grill at the Marriott. Food was really tasty and large portions...but a bit pricey, especially for kids meals. We didn't get out of there for under $60 each time, and we all had burgers/sandwiches (my husband would have a beer as well). My husband said the food at the conference was superb, so I can assume the same goes if you are a guest. Amenties - Great little touches, like turndown service with classical music playing and chocolates when you get back to your room. If you ask, they also provide mini robes and slippers for your kids to use...our kids were a riot, slipping into their luxurious Ritz robes every time we got back from the pool. I have more pictures of them lounging in the room in their robes than I do of the property itself! Too funny. With two little ones in tow, I didn't get a chance to do the spa, but it looked amazing. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay once again”
Reviews.Author: fcrouch
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the RC Grande Lakes at least a half dozen times now and once again are thoroughly satisfied with our stay. We have always stayed on the club floor and think the extra cost is well worth the food and drink presented daily (this last trip, the Champagne was a Perrier Jouet product - $42 a bottle at my local liquor store - and no doubt we drank a couple of bottles between us over the course of 6 nights). It was about 20 minutes or so to get to the Disney properties - and then a few more minutes getting to whichever park you're intending to visit - which we didn't think bad and the hotel gave us good directions to avoid I-4. We planned out afternoon breaks from the park in time to get back to the hotel for lunch in the lounge. The hotel is also putting out Bulgari White Tea amenities now (at least that's what we had). We loved the old "spa fresh" amenities, but my wife likes the Bulgari even better. As usual, dining at Norman's was terrific, the Ritz Kids club took good care of our daughter on a couple of nights (and in the off season, which this is at this particular Ritz anyway, there are not always more than a couple of kids in the club, so the counselors go out of their way to entertain those that are attending). Special compliments to Bryan and Stephan and Adam in the Club Lounge. We also made use of the pool at the Marriott. The spa is terrific as well - special compliments to Susan in the Salon. It really is a terrific property - you're also not far from International Drive and Restaurant Row - but we only left when we had to.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MutliMill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night and from the moment we arrived, valet to departure the customer service was outstanding - the Ritz experience. Everyone was very nice and accommodating. I would definately stay again. We stayed at Norman's which was pleasing to the eye and stomach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bed and the Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gfarmer668
Reviews.Content: My hubbie and I stayed for 3 nights at the end of July. The place is beautiful. The pool and its fountains are lovely. The breakfast buffet had lots of fresh rasberries and blue berries and all the trimmings. The breakfast servers and hostess were so very nice. The bed has down comforter and mattress- you just never wanted to get up. Our room over looked the golf course, city lights and even Sea World fireworks. I even tried the spa which was so relaxing with the flowing curtains and soft music. We went to the neighboring sister hotel and used their wonderful Lazy River through the green fun jungle of flowers. I wish the floats had been free for all. Golf was great but in the Florida August heat, the pools are better.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay in Oralndo”
Reviews.Author: josiegrammer
Reviews.Content: I also stayed at this property in late June/early July and had a much better experience than the other reviewer from my hometown. I stayed with my 5 year old and 3 year old and have very few complaints. I can't comment on the breakfast in the restaurant since we never had breakfast on the property but lunch in the restaurant by the pool was always great. And we were always provided with children's menu's, crayons, and other kid toys. Plus they had a lot of great healthy options for the kids. And my food was always delicious. We ate in the Vineyard Grill one night and it was also very good although a bit fancy for the kids. The pool was great. Rafts available for everyone who wanted one and plenty of umbrellas so you could easily be in the shade if you wanted. The JW Marriott was a 5 minute walk and that pool seemed to have more families and 20-somethings and a more party like atmosphere. It seemed like lots of Ritz families visited that pool but I did not get the impression that many Marriott people were over at the Ritz. Our rooms were very nice - overlooking the golf course and lake. We had a few issues with a clogged tub and one shower with low water pressure, but overall I do not have any complaints about the rooms. Also house keeping came twice daily and I don't recall them being late. Spa was georgous. My daughter spent a short time in Ritz Kids. The facilites seemed nice and the people working it were super friendly. One thing is that even though it is not far from Disney it took us one hour to get from the hotel to the Magic Kingdom (meaning inside the park). It just takes a while to get in, park, tram, monorail, etc. so keep that in mind if you plan on going there.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, A Luxurious Stay”
Reviews.Author: roxannex
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Ritz with my husband, my mother and my infant. Overall, we really enjoyed our trip, although there were some things that made our stay a little less than perfect. We really liked the chilled towels and lemonade at check-in. Those were great touches. The rooms were gorgeous. We had a suite and an adjoining room. They were lovely. The comforters were divine and cushy. We had a crib waiting for us. It was clean and made up with teddy bears sheet and a bumper. We also received a little baby care gift pack. The property itself is also lovely. The grounds are so well manicured! It was a treat just walking around. The staff was very nice and attentive. Everyone was very friendly. Housekeeping was a bit spotty, but we were in our rooms a lot, so it didn't bother us. The Ritz pool is just okay. There is no shade and some people hogged all the pool rafts, which was annoying. The Marriott pool was awesome! We loved the lazy river. But it was a bit of walk to the Marriott pool. I would definitely recommend spending more time at the Marriott pool than the Ritz pool (although the Ritz pool chairs are padded and have canopies over them). The fitness center was really nice. Each piece of equipment has its own personal tv and a bottle of water and towel is laid out for you. Now the down sides... For a luxury resort, we found it very odd that there was no complimentary coffee. There is a Peet's cart in the lobby in the morning, but it was crowded and took a long time to get coffee. The rooms are expensive...no coffee? Cheap hotel rooms usually have coffee makers in them. It just felt a bit like we were being gouged. I know it's a small thing, but it just annoyed us. Valet parking. Honestly, I hate valet parking in general, so I know I'm biased. The cars are parked a two minute walk from the front door. It's Orlando...not NYC! There is no shortage of land. But okay...it's a luxury resort...but several times when we called down we still had to wait for our car when we arrived downstairs. If we have to pay for valet parking and then tip the attendant several times a day (whenever we took out the car), I think the least the hotel could do is make sure that service is quick. Food. I was really surprised. The food at both the Ritz and the Marriott was only decent to pretty bad. We did not eat at Norman's so I can't speak for that. But we ate at the pool restaurant, had room service and ate at the casual restaurant at the Marriott and the food was really ehhhh. I just expected that the food would be good. Plus, it's expensive. That would be fine if it was good, but expensive and bad.... We did enjoy our trip. I think if we returned we might stay at the Marriott instead because the pool was so much better. But it was luxurious!

Reviews.Title: “High Marks For the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: scooby19
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Ritz in Orlando. The experience at this property was exceptional. We arrived midday on a rainy Friday. Right from check in, we were made to feel like a VIP. The room was beautiful with a wonderful view of the golf course and pool area. Service in the lounge was wonderful -- they had a great afternoon tea. The food from room service was also really good. Great selection, delivered on time and wonderfully presented. I had alerted the hotel in advance of arriving that it was my sister's birthday. On check in day we discovered a card along with champagn and chocolate dipped strawberries to wish her a happy birthday. A very appreciated touch! They always have town cars on the ready to wisk you away to Disney, Universal or any local attraction. Skip the cabs they cost just as much -- with less comfort! The spa was heaven and the Champagn brunch was equally devine. I would recommend this property for couples, a long weekend and families alike. There's plenty to do, a great pool and you are a short drive from all of the attractions without being in the middle of all of the Orlando chaos. This property is attached to the JW Marriott -- I have stayed there as well - it is a lovely property. However, the Ritz, surprisingly had much better rates! It was well worth it. This place really knows how to extend hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Food/Service not up to the Ritz Standard”
Reviews.Author: New Canaan Mom
Reviews.Content: My very pregnant wife, three-year old and I booked a week's vacation at the Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes through July 4th. After staying at several Ritz properties, we anticipated a luxurious experience with top notch food and service. In short, we returned early because of extreme heat, sub-par food and poor service. On the positive side, the property is magnificent, the location is perfect for escaping to the occasional tourist destination, George Butts played beautiful music in the lounge and the spa is exceptional. Spa treatment rooms, for example, feature tables that automatically adjust for the perfect massage. My wife said the pregnancy massage was the best one she ever had, and the nail services were also excellent. The relaxation areas were bare bones - no place to put your feet up, no current magazines and bare bones snacks (hot tea, flat water and a huge bowl with one apple). The breakfast buffet was what I would expect from the Embassy Suites. Omelette station feauturing plastic-tasting eggs, bagels, muffins and pastries that tasted "fake" for lack of a better word. FYI - there is basically one kitchen. Lunch and dinner tasted like chain restaurant fare, which is what we hoped to avoid by staying at a luxury property. Even the adjoining JW Marriott's restaurant, Primo, had almost the same menu items. The service at the Vineyard Grill was incredibly slow (lunch with a toddler took more than 80 minutes for basic menu items such as salads and burgers) - and the restaurant was never busy. Norman's is supposed to be excellent, but coats are required for dinner and we didn't want to leave our son with a babysitter. While they clearly intend to cater to families, the restaurants rarely provided silverware and a napkin for my three-year-old and we had to ask for crayons and a children's menu every time we dined on the property. Housekeeping is supposed to come twice daily, but on several occasions they had not arrived by 3:30pm in the afternoon when we were hoping to tuck in our son for a nap. The management gave the excuse that they had until 4pm to make up the room, and that this is a "leisure" resort. We rarely got turndown service, and waited an hour for an extra pillow. Guests with small children should know that their bed rails are not tall enough to extend beyond the mattresses. In fact, the person who brought the bed rail apologized and recommended pushing the bed against the wall for some protection. The concierge staff is polite, but not particularly well informed. I highly recommend calling the valet staff from your room so that you do not have to wait for your car. If you stay in the Summer, be sure to ask them to turn on the air conditioning. For some reason, the valets never thought to do this on their own. Children under five are not eligible for the Ritz Kids program. You can buy them a tube to ride on the Marriot's Lazy River for $5 or rent a bicycle for two at $50 for 30 minutes. Be prepared - there is no shade over the pool at the Ritz or the little playground. With some better management, this hotel could easily be elevated to the Ritz standard. We paid only $199 per night and it was not worth more.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most, but...”
Reviews.Author: fldave
Reviews.Content: I expected a little larger than average sized room( I stayed on the 14th floor, which is their club level). The hotel and grounds are kept impeccable. Room service was very( though the lobster bisque was beginning to smell "funny" ) quick. The Terrace Grill Restaurant was great. My daughter and I split the cold seafood platter which was loaded with lobster, oysters, tuna tar tar and some shrimp that were larger than most restaurant's lobsters!!! Service was good except my daughter had to ask twice for clarified butter for her lobster! This Ritz was just given four stars by the Michelin guide and I'd have to concur with their assessment.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Plus”
Reviews.Author: herekitti
Reviews.Content: I stayed several nights for a convention and EVERYONE at this hotel was spot on!! I utilized every dept. and couldn't have been more impressed with the service. From Adrian's warm greeting and lemonade to the check out with Jenna, fantastic!!! Rooms were immaculate everyday (and turn down), superb housekeeping staff. Food incredible, steak, lobster, HUGE shrimp, chocolate cake and penne pasta to die for!! Kudos Executive Chef and staff. Bellman great with room drop, thanks John, Tripp and Daryll. Banquet dept. quick with last minute changes, thanks Yirel, Jennifer, Joanie and the entire team plus A/V. Great staff at the Fairways, thanks Abdul and those who helped with cigars. Concierge friendly and helpful with last minute suggestions do to rain and printing of signs for transportation. Business center great with fax's and messages. The valet's saved me in the heat with constant supply of RC water! Katie at the spa worked my people in last minute do to rain, thank you Katie! Room service quick and friendly. But the person who I thank the most is Robert Montgomery, Meeting and Special Events Manager, who's tireless dedication and professionalism go unmatched!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever - Stayed at the finest hotels around the world”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Concur with previous message. Just returned from four night stay with family. From the moment we checked in we were treated like VIPs right through check-out. Stayed on club level (staff and food/drink more thank expected/decor outstanding). Ritz pool is great (kids also enjoyed lazy river next door at JW Mariott.) Food at Bleu restaurant at pool side is above average. The spa and fitness center is the best my wife and I have experienced at a resort (five star). We ate at the club level throughout the day (morning breakfast through evening deserts) but had diner at recommended favorite restaurants (Charlies, Moon Fish, Emeril's reaturant at Royal Pacific hotel, Abice at Portofino Hotel). We played two nine hole rounds of golf at the Ritz. A caddie, cart and driving range are included as well as use of clubhouse locker room. Lunch at the clubhouse was very good. Having stayed at the Disney and Universal properties when the kids were younger, the Ritz offered us five star accomodations that you can't find anwhere else in Orlando. We look forward to returning to the Ritz. PS - Fly Jet Blue (Direct TV and lowest fares)

Reviews.Title: “I've had better stays...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ritz Carlton booked with Amex FHR amenities (free lunch, upgrade, and free breakfast). Had to specifically ask for paid for amenities at check-in, was not given upgrade, and received coupons two hours later. Room was mediocre on 5th floor facing parking lot (great view of valets running around). Never received maid service even though we were absent probably 12-15 hours of the day. Food- mediocre at best. My fiance ordered a coke and she discovered broken glass in it. Notified server who seemed irritated that we were complaining. No apology but we did get another coke. Also our floor smelled like wet dogs smell like. Not a pleasant stay in the least.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Orlando Property”
Reviews.Author: LadyDiDi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay at the beautiful Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes. Myself, my husband and 8 year old daughter went to Orlando for relaxation and just one day at Disney. The rest of the days were spent at the hotel pool. We travel often and stay at a Ritz Carlton property as much as possible. This one did have some flaws, but there was no mistaking that you were staying at a Ritz. POOL - Beautiful pool area with truly wonderful cushioned pool chairs. The pool temp was on the warm side - just right for us. The pool got a little too croweded on Saturday and Sunday, but was fine on the weekends. It seems like there were some people from the adjoining JW Marriott using the Ritz pool, which is allowed. Although the pool area at the JW is stunnihg and includes a lazy river, the chairs are not cushioned. Service at the pool ranged from excellent to poor. Some of the things that we ordered never arrived or took forever. At different times there were staff floating about with cool towels and fresh fruit. Overall, it was the best part of our trip. FURNISHINGS - Superb decor! However, this was the least comfortable Ritz bed that I have ever slept in. HOUSEKEEPING - Not bad, but I would have liked to have seen the beautiful bed covers and pillows returned to the bed during the day, not rolled up and shoved in the corner. They should be taken off at turn down. VALET - We called for our car from the room and if we have to wait for our car, it was never more than a couple of minutes. OVERALL - The lobby is absolutely stunning and the grounds lovely. The staff was most often very accomodating, but we did incur a few who just didn't really care too much. It wouldn't take much improvement for me to move my rating to five stars. Yes, I would stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star with some issues”
Reviews.Author: OneTraveling
Reviews.Content: Just completed a weekend stay at the Ritz Grande Lakes. Overall, this was a great property - the best hotel in Orlando and in my opinion, one of the best of the Ritz Florida locations (no beach, so that takes away some). Here are my thoughts on this property in the following sections - Excellent, Good but not Great and Problems: Excellent ------------- + Nice sized rooms & bath with quality furnishings you would expect at an RC property. Hotel is about 3 years old, so everything still has a new feel. + Great pool, comfy chairs and OUTSTANDING pool service (ice cold hand towels to cool you down, samples of fruit and smoothies brought around periodically, wait staff constantly checking on you to see if you need food or drink, pool attendants were always willing to help set up chairs, move umbrellas, whatever you needed) + Overall look of the Grande Lake resorts is quite nice with beautiful grounds and pleasant golf course & lake views + Great food at Vineyard Grill & Bleu (poolside restaurant) + Location. 5 miles from Disney, 5 miles from Airport, 5 miles from Mall at Millenia shopping. Overall, a great location if you are there for R&R and Disney & other parks. Good But Not Great ------------------- o Spa was large, serving both the RC and JW properties. The service at the spa was not quite up to RC standards, but probably because they serve close to 1000 rooms when you count the JW, plus locals. The men's waiting area for treatments was not large enough for the number of treatment rooms. Spa service was "okay" o Service at Vineyard Grill was spotty. The breakfast buffet area is a bit small for the size of the dining room, which may be the reason they require you to wait 10 to 15 mins to be seated when the restaurant is half empty. Still it is annoying when you have other things to do. o Housekeeping. While they did a good job of cleaning the room for the most part, they often were not finished with cleaning until 5pm. That's way too late when you are wanting to get in from the pool to get ready for dinner, and the maid is still in the room cleaning. Found some issues that were reported, and corrected, but did cause some inconvenience. Problems ---------- - Valet Service is probably the worst I have experienced. It doesn't matter if you call 10 minutes ahead or if you walk up to get your car, it still takes a 10 to 15 minute wait once you arrive at the bell stand. They say it is due to construction to add to the conference center, but they need to correct this ASAP, as they require valet (who wants to self-park anyway) and charge a hefty fee, and this leaves an overall bad taste for the property when it is so inconvenient to leave the hotel for dinner, outings, etc. - Pool gets crowded, and there seems to be a number of JW guests using the RC pool. With 2 large hotels together, they need to make the RC pool exclusive to RC paying guests to allow for good availability of chairs and umbrellas. In summary, I think this property has the chance for a 5 star Mobil/AAA rating if they can iron out a few kinks. The service generally is outstanding (everyone notices and mentions the negatives unfortunately). I would not hesitate to recommend this property to friends or business associates. And I will stay here again upon return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break in Orlando at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: familyfour65
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The outside grounds and facilities are wonderful. The spa is incredible. We were treated like royalty there. However, like some previous reviewers, I did notice the housekeeping in the rooms could have been better. A couple of times the vanity countertop was not wiped down. Our kids got sand in the bathtub from the beach and it was not rinsed. We NEVER saw the quilts/mattelasse and pillows on the bed. They were always on the floor folded up, even after the early maid service. Sometimes, only one bottle of water was left and clean glasses were not put in the room. We ate breakfast everyday at the Vineyard Grill and the service was slow and not very good. Because we knew we would be returning each day, we felt compelled to tip well. There appeared to be several servers who only had a handful of tables each, but they were slow to return from wherever they were retreating to. Samantha seated us everyday and was quick to do so and very nice. There were mornings we had to wait for up to 10 minutes before a server showed up. There is only valet parking for $18+ per night. And, they do charge per night, not 24 hour period. I had always thought if one paid handsomely for valet parking, tipping was optional. These valets, although good, generaly seemed to wait for a tip each time, which can really add up. We stay at Ritz Carltons every chance we get. We've stayed at better ones. We would probably return when we go back to Orlando, in hopes they are able to improve in the areas they need to.

Reviews.Title: “A nice respite in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Ellense
Reviews.Content: Just returned from several days at this property. I had mixed feeling at this hotel. I usually come to Orlando to go to disney, but this trip we decided to try the other attractions including Sea world. This property is an interestging concept. Two hotels, a JW Marriott and a Ritz Carlton comprise a large shared property incluing gym, two pool areas, spa and golf course. The Ritz is much smaller and intimate with better service The JW a large convention hotel. The two properties connect via their convention area. The walk from one to the other is about 7 minutes. The rooms were what you would expect at a Ritz, nice bedding, big bathrooms. But no coffee makers(a surprise at a luxury property) and coffee in the lobby was not complimentary. Rooms were average size with a terrace. Service at the Ritz was spotty, house keeping issues needed to be requested several times( a fridge I requested prior to check in needed to be requested 3 times). The concierge was fine(there are 7 restaurants on property and they did not have the menus for them). All other reservations I requested were accommodated. The pool at the ritz was what you would expect. The pool at the Marriot is spectacular, a long lazy river pool). Service at our meals at the JW were mediocre at best with long lags at dinner, courses forgotten. Although the breakfast buffet there was better than the Ritz. Service for meals at the Ritz was consistently good. All in all, if I were to return to Orlando to visit Disney, I do not feel the ritz offers any benefit over staying on property at Disney. I may consider it if I returned to Orlando for other reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: Homergirl
Reviews.Content: Husband and I went for a short 3 day 2 night stay at Ritz, Orlando. Here are my comments: Driving in was beautiful, everything immaculate and in order. Beautiful landscaping and cobblestone drive. It must take a small army to keep this up. Valet promptly took our car and offered to help with our bags, we only had one so we declined. Check in was very busy. I felt as if I were in a theme park line- however, they quickly resolved this by adding new staff to check in guests and to offer fresh lemonade while you waited. There was staff there to make you comfortable and chatted with us while we were in line. Reception area very spacious and full of fresh flowers beautiful couches and marble floors. Very elegant and appealing. Upon check in, we were immediately upgraded to a suite (we went on the AMEX platinum card). For the record, I frequently use AMEX platinum travel services in hopes that we are upgraded (they guarantee an upgrade IF one is available). We also enjoy the late check out, complimentary breakfast every morning and lunch during our stay and early check in. We tipped the clerk generously and he showed us to our room. It was a suite on the second floor. As you walk in the room there was a half bath on the left and the hall opened up to a living room area and balcony. then there were double doors that opened to a bedroom (king bed) and a full bath with walk in shower and closet. It also had a patio off the bedroom. Furniture and bedding was up to Ritz standards. A few housekeeping issues that irked me. Bathroom toilet seat falling off, light bulbs needed replacing and, under bed, there was garbage and slippers from previous guests. The night stand also had sticky stuff on it that was never cleaned off. These are just minor observances and didn't bother us enough to say anything during our stay, we just told the clerk upon checkout to fix them for the next guest. Pool area- always enough chairs for everyone. It was cool during our visit, so I am sure that a lot of guests opted not to sit by the pool. However, we found it delightful and always found a perfect chaise in the sun to relax on. The pool was warm and inviting however there was no “deep end” so you could walk from one end to the other. When you got chilly, the hot tub was delightful. Dining was nice as well. We were casual for our trip so we generally ate at the poolside bar Bleu and the Vineyard Grill (casual restaurant inside) and room service for dinner. Food was nice and presentation was good. The drinks poolside were very expensive ($12 for a frozen drink- but hey it’s the Ritz). I have to say that the coffee that the Ritz served was the best coffee I have ever had. My husband and I asked several times for the brand name however, the staff didn’t seem to know. They sold Pete’s coffee in the gift shop, so perhaps it was Pete’s? Tap water was sulfur and that rang true with the shower and bath, but in Florida, sulfur water is commonplace. It wasn’t too overwhelming. Just a hint of it. Spa- The two times I visited the spa, they seemed very understaffed. The line to check in or inquire about a service was always at least 5 deep (perhaps it was a fluke). Went browsing the spa gift shop to see if the line would dissipate, and found that the spa shop needed some attention. Clothing falling off hangers, and general tidiness issues. Needless to say when I finally got my turn at the desk (I also bought some spa gifts) I inquired about a service for the next day and the gentleman handed me a brochure and told me to call later- I felt as if he wanted to push me aside and say "next"- needless to say I didn't call back.
