We walked around the JW Marriott (which adjoins the property) to check it out-and we were glad that we decided on the Ritz. Even though Marriott now owns Ritz Carlton, we thought that there was a substantial difference in staff and atmosphere between the two hotels. Staff- this was the only thing that made me give 4 stars instead of 5. Staff was spotty. Some excellent. Namely, Amanda at the vineyard grill who went out of her way to purchase me some aloe vera gel with her own money to sooth my sunburn, Jared at the pool bar who was very kind and attentive and everyone at the front desk, who were a great "front" for the Ritz and were completely professional at all times. However, there was plenty of staff who were aloof. For example we were at the lounge bar one late afternoon for a cocktail and were waited on promptly. However, as we sat with empty glasses for over 10 minutes, we kept glancing over at the bar, and there were at least 5 young staff members standing around chatting about something and completely ignored us. We had to get up to get the bill, and when I got the bill, I felt as if I were interrupting their conversation. We did not go back to the lounge bar and thought that the service was completely out of line for Ritz. Also, at lunch one afternoon (granted I believe we came in late) we were not even done with our lunches and the waitress dropped off the bill to us saying “I am going to leave this here for your convenience – in case you have to go to afternoon tea or somewhere in a hurry"….never offered us coffee or dessert-. Not very professional. Overall- this place is HUGE, and I would imagine one of the largest Ritz out there. It must be very difficult to staff and maintain that many rooms and public spaces. We LOVE Ritz-Carlton’s and generally travel to places were we can stay at one. However, I would say that this Ritz just didn't live up to the "cozy" feeling you generally get such as the Ritz at Central Park, San Francisco, St Thomas, or other cities. It felt very different. Perhaps it was that they obviously catered to large groups and corporate meetings? were not sure. I think we would travel here again if we were coming to Orlando, maybe during an off peak time. I think they are doing a fine job considering the size of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the 1 Bedroom Suite”
Reviews.Author: FLarchitect
Reviews.Content: We normally would not pay for a one bedroom suite, but we won this in an auction and we LOVED our room. It was spacious, elegant and gorgeous. The food is really expensive, but very nice. We took my daughter and mom for tea and they LOVED it. All in all, I probably would not pay $650 a night for a room, but I have to say that it was well worth it. To the person who paid $519 per night for a smaller hotel regular room, they probably should have checked online, because the smaller hotel room goes for around $200-250 a night. I am trying to upload some photos but haven't been able to yet. Make sure if you have young children to advise the hotel staff so that the windows are locked on the higher floors. I have found several windows unlocked with no screens in several luxury hotels and any child could fall.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Grande Lakes...Awesome for Families”
Reviews.Author: KimJacksonville
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 children ages 2,5 and 8. This place was fantastic. We travel a lot and like to stay at Ritz Carlton's whenever possible. This was top of the line. My children were treated with respect and pampered as such. The only complaint we had was the unhelpfulness of the concierge. She was always busy and never had any sense of urgency when helping you out. We ordered in room service one evening and it was superb. They also had a "guest registry" when checking in that my kids thought was way cool. I stayed there again 3 weeks later on business and again, concierge service was about the same, but otherwise, terrific service. I tried out the club level this time and it was really worth the extra money. I have stayed at several club level rooms in the Ritz chain since then and none of them compare to Grande Lakes. I also had the opportunity to try the spa. Fantastic!!! I can't wait for a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous-oooooH!”
Reviews.Author: LovesCT
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting to stay here at all as I usually stay at Marriott's or Hilton's. However I was drawn to the spa here, thank goodness. What a wonderful spa experience I had. I actually faded away during a pedicure, really! Yes, the spa is pricey, but no more so than any other really good spas, although this was top-knotch. The spa at the Marriott is really great too. Dinner at the Ritz restaurant was delectible, divine, so was the service, and I was dining alone!! I never felt uncomfortable at all. I found people all over the resort to be quite kind and attentive. I even packed up my own sandwich one day bringing it with me to the pool (discretely) and sat out on the green grass by the little lake to enjoy the birds. It was a very nice quiet time. I actually got a kick out of the Convention people and wandered through some of them, bought a book at one. I have also stayed at The Ritz in Atlanta, The Concierge level was out of this world. The workers there deserved every 20 per cent tip , or more, that I gave them. I hope to stay at more Ritz Hotel's in the future and will definitely go back to this one...asap. CT

Reviews.Title: “Cannot believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: fionadavid91
Reviews.Content: Quite surprised by the rave reviews given to this hotel.Our family stayed here in October and found that while it was ok it was not as good as some Florida hotels we have stayed in. There was no personal touch, receptionists were busy and hassled most of the time and on occasions quite unhelpful, food was good but not 5 star and we were disappointed. Much preferred Homewood on I drive.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class All The Way!”
Reviews.Author: kpcloud9
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is 1st class all the way! The service is unbeatable! The way a guest SHOULD be treated. The decor is outstanding with fine art like Chihuly showcased. The beds are so comfortable... My experiences with the Ritz have always been positive and the Orlando Ritz & Marriot are right on target!

Reviews.Title: “Overall definitely a 5* experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went back to the Hotel for the 2nd year running. We don't have any kids, so specified a quiet room. We were unfortunately put in a room with interconnecting doors. Once we had unpacked we heard next door arrive home and kids were screaming and trying to get into our room! We had to move rooms 4 times before the Hotel eventually found us a "quiet room" They seem to prioritise familys more than couples so be warned if you don't have kids. We have found that if you pay extra to stay in a 5* hotel, when you experience problems like this, the staff will do something to rectify it. Once we resolved the noisy rooms, we were looked after well apart from the member of staff who had to organise moving us into different rooms, she just blanked us every time we walked past! Other than this the Hotel wsas fantastic, the staff were very courteous, the room was well maintained and the valet parking absolutely brilliant. Will go back again this year for the 3rd time, but will make sure before we arrive that they sort out a good room for us. Did not really eat in the hotel as there are so many restaurants to visit in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: cuarenty
Reviews.Content: I have no idea where the person from the review below mine stayed...I'm sure it was not this Ritz-Carlton. This is the very best hotel in Orlando...possibly the best Ritz-Carlton in Florida. We've stayed here 4 times over the last 3 years and we've never had a problem...staff is incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Big Price, Small and Average Room”
Reviews.Author: joy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in January to celebrate a "milestone" birthday. I have stayed at many RC's and love the Club Floor for its food service and amenities. This hotel was no exception--great service, superb food and wonderful view. However, the room itself was small and the furniture and bedding was not of the Ritz Carlton standard. The rug was soiled and the room very dusty and daily housekeeping lacking in quality. The bathrooms are large and well-appointed. I paid $519 per night and was expecting much better than I received. In addition, I was billed for a bottle of expensive wine at check-out as someone had called the hotel to have it delivered to my room. I never imagined the hotel would take the word of an outside individual, send the wine to my room as a gift, then bill me for the item. After quite a fuss at checkout, they did remove the charge. There are much better Ritz Carlton's than this one. Save your money as you will not receive the level of service (except from the Club Lounge) you expect to receive from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us very special - Christmas trip”
Reviews.Author: Leigherton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Orlando, from December 23-26, 2005. It was an amazing experience......the Christmas Brunch on Christmas Day was amazing......there were all types of speciality items offered too.....candy making exhibits, caroling, music everywhere......the spa, we did not get a chance to use, was very beautiful... The staff was very good......the food was excellent and we will certainly be back....Personally, the Ritz Carlton in Amelia Island, could learn more about guest relations from the staff of the Ritz-Carlton, Orlando... Thank you for a special time.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Ritz property”
Reviews.Author: sassygtr
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Christmas holiday...the rooms and grounds are beautiful and spacious. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably one the best Spa's in the country”
Reviews.Author: Haiser
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW but used the Spa facility at the Ritz. It was incredible. Had a message from a german woman that was unbelieveable. Worth every penny. The pedicure and manicure were average though. I would stick to the body services and the wet areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but why?”
Reviews.Author: FlaHockeyFan
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel that seems brand new. Everyone goes out of their way to be helpful; I am not used to chambermaids offering greetings. I was there on a conference, otherwise I would have chosen another Orlando hotel. It is an elegant hotel adjoining a JW Marriott each with ample convention space. Our group was rescheduled from New Orleans. Instead of walking around a historic city, here we were "stranded." There is mandatory $15/nt valet parking fee. There is nothing nearby, one is fairly well restricted to the resort. If you are not travelling with children (why are in Orlando?) and you do not want to see any, this is your place. My only gripe is the absence of a gift shop that offers diet coke. If you take your caffeine cold, you have to either settle for the micro bottle in the mini bar or walk 15 minutes to the JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: DeedraF
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and my 7 year old daughter just returned for a 4 night stay. From the moment we checked in I knew everything was going to be just perfect. There was a seperate "check-in" for my daughter in which she was given a bracelet that entitled her to free ice cream at any of the hotels restraunts. Our room was immaculate with twice daily maid service. I spent two wonderful days at the spa and the spa pool while my daughter enjoyed every moment she could at the Ritz Kidz club. She was treated like a princess and loved every minute of it! The fitness center had practically everything my gym at home does so my daily workouts went uninteruppeted. The food was delicious and room service was fast and accurate. The time my daughter and I spent at the main pool was great too. We had lunch there and drinks and the service was excellent as well. It was a quick car ride to the Magic Kingdom and Universal Studios and right down the block from Sea World. The only problem was that we had to leave! :(

Reviews.Title: “A must stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a Florida vacation and the absolute best part was our stay at the Ritz Grande Lakes. We spent three days there and had no desire to leave the property. It's beautiful, the service was excellent and being connected to the JW Marriott offered even more options. In true Ritz Carlton style the entire staff always went the extra mile to make all guests feel special. We used rewards points for the stay at the Ritz and it was a wonderful reward for our loyalty to the Marriott brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a vacation at the Ritz Carlton Orlando at the last minute because the damage from Hurricane Wilma meant we couldn't go to our original destination- Miami. I have to say the hotel is excellent- the service, food, pool area, location, room etc. but we were disappointed that despite paying last minute top price for the room and the hotel being half empty most of the time and us being there for 11 nights, we weren't given anything more than a standard room and a standard view. Also, I think it is unfair to charge $15.98 per night for valet parking without an option for self parking- some people would like the choice even if it means a shortish walk. However, this is a great hotel and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “wow. amazing. and a bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i usually stay in hiltons, sheratons etc... for business. this was for plaesure, and it blew me away. the level of service is so far beyond the rest, it will be hard to go back to the 3 and 4 star places. champage on arrival, a personal escort to our huge room, beautiful views (we were complimentarily upgraded), a pool area so serenetthat we stayed for hours. PERFECT for a romantic getaway. and on top of it - it wasn't even expensive. $199 for the room. drinks and nibbles at the pool are totally reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and splurge to stay at Ritz Carlton! It was the best hotel I have stayed at. Not only was the staff wonderful and very accomodating, but the hotel was immaculate. Ofcourse it was pricey, but my husband and I needed the getaway. We never left the hotel because everything we needed was right there. The pools were awesome, drinks were great, and the room was beautiful. The best part of the hotel was the bathroom! Make sure you take all the toiletries that they leave for you. They are top of the line spa products that smell wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautiful, staff was great..........we put our kid in kids club and he loved it........had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel! Heavenly spa! Wonderful Ritz Kids!”
Reviews.Author: ritzlover
Reviews.Content: My son, daughter and I joined my husband at the Ritz for 2 nights before we headed to Disney. My husband was there for a conference, so we were pretty much on our own. The room was lovely and very clean. We tried to upgrade to Club Level, where we always stay in other Ritz locations, but were unable to because we were part of the conference and had discounted room rates. We had room service 3 times during our stay and it was always fabulous and right on time. I dined with the children in the Lobby Lounge which was wonderful. They gave the children coloring books, special bending sticks you could make into bracelets, shapes, etc. The weather was awful, but the children and I braved it and went over to the attached JW Marriott pool to try the lazy river. That pool was heated and there was a nice kids playground over there and a really fun life size chess game as well as a mini soccer field. My complaint about the lazy river is that you have to buy the floats for $5 each. They are huge, and you have to lug them back and forth to your room! I think if they are going to charge you, why not let you pay $5 to rent them for the duration of your stay and then leave them at the pool? Due to the weather, the outdoor dining option at the Ritz was closed, but the bar was open at the JW pool. I ordered 2 Cokes for my children and the bartender snapped, "They are $3 each, you know"......which I found both odd and rude. Service at the Ritz is FAR superior. I sent the kids to Ritz Kids for 2 hours so I could go to the Spa. The Spa is GORGEOUS.....so clean, inviting, relaxing. I had some sort of Lime Body and Scalp Massage. HEAVEN! My kids loved the Ritz Kids.....it's a clean, fun place where they did Sand Art, crafts, a water balloon toss, etc. Stay here and you will LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: “If You Can Afford It Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for 2 nights with my Mother and Father. We stayed in the upper club level room with a pool view. When we arrived we were greeted with cold towels and glasses of fresh lemonade. The room was a resonable size with a large bathroom. The pool was very clean and well set out. Everything we asked for we were given. The club room had a range of servings including afternoon tea. This hotel is very nice and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Will Go Back”
Reviews.Author: CJayEE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz with my wife at the beginning of August, as part of our honeymoon. The first leg was in Aruba, where we stayed at the Hyatt Regency. I wish that we spent more than four of our days at the Ritz. It was that good. I strongly recommend this hotel--despite going in the heat of the summer--because the rooms, service and grounds were that stellar. Yes, it was that good! One more thing, the hotel has a spa which guests use (at least the gym portion) free. It was so nice to wake up to a great work out in an upscale environment each day. Also, the food at the restaurant on site was terrific. A great breakfast buffet--you will eat it at some point if you go. My wife and I both agree that we will be back again, perhaps instead of going to the Breakers. This hotel is "a must-go" in my book, if just to relax and get some sun and work out at the spa.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the start this was one of the best experiences at a hotel I have ever had and I travel a lot and am high maintenance or so I am told by my husband. My room was not ready when I arrived so I was upgraded to club level. The lobby lounge staff is amazing. Justin at the pool was so attentive and accommodating and the staff in general go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable. The club level is excellent with movie and CD rentals. I'd enjoyed the Metropolitan cocktail they made for me in the lobby lounge and when I asked for it on the club level, they went to get the ingredients so that they could duplicate it there. Even though there was a huge conference going on, it was still a very relaxing and calm environment. The beds so comfy. The pillows like clouds, and the service is truly ummatched. I am now a client of the Ritz for life.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: admem
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Ritz for a second time in a little over a year. We stayed on the Club Level which was great for us, having 2 children (3 yr and 1yr) the club level provided kid friendly a breakfasts and lunch, and the cocktails and cordials were very nice to the parents. We received a basket of goodies when we arrived that plenty of snack so that we did not even thinking of opening the mini bar. Even though it does cost more to be on the club level, it is worth it if you will be taking advantage of services. The grounds for the property are magnificant. My only minor complaints are that the Ritz lacks causual dining options. We would often return to the hotel in the evening and the only dining options more formal than we would have liked. My second complaint is that the pool is so much better at the Marriott. It is more relaxing, plenty of sun and shade. But the plus is that's a short walk and you can still charge to your room at the ritz. Also the children's pool and playground area is great. Ny children would have loved to have stayed and played there longer.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: ladywesson
Reviews.Content: After looking at probably 20 hotels for our wedding (in Orlando, Tampa, Saint Petersburg and Clearwater), we found this gem right around the corner from where we live. The down-to-earth luxury of this place is amazing! It is absolutely gorgeous without being the least bit intimidating. The wedding planner (Emily) did an awesome job. The reception was at the Fairways pub, which was perfect for our relatively small wedding (40 people). The pastry chef created a delicious wedding cake (chocolate and fresh raspberries inside, real roses outside) and the dinner was just exceptionally good- we still have guests raving about the food that night. They run out of the French champagne we ordered (Perrier Jouet Brut), so they upgraded us to the even better one (Veuve Cliquot Vintage 1998) without additional charge. It was definitely the most wonderful day in our life. The wedding suite (complimentary!) was covered in rose petals, we had a picture of us in a silver frame sitting on the night stand and champagne and strawberries waiting for us. The housekeeping sent us an amazing bunch of lilies. The beds are wonderful - we slept soooo good!! And the products in the bathroom smell delicious and make silky-soft skin. They use them in the Spa, too. Oh, I almost forgot the Spa...! An oasis of tranquillity - my husband and I were sitting around in our bath robes, towels turbans on our heads and sipping green tea. The ultimate relaxing experience, believe me... The staff is extremely friendly and professional. We sometimes go there on a Saturday night to enjoy the delicious Martinis (try the Metropolitan) and the nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking problem”
Reviews.Author: ben01St_Louis
Reviews.Content: We almost had a great time at the Ritz Carlton hotel. The place was gorgeous and the view from the room terrific! The pool was great. But... There is no self-parking in this hotel and we had our car valet parked throughout our stay. when we retrieved our car, there were several scratches on the bumper side. As this was a rental car, we had to go through all the inconvenience of filling up reports and were told by the rental company we will be responsible for the damage that the valet staff caused....sigh...so much for our "great time at the Ritz... Also, we decided to splurge for our anniversary dinner at Norman's and at the suggestion of the waiter ordered the prix fixe dinner featuring Norman's new creations.... Very, very disappointed and not worth the $75-/person dishes offered. They were tiny and their "taste of the sea" seafood with boiullabaise sauce was not fresh and tasted yucky, we had to ask the waiter to change this to the conch bisque which was ok... The other 4 dishes were truly forgettable. I do not recommend this restaurant at all. Had fresher food and better service at Roy's a few days later.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can I start be saying that this has been the best Hotel that I have ever stayed in. The Ritz Carlton was the ideal location for my wife and I to spend are Honeymoon. We stayed for 14 nights and loved every minuite. We were gutted when we had to leave. When we arrived we were greated by the Valet and Hotel Staff who politely welcomed us to the hotel and had a are bags brought to are room. The Valet service ($15 per day) is a little expensive however the staff were excellent and were very willing to help out with directions and always greated us by name. The Hotel itself is truly beautiful as can be seen by the photos. As it was are Honeymoon the Hotel Staff kindly upgraded us to a lake view room which was huge. On entry into the room we discovered that the hotel had also provided a complimentary bottle of Champagne aswell as assorted chocolates with "Congratulations" written in chocolate on the plate. The bed was truly wonderful and was decorated with rose petals in a Heart shape. The turn down service everyevening is another welcome addition where the chamber maids turn down your bed clothes, provide fresh towels and fill up your ice bucket. The pool is also superb, however you can use the the Marriott pool aswell. All of the staff at the hotel were great and went out of their way to cater for all of your needs. The staff seemed to enjoy their jobs and appeared genuine in their manner. I feel that to get a true feel for the Hotel you should visit. Its great and we really enjoyed are Honeymoon and are stay at the Ritz Carlton. I think what makes the Ritz Carlton so good is its attention to detail. Everyting was excellently done and no short cuts were taken anywhere. The Hotel is around a 5 minuite drive from Sea World so may be deemed out of the way however with the facilities in the Hotel it is a welcomed change to be away from the i-drive - Theme Park mayhem. Thank you Heidi for making are trip one we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay & service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Ritz in Orlando and would definately return. The breakfast buffet with the omlets made to order were exceptional. We thought the prices we very fair here at $21. per person. We visited the bar in the lobby area and had a great bartender by the name of Ryan who was exceptional at his job with great customer service. By the time we checked out we felt we had made a friend in Ryan! ;o) The rooms were very comfortable with nice turn down service. The pool was an absolute delight with service everywhere. The "iced-towels" were some of our favorite splurges as a treat by the hotel. We actually loved the location, out of the way and not in all the rif-raf of the Disney traffic. This is one of our absolute favorite stays we have encountered. Even though this is the largest Ritz in the US, you would never know becasue the service did not fall off at all.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: azijack
Reviews.Content: great hotel. beautiful. about 20 min from disney world. the only problem is that food was not that good. we went to JW for breakfast which was much better. it is also ridiculous that they charge $15 for parking. service was very good. the pool is also great. the pool at JW is more fun. but, by staying at the ritz, you get to use both pools.

Reviews.Title: “Over-overrated!”
Reviews.Author: BarefootTom
Reviews.Content: This is a nice looking hotel, big, with marble and columns everywhere. But the staff actively grumbles about working conditions whenever supervisors aren't around and (and this drove us crazy), they played the same three songs over and over on the PA system -- for four days. The place is overrated and I was very disappointed with the service and the room, which looked out over...absolutely nothing. The only place you can walk to is the adjoining JW Marriott. Note to Marriott: Send the Ritz-Carlton staff over to the Naples, FL Ritz-Carlton to learn what service is all about. And please, no more "Love for Sale" (not appropriate for a hotel to be playing) and "Take 5" on the PA system!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: Beckyjc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Orlando over Memorial Day weekend and then stayed the following week. We had a total of 5 people in our room, with us and our 3 children. There was plenty of room, and the bathrooms were very nice. When I booked our room, it was for a garden-view, but when we checked in and went up to our room, I was very surprised to see that it was a lake-view room. It was a very beautiful view. Over Memorial Day, they had lots of things for the kids planned. They had face painting, and we let our kids do that a couple times over the weekend. They also had a movie by the pool night. Sunday night, they had fireworks and the display of them was outstanding. Everything was really nice there. The concierge, was very excellent and helped us if we needed directions to certain locations around Orlando. I even asked them for suggestions for great Italian food, and it was a very nice place that we ate and the food was great that they recommended to us. We ate breakfast at the Vineyard Grill. The breakfast buffets were outstanding! We went swimming a lot while we were there. Our kids loved going to the Lazy River pool at the JW Marriott, the flow of the current was great to relax and float on an innertube, or a noodle. The valet service was pretty poor at the beginning of our stay, we would call down and tell them that we needed our car in 15 minutes and then when we got downstairs to get our car, it would take another 15-20 minutes. It got better as the week went on, it might have been due to all the people that were there over the weekend for Memorial Day. There is very friendly people at the Ritz, and they know you by name when you come downstairs. I would recommend anyone to stay here, and I can see ourselves staying here again when we come to Florida! If you have any questions you can e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a conference hosted at the Ritz-Carlton. The place is classy, classy, classy. Yeah, it's out in the middle of nowhere and a cab ride to the local drug store two blocks away will cost you $15 bucks _minimum_ (but hey, it's Orlando, tourist trap central. Can you expect anything less??). But the rooms, ammenities, and service are outstanding. I've stayed in some nice hotels but this Ritz outclasses them _all_.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything you can expect from the ritz. Perfect place to relax and enjoy. Not worth it if you plan to spend a lot of time in the parks and less time in the hotel. The food in the hotel is great, but not much available close by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We ended up here after another hotel overbooked us. We ended up staying for 3 nights because this place was just wonderful. From the moment we walked in, the service was perfect! The room was gorgeous: fluffy beds, nice smell (wow!) and a big bathroom! Had a nice view of the pool area and lake. The room service was fast and fairly priced and quite yummy. We had a great time and wished we could've stayed longer. Thanks to the Ritz for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Gilly2222
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Orlando with our 2 small children for 5 days prior to staying with friends in a villa. After staying at the fantatic Ritz Carlton the villa was a complete let down and we missed it so much we even went back twice to spend the day at the hotel. It was the perfect combination of luxury for adults and being child friendly as well. We had a loevly dinner at Norman's without the children (even though we could have taken them with us if we had wanted). The food was top notch but what made it so memorable was the service the waiters were so friendly and helpful and were genuinely interested to hear whether we were having a good holiday. We dined with the children one evening in the Vineyard grill and they provided a huge box of toys for the children to play with while we were waiting for dinner. Fantastic! We had a suite with a cot and a roll up bed which was very spacious and the fabrics and furnishings were luxurious. The bathroom was exquisite all marble with a huge walk in shower. We were provided with bags of bath goodies for the children. The pool and surrounding areas were spacious with plenty of sunloungers. You never felt that you were on top of anyone.The odd special touches were great such as free swim nappies for the baby. The pool service staff were again very friendly and accomodating. We really rated this hotel I would go back to Orlando just to stay in this wondeful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando's Finest 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: orlandohelper
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the ultimate best hotel to stay at in Orlando, Florida you must stay at the Ritz Carlton Orlando Grande Lakes Resort. The Grande Lakes resort is absolutley spectacular, its beautiuful, spacious, luxurious, GRAND, and VERY unique, its the first time in the history of both Marriott and Ritz Carlton that both hotels are built on the same property. 2 of the most finest and luxurious hotel brands in the world on the same property. In fact, Grande Lakes is so unique that even our Florida Governor Jeb Bush was present at the grand opening in 2003. Theres so much at the Grande Lakes that I categorized it to make it easier for you to read through this review: THE 2 LOBBIES: Both hotels have absolutley beautifull lobbies, the second you walk into the lobby you can easily notice that you have walked into a luxurious 5 star hotel. At the entrance of the Ritz Carlton you find formally dressed bell-hops awaiting you with perfectly tailored uniforms, pearl white gloves, and very friendly smiles, if you chose you can also have a private classic Rolls Royce pick you up directly from the airport or wherever you are coming from in Orlando. Inside the lobbies you find shiny marbles floors, grand sparkling chandeliers, fine artwork, comfy high-quality furniture, and extra friendly and very formally dressed front desk clerks readily availiable to help you at the spacious shiny front desk counters. The Ritz Carlton lobby has the more classic Ritzy touch while the JW Marriott has a more contemporary formal touch with a tranquil central fountain and tall curved roofs and columns. DINING: When it comes to dining, the Grande Lakes resorts are home to some of the finest dining restaurants in Orlando. The 2 feature fine dining restaurants are Norman's at the Ritz Carlton Orlando and Primo at the JW Marriott Orlando. There are also many additional restaurants including the Vineyard Grill, Citron, Bleu, and others, there are also many fine bars and lounges. SPA: Grande Lakes is also home to the the Ritz Carlton Spa, the largest spa in Central Florida and also one of the very finest. It is definetly worth a full day experience. There are many varietys of treatments to chose from. The spa also has a private pool, cafe, and full-service health club and fitness center. GOLF: Grande Lakes is also home to beautiufull golfer's paradise, The Ritz Carlton Golf Club with the 18-hole Greg Norman Golf Course. There is also a golf academy if you dont know how to play golf or would like to improve your golfing skills. MEETINGS, CONVENTIONS, AND EVENT SPACE: Grande Lakes has over 134,300 square feet of flexible indoor space, including 39 total breakout rooms and an additional 117,000 square feet of outdoor space including a wedding gazebo, citrus garden, and lawn and terrace. The ballrooms, exhibit halls, and breakout rooms are all spectacular, great venues to have anything from large banquets, parties, and wedding receptions to business gatherings and conventions. POOLS: The pools are also spectacular, the JW Marriott has a giant and very fun pool including a tropical lazy river, waterfalls, and water slides. The Ritz Carlton has a more formal and adult-friendly pool. It goes on and on, there are many ameities that go on and on, the Grande Lakes has a wide variety of many vacation packages to chose from, I highly recommend this resort to all. I really recommend you checkout the website to book your reservation and also checkout the virtual tours, photo gallery, and much more helpfull information: ------

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Club Floor”
Reviews.Author: TM99
Reviews.Content: We are big Ritz Carlton fans and have stayed in almost all of the Florida properties but we hadn't tried this one, as I generally try to avoid Orlando. However, we recently stayed here for 1 night and what a revelation! The Club Floor was so good that I actually think I might make a trip back to Orlando just because of it! Firstly, the quality and variety of the food servings was superb and on a par with my benchmark Ritz at Naples. The staff were universally excellent and Stephen especially is worthy of mention. Also, I have never seen such fast and efficient clearing of tables as I witnessed in the Club Lounge - even more so when considering the number of children who were in there (not surprising, being in Orlando). The hotel is also very good generally and benefits from being new, so the bathrooms have separate baths and shower stalls for example and accommodation throughout is in good condition. The setting is attractive, overlooking the golf course with great views from the higher floors. Despite considerable grazing on the Club Floor we still managed a main course for dinner at the Vineyard Grill - it was OK, but nothing to write home about. We went back to the Club for dessert and watched the Disney fireworks - very enjoyable.

HotelInfo.Name: Ritz-Carlton Orlando Grande Lakes
HotelInfo.Address: 4012 Central Florida Parkway, Orlando, FL 32837
